Reviews.Title: “Good modest hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CJFergi
Reviews.Content: If you like to travel by trains, metro and buses while in Rome, this place might be for you. Very close and easily accesible to Termini. Rooms are clean but modest. Ask for a room away from the main floor in the front of the hotel as it gets quite noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: alex g
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and we were happy with the stay. The location is great within walking distance to most important sites. The service was exceptional. Rooms are cleaned and the breakfast had a good variety.

Reviews.Title: “Very Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: smrsarma
Reviews.Content: A house is made as a home by the people who live in it and like that a hotel is transformed as a home away from home by the staff it has. We stayed in Aberdeen from March 19th to March 27th 2012 and our stay become memorable mainly because of the front desk staff and the dining room staff. They always greeted with smile irrespective of the time of the day and have been patient with us regarding all our queries about sight seeing and directed us very well. The house keeping was also not lacking in keeping our room clean always. The breakfast was very good and the the elderly gentleman and his lady associate made sure everybody was fed nicely. I can not stay anything but except wonderful regarding our experience in the hotel and generally in Rome. and has already told my friends and children to select this hotel on their visit to Rome. Finally there are two persons I have to single out in the hotel. That is Mr. Costa and Mr. Mariano and both have been extreamly kind to me and my wife and looked after our welfare very well and would like to thank them through your portal

Reviews.Title: “What else”
Reviews.Author: Rosy G
Reviews.Content: I' m traveling in Europe and I find this hotel in a travel book guide and I want suggest this place. The position is convenient and nice. The service is good and the staff is friendly. Rooms are big enough and very cleaned. Breakfast is good even if there are no cold dishes, anyway you have to consider is a 3 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This the THE Place - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicenvanity
Reviews.Content: There is nothing's me and my wife don't like about this hotel especially my wife is the fussy queen. We stayed in a balcony room which took me and my wife by surprise, it was PERFECT! Hotel Aberdeen is CLEAN in a perfect and safe location. All the hotel staffs is FRIENDLY, thoughtful and helpful. Breakfast was decent but good. Walkable to main tourist attractions and to termini if you travelling to others city. Metro and taxi stand is right around the corner near the Piazza della Repubblica, it only took us 2-3 minutes to reach. I strongly recommend this hotel. Me and my wife would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Like Visiting Friends”
Reviews.Author: Curt G
Reviews.Content: This is the third year in a row that we have brought a group to Rome and stayed for a week at the Aberdeen. As always they were thoughtful, hospitable and responded to our every need. We initially chose the Aberdeen because of its close proximity to Termini and Repubblica. The central location provides easy access to most of the major attractions. We continue to choose the Aberdeen because of the gracious staff, wonderful breakfast and affordable accomodations. I appreciate the warm welcome we receive each time we arrive. Returning to the Aberdeen is like visiting friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveler28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Aberdeen for 4 nights in October 2011. Overall, I'd say our stay was very good. Our room had a double bed, a TV, and a private bathroom with a toilet and shower. The decor is somewhat outdated, but the hotel was a great value. The location was convenient, also, a 5 minute walk from the Republica metro stop, 10 minutes walk from Termini, and 15-20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. The breakfast (which was included in the price of our room) was also decent, and included pastries and croissants, yogurt, cold cuts and cheese, cereal, milk, fruit, coffee, and juice. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful when we had questions. We were also at the end of a hallway, so there was not much foot traffic near our room and it was nice and quiet for the most part. The only (small) downside was the WiFi is not throughout the hotel, but only in the computer lounge. We stayed in Room #18, which was just steps down the hall from the area, so we weren't bothered too much by it, but it is something to be aware about if you're planning to use your phone/laptop/etc from your hotel room. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, clean, inexpensive place to stay while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - helpful and friendly staff, good breakfasts provided, great location for access to almost of the city, comfortable accomodations! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “average rooms, quite noisy rubbish breakfast but pretty cheap”
Reviews.Author: rosiem333
Reviews.Content: the doors and walls were pretty much paper thin so you could hear other guests and the cleaners each and every morning, breakfast was a few staleish rolls and cheese/ham or cereal so a bit disappointing for Italy. the staff were pretty nice and the location was fairly good - about 10 mins walk to Trevi fountain. there is a flight of stairs up to the rooms and no lift which was a slight problem for my elderly grandmother. the superior room was no different so i wouldnt bother spending the extra here. overall for a fairly cheap no frills hotel it is fine - nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Charming basic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: smackeyIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I have recommended for family and friends in Rome. It's a small hotel, spotlessly clean with a short walk to Trevi in one direction and the Forum in the opposite. If you want glamour this is the worng hotel for you but if you want a clean small safe hotel in the centre of Rome then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location and decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Pascali89
Reviews.Content: Very good for location, walking distance to Termini station. Room small but clean. Comfortable and reasonably good for price (around 75 euro for one night in single room). Breakfast was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DphRPh
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on a recommendation by Rick Steves. It is near the Termini train station (10 - 15 minute walk). Via Firenze is a quiet street with little traffic. It is located near the Republica Metro station (closest) along with the previously mentioned Termini train/Metro station. I stayed in a single room so it was small (twin bed) but enough room for one person. The room was clean and bright. The staff was very helpful and a wonderful source of information. The continental breakfast (ham, cheese, cereal, pastries, yogurt, etc) was filling. They will make expresso for you if you ask. The building itself is spotless. Marble floors, bright and cheery. My single room was a good value. I had looked into staying in a hostel and the Aberdeen was actually cheaper since the hostels usually charge a solo traveler the double price for a private room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dornwc
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for two weeks on vacation in January. We picked the Hotel Aberdeen as our first lodging, largely because it was so conveniently located--a short walk from the main Train station and close to many landmarks--but it was such a delight to stay there we never left (until we left Rome altogether). Rooms were simple but very clean and well appointed, and all the staff were very personable and eager to please, from Mariano, Costello and Alberto at the front desk to those who prepared the breakfast and cleaned the rooms. They were helpful in getting us reservations, answering questions and resolving problems, and flexible when they could be on things like breakfast hours. We very much appreciated their willingness to talk with us and share our enthusiasm for sights and experiences they must hear from hundreds of visitors to Rome over the years, as well as their generosity with cappuccino (eapecially vital during the first jet-lagged days).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Base for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: serving4theking_11
Reviews.Content: We booked five rooms at this hotel for a European family adventure. My parents, both sisters and their husbands, one set of in-laws, and my wife, daughter and I stayed here last week. Location is amazing because it is a 3 minute walk to the metro, which in Rome will take you close to all the major sights for 1 euro per ride. It's also a nice neighborhood anyway, with good options for lunch where locals go for the price/quality combo. Service was great. No one had any problems with the rooms, but whenever we needed a taxi, or to make reservations for a dinner, Costel and Mariano and the other reception manager were always more than willing to help right away. For me, Costel and Mariano are the best assets to this hotel. We were doing multiple things as a group, and their expertise was absolutely invaluable to the trip. Breakfast was always decent -- nothing to write home about but enough to get you going for the day. Nice pastries, cheese, ham, bread, cappuccino and espresso to order, yogurts, juices, cereals, etc. Rooms were cleaned daily and nicely done. Cleaning staff were always smiling and seemed content. We had a triple, which is quite a bit more room than the double so if space is an issue or you are with a group and want one room as a meeting/communing spot, go for the triple. There are small safes in each room. Personally, I would rate it 5 (excellent) but if I consider the experiences of the whole group I will knock it down to a 4.5 (very good). The only reason I will do that is the noise that tends to come into the rooms at night from the street. The street sweeper vehicles and garbage trucks and mopeds (so frequent in Europe) tend to create some noise, but it mostly ends by midnight. This is not the fault of the hotel, but more of an effect of staying there. Thank you Aberdeen, Costel and Mariano for helping to make our trip to Rome a success! When we are back in Rome, we will strongly consider Aberdeen again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Evi_Ch
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on March 2011. Clean, very good location, friendly staff. A renovation could make it an ideal hotel! We defently recommend this hotel, and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: julia_budapest83
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in March 2011. Very good location: 10 min walk to Colosso, 1 min walk to Metro (Piazza di Republica) The room was small, but we do not go to Rome to stay in the room!! There was olny one chair in the double room. Breakfast: wow!! Coffee and cappuccino, cakes, bread, juice .... everything you need, and not the same on the 4 mornings, it varied. The staff was kind, and we paid 63 Eur / night (breakfast included). March was excellent choise, as there were no long queues at museums, and churches. But it was rainy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: carolwesterly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in late November prior to boarding a cruise ship. The hotel is in a very convenient location and walkable to many restaurants, shopping and major tourist sites - it is also quite close to the Termini train station. The rooms are fairly small, but nicely decorated. Bathroom shower is very small, although some of the rooms have larger showers and even bathtubs. The staff was efficient, friendly and speak excellent English. The breakfast is good with an assortment of breads, rolls, cereals, fruit and some cold cuts. If you ask, they will bring a cappucino. The bedsprings on our bed were very creaky and noisy, but otherwise the bed was comfortable. Be sure to ask for the Rick Steves special rate. You do have to walk up some stairs to get to the lobby and there's only one tiny elevator to get to the second floor and it has to be opened with a key by the manager so it's mainly used for luggage. The rooms and hallways on the main level are a bit maze-like, and our room in the interior faced an unattractive courtyard filled with airconditioners and other equipment - no view at all, but it was quiet. Overall, the location was excellent, very close to the Metro and convenient for walking around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good & great location”
Reviews.Author: Marija15
Reviews.Content: Very good little hotel with basic breakfast great location and nice helpful staff. Will definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MrSnappit
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Aberdeen based on its location and on positive Tripadvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. Located opposite the back entrance of the Ministry of Defence, it is convenient for bus and metro, for restaurants nearby and in the Via Flavia area, and within comfortable walking distance of most tourist attractions (we walked to St Peter's Basilica with relative ease). It is not plush, but beds (on the hard side) are comfortable, rooms are adequately furnished and very clean, and there is a safe located in the wardrobe. The breakfast is basic continental fare, but rolls and croissants are regularly replenished and tables cleared quickly and efficiently. The reception staff are excellent: we had cause to report a minor shower problem which was attended to promptly, and there was helpful advice concerning restaurants and travel around the city. Via Firenze is busy from early morning, but even with a room overlooking the street we slept soundly. Don't expect 5 star luxury: if your hotel room is simply a sleeping base and you spend the rest of the time sight-seeing, the Aberdeen fits the bill: good and convenient accommodation at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Aberdeen all you need”
Reviews.Author: KatieVM
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two night stay at the Aberdeen Hotel in central Rome. The room was very adequate for a short stay. The floor was not carpeted but very clean tile. The bathroom, though small, was well appointed. The included breakfast was the basic continental fare which was really all we needed. The location of this hotel is a real plus. The metro stop is just a couple of blocks away. Plus many of the historical sites are within walking distance. After visiting the Vatican we, in fact, walked back. Granted it was quite a distance but not that hard really. The fact that it was drizzling rain made it a bit more challenging for us. The hotel has internet available, with a printer which was great for obtaining e tickets for our flight home. The TV has only CNN in English though. So not much in the way of entertainment later in the evening should you feel like taking it easy after a long day of walking. For short stays I would use this hotel again. I would ask for a room not facing the street though as it did get noisy one morning very early.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ivyCroatia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip to Rome, stayed in Hotel Aberdeen. Hotel is nice, very clean, value for money, in the center on city, just few meters from via Nationale and all the sites. Hotel staff were very nice, helpful, everything was good, very good but noise. Hotels rooms are facing street and You can hear everything. Other than that I would recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quiet Location, Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: TippyGirlTwo
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here 10 years ago with some friends and when I came back to Rome I tried it again for 4 nights. The location is very quiet. It is across the street from the Ministry of Defense, so lots of security and you feel safe in the area. The building that houses the hotel, has a couple of other hotels in it. When you walk into the main courtyard, Aberdeen is the one on the right up about 8 steps. We had a triple room which was roomy. There is AC. Free Wi-Fi only in the lounge/computer areas. There are 2 PCs in this area also. I remembered breakfast being a bit more personable 10 years ago, with I believe, a relative like grandfather overseeing the room who was very friendly and nice. This time, the staff in the breakfast room seemed a bit brusque and not overly friendly. The breakfast consisted of Rolls, cheese, tea, coffee (from canisters), but you could order cappuccino if you contacted the staff there. Fruits, cereal, yoghurt. The usual European style. The beds were comfortable. The room was clean and the bathroom bigger than a postage stamp. Which means this 6ft tall person could comfortably manage in it. the front desk staff spoke English and were very helpful with directions, maps and suggestions. The area is close to ATMs, the Termini-Train station and a main hub of the subway. One can easily walk to the hotel from the Train station. From the Rome airport (as the Hotel is inside the city walls), there's a set taxi fare from the airport. It's posted at the Taxi stand. 40 Euros for up to 4 people with luggage. Confirm with the Taxi cab driver at the airport that it includes you and your luggage, otherwise they may try to overcharge you. Or alternatively, at your destination only give the 40 Euros. They most likely will try to add on more. Taxis should have the license number on their doors and TAXI on top. If you want, you can take a short train ride from the airport to the Termini station, but if there are more than one in your party, I think the Taxi is better as you get right to the door and can split the tab. We like to walk, and It was easy to walk to sights like the Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Colleseum. We took a taxi to the Vatican, because like before there were 3 of us to split the tab. Of note for snacks or a good take away lunch of pizza there is a place right next to the hotel almost. Just go out the front door, turn left. As you come to the next building, you will see a window that has displayed some of the pizzas etc. 2 doors, Enter the one under the sign Biscotteria Panifici. For 11 Euros 3 of us had a bottle of soda and a huge square of delicious pizza. Priests and workers from the ministry were nonstop coming in for lunch and takeaway. There are a couple of small bar tables there to sit at if not occupied. Make sure NOT to go to the shop across the street on the Defense Ministry side that says snack Bar Gastronomia. The 3 of us had 3 sodas there for 11 euros. Taxis ordered from the hotel arrived in about 2 minutes. We also booked a limousine to the airport when we left at 45 euros. I would go back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Visit From Australia”
Reviews.Author: Gus079
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Abedeen Hotel in Rome. Great location and with in walking distance of of great touist attractions and nice restaurants for an easy meal and of course a nice vino in Rome." While in Rome do as The Romans do". We had a lovely room and enjoyeble breakfasts. The front desk staff vey helpful and full of conversation, that you felf at home in the great city. The housekeepig lady very honest . I know this for sure,as I left one of my rings on the bed the day I was leaving. We were in a cab to the airport to fly to Sicily and received a phone call to say my ring had bed found in our room. We returned and the front desk met us with the ring. This speaks highly of the staff they have at Aberdeen. Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “A hotel stay that is Value Worth!”
Reviews.Author: DNG6711
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed last August 11-13, 2011 to tour around Rome. That was a short stay but we indeed enjoyed it. The triple room was a bit crowded for 3 pax but if you happen to just use it for sleeping it was a-okay. The toilet was clean. Breakfast though has only few choices but was good enough to fill-up your energy for an early morning tour. And of course not to mention the service that made our stay to comeback again (August 14-15) for another day before flying off to Barcelona. I would like to extend our thanks to Mr. Mariano for taking care of our reservation and ride going to the airport. The hotel is conveniently located. Walking distance to Termini (MRT) and to Rome's tourists' sights. So you have to be ready with your walking shoes. One more thing, there's a free internet access and a ready printer in case you need to print your airline e-booking, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Quiet Enough To Sleep”
Reviews.Author: MJL18
Reviews.Content: Good location, within walking distance of many sights and public transport. The public areas of the hotel are pleasant, the standard of cleanliness is good. Our bedroom was perfectly adequate, but could benefit from an update - I generally prefer hotels that provide duvets, but had to contend with the dreaded sheets and blankets. The big disappointment of our stay was the lack of any heating. During the day Rome was sunny and warm, but it gets cold at night, and the hotel did not provide any heating. We slept in our fleeces and covered the bed with blankets, but despite asking for the heat to be turned on, we were told this was not possible until December!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen was ideally situated for us. Close to the Termini and withing walking distance to Trevi, Spanish Steps, Forum, Coliseum... we even walked back from the Vatican after taking the metro there. We stayed 3 nights and walked everywhere. Mariano was most helpful in giving advice as to routes to take, restaurants to try, etc. Breakfast was ideal for us, cereal, breads, ham and cheese, coffee and juice. Limo service from the airport was arranged for us, as was limo service to Civitavecchia to meet our cruise at the port. Would definitely use this hotel again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Location”
Reviews.Author: MortonGrove
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Rick Steves tour. Very nice, friendly, clean hotel. Room was a little dated, but decent enough. Good breakfast. Good location across from Ministry of Defense on a side street. Convenient to Piazza, transportation, and restaurants (including McDonalds). I recommend it. Don't know cost due to tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jbgranger
Reviews.Content: Aberdeen hotel was a nice well kept hotel in the heart of Rome. It was very close the Metro and central to downtown. Enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rubyPerthWa
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel primarily for the location...so close to the train termini, and other transport facilities., just half an hour walk to the Trevi Fountain, great restaurants nearby.The hotel is situated off the main street, a cafe, restaurant opposite the hotel great for a snack or meal. The hotel entrance /reception room is separate from the main building..just walk outside and into a different lobby...no problems. Our room was quite spacious, facing onto the back street...not a lot of noise, cars, trucks etc, not a lot of early morning noise. The lighting was poor in the room, but the room itself was spacious, very clean, very comfortable beds, two singles put together. Breakfast was ok, if we had stayed longer we a would have ate breakfast in the cafe opposite the hotel. They will arrange hotel to airport transfer for 2 people for 45 euros...we took advantage of this . The taxi was prompt exactly the time we ordered, and our bonus was having a personalised tour to the airport.. Great service at the hotel, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: KMO33
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights at the Hotel Aberdeen in October this year and found the service to be fabulous, the rooms so clean and huge, in a great position close to absolutely everything - we walked and walked as all should do in Rome if you want to see it properly. Breakfast was great too. Nothing was too much trouble for Mariano, Sabrina and Kosta. Most impressed. Both of us are seasoned travellers working in the Travel and Tourism Industry and have stayed in the tops - I can assure you that the service here does compare to the "tops"!! My only problem was that I felt the bed quite hard and it would be good to provide tissues in the rooms for guests.........but please these are not huge negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but a bit noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Shinobi91
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Aberdeen during our first trip ever to Europe this year. I read up about the hotel here and I agree with all of the good things mentioned by fellow reviewers here. Hotel is conveniently located near the train, subway, and bus terminals; the room was spacious and clean; breakfast is provided and free wifi is available at lobby. You can leave your luggage with them before and after checkout if it helps with your itinerary. The only complaint we had was the noise level of the room during the night. First off, the walls are quite thin and you can easily hear noises (occasionally conversations) coming from other guests in the hotel. Secondly, our room faces another side street and there were quite a bit of noise coming from there as well even past midnight from people on the street. Finally, our room was located right by the breakfast dining area and the amount of noise coming from there was just unbelievable. Sounds of chatters and the clinging & clanging of dishes were just very irritating and there's nothing we can really about that (we didn't bothered changing room since it was for 2 nights only). There were a few rooms around that area too so I am sure we weren't the only one affected by that. Overall the hotel was great if the noise level can be managed somehow. I would suggest future travelers to request for rooms away from the dining area or if possible, on the first floor as there is no elevator to the second floor. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel for all the good reasons mentioned by other reviewers on this page.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: JulieandJoeP
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Aberdeen Hotel. The staff (especially Mariano and Sabrina) were soooo friendly and helpful and put up with all our questions with a smile. The room was huge and extremely clean. Big fluffy towels and extra pillows. The breakfast was great with a wonderful cappuccino upon request. This hotel made our trip to Rome, close to absolutely everything. If we were in Rome again, we wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveler47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights (October 8-15) with a Rick Steves City tour of Rome. this was my second time and my husband's first. The location is wonderful - very close to Termini. There is a metro stop (Republicca) right down the street. The hotel itself is charming, quaint - cleanliness is just tops. The staff (especially Sabrina) could not be more accomodating or helpful. I know that the Steves tours stop here regularly - so there always seems to be a lot of Americans which, because they are on the RS tours, are usually a happy, non-complaining bunch. The hotel's breakfast is wonderful and you can ask the breakfast staff for capuccino - which they deliver with a smile. They offer wi-fi in the lounge area - lots of early risers were always checking their e-mails. They do not offer an elevator - to get to most rooms there is a circular marble staircase - but shouldn't be a problem if you are going to be doing a lot of walking anyway in Rome. All in all - we will stay there again when we are not on the RS tour - it was that good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcel G
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel which we found ideally located for ease of travel around Rome, being a few minutes walk from the Metro and Bus Station Spanish Steps , Trevi Fountain, 10 min by subway to the Vatican City Our room was immaculatey clean and comfortable,excellent breakfast The staff were very helpful,especially Livio and AnnaMaria and gave excellent service. We would stay here again if returning to Rome

Reviews.Title: “No Frills But Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: Sally O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located near the railway station, metro and bus stops. It is nothing fancy but offers clean rooms accompanied by helpful and friendly staff. It offers value for money in an expensive city but if you are after a few extra frills (like a television manufactured post turn of the century) it might be better to look further. I wouldn't hesitate to book it again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: p0ny123
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aberdeen was recommended by a friend and we stayed 4 nights. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is terrific, close to the termini, hop on/hop off bus, and shops. Breakfast was delicious. The room was spacious and clean. I would definitely return to this hotel the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel and good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: blueguaviyu
Reviews.Content: The guy at the desk was very helpful...cannot remember his name but he spoke a few languages and was the best at directions, the hotel was comfortable and at a nice location, we walked at night and were not afraid, close to termini station etc. Would recommend this hotel for the price and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jean A
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms, one for me and hubby, the other for two daughters (20 and 22). Very, very clean. Both rooms were on the street side, and we were so exhausted from walking all day in the August heat, that we didn't have any trouble sleeping. Staff is Excellent; friendly and helpful. They sent us to some great restaurants, too. The location was great! We walked to the Trevi, Spanish Steps, hop on and off bus, Mass at the Bascilica santa maria something, ask the desk, I forgot the exact name. We enjoyed the Irish pub, too, not far from the hotel, called O'briens. We went back there a few times, lol, but we like beer and bar food, what can I say. We used taxis to get to the Vatican and to Piazza Navona for the night walk, but they weren't very expensive when you can get four people in, consider that, and no worries about pick pockets while riding in a taxi. We stayed three nights. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great employees, better location”
Reviews.Author: breinings
Reviews.Content: The employees willingly made museum reservations and car reservations, got us shampoo when the cleaning staff didn't provide it. Breakfast here leaves something to be desired (the worst of the three hotels we stayed at while in Italy). But centrally located to all of the touristy things, decent restaurants and shopping. Rooms typical size of European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LA S
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk to Aberdeen from the Termini. The staff was very polite and helpful giving us plenty of nice tips for touring and for places to eat. Breakfast was nice - but nothing to write home about. Only drawback for me was no rugs on the floor in the room. I am not a fan of bare floors. Also, internet was only available on first floor in a corner of one room. Other than that, this was a very nice place to stay. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted and for those days when we walked so far that we were too tired to walk home, we were able to catch the bus which dropped us off just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Thanks for making our trip so much fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanne_8
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Not fancy but well situated, comfortable and clean. Perfect as a 3 star hotel but a little pricy for a 3 start. But it is Rome and it is to be expected! The service was very good but the breakfast weak... I don't know what is wrong with the coffee in the Italian hotels but it is undrinkable...It is not particular just to this hotel. We arrived early and were able to complete the check in, leave our luggage and when we came back at night everything was in our nicely air conditioned room. Even if our room faced the main road, it was quiet and we enjoyed a great night sleep. The bathroom was clean and was a good size. Wifi was available and free in a nice sitting room. I would go back any time and recommand it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JOHN1292
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen is a good hotel in a great spot. Nice clean rooms, nice friendly staff. Easy walk to restaurants and attractions (10-20 min walks). Only complaint is that shower is a little small. Must walk up two short flights of stairs to get to your room. Would go back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bobinmelbourne
Reviews.Content: A good choice: quiet, clean, helpful and friendly staff. Close enough for most of the sites on foot. Only downside was the quality of the bedlinen.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great.....but not quite.....”
Reviews.Author: Hundleychick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel in Rome for three nights in August. It is on a quiet side street just off a main road. We mostly booked it b/c it was very close to the metro and main train station. We also found that it was the best choice for our budget and we got a great deal on the price of the room with the Rick Steves discount!! Upon arrival, we were able to check in early, which was welcome after a long overnight flight from NYC. However, we were not happy that there was no elevator and we had to drag our luggage up a long winding staircase. Our room was nice and clean, but a bit on the small side. The bathroom was also very small and the shower (so typical in European hotels) caused a nice little flood every time either of us took a shower b/c the door on the stall didn't close very tightly. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was modest--it only included some cereal, yogurt, and a variety of breads. I think the most annoying thing about this hotel was that the bed was two twins put together--so needless to say, it was a little hard to get close to your spouse when theres a crack between you! However, unless you are staying in a 4 or 5 star hotel, these minor annoyances re: showers, beds, and breakfast seems to be pretty common in Europe. On a good note, the staff was great and very helpful. We were leaving on a very early morning train on the day of our departure and since we were going to miss breakfast, they put two little care packages of juice, croissants, and dry toast crackers in our room so we would have something to take with us on the train. We also loved the fact that free Wi-Fi in the lobby is available (as well as one shared computer if you do not have your own laptop)--so that is very convenient as well. Overall, I would say if you are on a budget and are looking for a nice, clean place to stay in a pretty convenient location--this is the place for you. If you are looking for more glitz, glamour, and better amenities--you might want to look elsewhere (and spend more $ of course)

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aberdeen for three nights before going on a 10 day Mediterranean cruise. The hotel manager was very friendly and helpful. All the staff did speak some English and we had no problems communicating with them. The room was spacious and the a/c was great after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel location was located across the street from a police station and within a short walking distance of many historic sites like the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps. It was also close to a bus stop and Metro line that we used for traveling to the Colosseum, Roman Forum and Vatican. We recommend purchasing a Metro Pass for 20 euros/person. It can be bought from a street magazine shop a few blocks from the hotel on Via Nazional (a main street). This Pass allows for free bus rides and subway usage for 3 days; however, it did not appear that anyone bothered to check the Pass as we entered. The free continental breakfast was ample and very European. We would definitely stay here again. The only negative is that there wasn't a lobby or area where you could sit down and socialize with friends. Although they did have free internet and two PCs, the connection was slow. The price of 80 euros/night was a plus as compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, just a nice hotel on a good location”
Reviews.Author: appelsap a
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, just a nice hotel situated near one of my favorite streets in Rome: the Via Nazionale. Also situated near the metro station Repubblica, tourist busses, and taxi's. So the location is great, though Via Firenze is quite dark, especially at night when you're standing before the closed gate (opens via an intercom connection with reception). The rooms are spacious and clean, the bathroom includes a bath tub and a window that opens. The room I stayed in was a bit outdated, so was the bathroom. But we didn't mind, because Rome has so much to offer and we were only at the hotel to sleep. Breakfast was nothing special just your average ham/cheese/jam/OJ/tea and coffee. What I really missed was an elevator. Climbing the stairs with a suitcase is not what you have want to do when you arrive at a hotel. Going down the stairs with a suitcase that's even more heavier after a few days of shopping is even worse! + Clean + Good location - No elevator - Located in a dark street

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good position!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband we stayed at Aberdeen hotel for our anniversary. The hotel is located in a good position, near the main subway an buses stop s,in a quiet street.The hotel is so cleaned ,the breakfast is with a big buffet with very high quality of food.All the staff from the front desk to that at the breakfast room is really so kind and helpfull.F or our anniversary we found in our room a bottle of good spumante.We will suggest this hotel to all our friends and we will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Silrak
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Aberdeen Hotel in Rome. It is on a fairly quiet side street just off a main road. It is very close to the metro and main train station (an easy walk). Our room was nice, the bathroom was very good. The bed was firm but that seems to be the trend everywhere in Italy. The staff was great, very helpful. Breakfast is included and was good also.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Frankcostelo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel maybe one of the best three stars hotel in Rome,nice and clean rooms excellent breakfast friendly staff particularly Mr Livio @ Mrs Angela..great transportation service ..just ask for the limo service:))

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay. Highly reccomend it”
Reviews.Author: HAmlani
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in the heart of the city with excellent transportation connections. The service staff were very helpful in meeting or transportation and restaurant needs. the hotel is 10 minute walk from the Colosseum and 2 minutes from the republic train station. The rooms were a fairly nice size for European standards. we traveled with our 15 yr old son and we were quite comfortable in their triple room. The breakfast was very ordinary. They could use some hot items.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beginning to our 50th Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Briteguy41
Reviews.Content: From our arrival into Rome Fiumicino, where we were met by Hotel's car, to the early check-in to our lovely room, complete with a bottle of Champagne on Ice-(honoring our 50th) and onward through the entire visit--the service provided by the staff and owners of this Hotel exceeded our expectations. The managers had excellent recommendations for meals, for places to visit, and support for taxi's and other transportation. The room was spacious for the price-range, and always kept clean & neat. It was quiet, the A/C worked well. Internet connection was provided in a central location, and was always working.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an accessible part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Janet_in_Portland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 26-30, 2011 on the main floor, at the end of the hallway (nicely distant from the lobby, but close to the wi-fi area). The location of this hotel is fine in that it is reasonably near a subway stop (and a McDonald’s if you are travelling with kids who have had enough local food). Not the greatest location, but ok. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were large enough, but ours lacked any flair in terms of décor. It wasn’t bland, just not really a “wow, I’m in Rome” feel to it. The A/C worked; the bathroom was quite modern and had plenty of hot water and water pressure; the beds were reasonably comfortable, although a bit hard; the breakfast was filling enough, and the breakfast room was truly lovely, making up a bit for the room. It has hairdryers as promised. The free wi-fi worked and there was also a PC for guest use in the common room. The room was quiet (the window opened onto an interior space so the windows were pretty much shuttered – no view, but quiet). The floors and furniture were clean and housekeeping was efficient. I would consider staying in this hotel again if I returned to Rome, although I would look around for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: DavisSunflower
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Rome and our 2nd stay at the Hotel Aberdeen. We were just as happy with our stay this time as we were the first time. This place is a real bargain. The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable, and the linens are of high quality. It is centrally located in the heart of the city, and an easy walk to most sites. The staff are all friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is one of the best we had on our trip. The housekeeping staff keep the rooms immaculate. And with all that, it is still well under the cost of most other hotels in Rome of the same quality. I'm not sure how they do it, but we will keep going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, good location”
Reviews.Author: Zebra740
Reviews.Content: Marble floors, an actual tub, walk right out the front door through a courtyard and onto a main central street. We were able to easily get our suticases to and from the train station from here without an expensive cab. Had an unfortunate experience with the subcontracted laundry service stealing some money, but the hotel management stepped in and offered to reimburse part of the loss. More importantly, they are using a different service because of it. I have to applaud the business owners in Rome who are trying to improve the reputation of this city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, friendly, central .... we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: BCBoomer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in our travels (originally discovered through Rick Steves) ... and find it perfectly located to the main attractions in Rome ... and central to the public transit. Most appreciated is the quiet in the midst of a safe neighbourhood in a bustling city. Staff is cheerful and helpful .... and all the amenities met our expectations. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, friendly folk”
Reviews.Author: melted_snowball
Reviews.Content: I was here for a couple days at the end of June before I went to a meeting in Sicily. It's convenient to the main train station and surprisingly easy to find even when jetlagged. Breakfast fine, nothing special. Internet only in their 1st-floor lobby, but that's fine, I guess. Room small, but entirely okay. Clientele seemed to be largely 50-something Canadian and American tourists, which is certainly an easier crowd to deal with than the armies of college kids on their World Tour.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: kmck518
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen on Via firenze while in Rome ( recommended by Rick Steve's guidebook) .It is a great location as it is just a few blocks from the Rome Termini and bus lines. A real convenience for airport and bus connections. . The hotel is in a very safe area, clean, very helpful staff, , average decor, small bathrooms , a nice breakfast room with fruits and cereals.. The only negative is that the hotel can be noisey in a few areas near the front alcove entrance and the breakfast room area. ( and by the way, there is a bakery located in the next building bottom floor,so you will hear singing and pots banging at 2 A:M!) Just ask for rooms in quieter areas of the hotel . A good value and very good location! (safe and clean ). La vita e' bella!!! Kathleen Berlin CT USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveler48
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The staff (particularly Sabrina) was very nice and courteous, anticipating our questions and always had good suggestions on restaurants, sites, transportation. They give you a good map when you check in. You can easily walk to the Colosseum & Forum (15 mins), Trevi Fountain (20 mins), and Pantheon (25 mins). A subway stop is 5 minutes from the hotel, perfect for taking the train to the Vatican and sites further away. The train terminal is a 10 minute walk (down a busy street, with luggage ugh) but it beats an expensive cab ride or the stairs/escalators in subway. The breakfast is Ok, breads, cereals and meats/cheeses. Internet access only in Internet room downstairs. Oh, although we booked a triple room, staff went ahead and gave my 17 yr old son his own only single room (due to availability) so he loved it.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: artyheart
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed it. They have an elevator--a rarity in Italy-lovely rooms with tub and shower and a nice breakfast room with a wide variety of breakfast foods. Staff is welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 3travelers_9
Reviews.Content: The desk staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was clean and nice. Marble floors!The location was supurb.Very close to the Republica Metro Stop. Breakfast was great. Internet acess worked. Snack Bar Restaurant across the street had great pizza, soups, gelato, salads and pasta. Nice quiet hotel. Would definetly stay again. We had a triple room facing the courtyard. We walked from the train station - 12 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, hotel, and location was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: FolsomVic
Reviews.Content: Location near Termini Station ideal as was a nearby bus stop. The staff was great. Sabrina was especially helpful to a first timer to both Rome and Italy. My family was very comfortable in the hotel room (myself, wife and 14 year old son) and the bathroom was great. Great inexpensive places to eat nearby too. The staff arranged for a car to meet us at the airport since we arrived from Toronto after an overnight flight. And upon leaving Sabrina ordered us a taxi for the short ride to the train station. I would certainly return to Rome and stay at the Aberdeen.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, the finest staff”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterista
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Aberdeen after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. We had a very pleasant stay. At first the hotel looked very basic, but I soon saw it had everything one needs when visiting a city. The hotel is in a very good location. It felt safe there, because the front gate is locked at night and during most of the day, one rings a bell outside and is let in. The room size is similar to that of hotel rooms in European capitals. We came only for four days so we had little luggage, two large people with a lot of luggage may find it a bit crowded. After a day the air-conditioner stopped working, and we were given a new room immediately. The two rooms were similar but the first one had a shower and the second a bathtub. The rooms were spotless, and the bed comfortable. The room and bathroom were well lighted, and I loved it because for some reason hotel rooms tend to be dark and gloomy even in expensive and luxurious hotels. The bathroom amenities included soap, a shower cap, shower gel and shampoo, generously replenished every day; there is also a hair dryer in the bathroom but no facial tissues and no body lotion. No full-length mirror in the room, the only mirror was in the bathroom. There is no elevator in the hotel. There are rooms on the ground floor and on the first floor. The breakfast room is on the first floor, so even those on the ground floor have to use the stairs. There is a wi-fi area in the lobby and it's free. The staff in the hotel is excellent. They all seem to be enjoying what they do very much. Everyone is helpful and polite and friendly. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: travel_incognito1
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good - walking distance from the Termini train station and close to a Metro/subway stop. It's also not a far walk from the Colosseum, Forum and other historic sites. The walk from the train station is fine during the day but would be difficult at night, especially with luggage. The hotel is a bit hard to find (not good signage, down a side street) but the hotel provided good directions for us to walk. It's a bit expensive for what it is. I think many hotels in Rome are likely expensive but it did seem to be more expensive than expected. But it worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: kegearhart
Reviews.Content: This Aberdeen Hotel was the perfect hotel for our first night in Rome. The staff was extremely helpful and spoke very good English. Our room was big by European standards, very clean and very comfortable. I would stay again next time in Rome. It was the perfect way to begin our 2-week Italian adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Maria84
Reviews.Content: This trip was part business and part leisure and was the 5th time we have been to Rome. We now know where we will stay the next time we go to Rome. On this trip, we stayed at this hotel for 13 nights. Our first night was at a more expensive hotel, where the room was much smaller. Aberdeen hotel was less expensive and much more comfortable. The room was large and had plenty of space for our personal things. The staff was great, from making dinner suggestions to offerring to make train reservations for out of town travel. We were very close to the metro and bus lines. Also, the hotel was in a very nice part of the city. I can't say enough about how great this hotel was. Both Rick Steves and Trip Advisor were correct in their evaluation of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jarrette
Reviews.Content: This is a small, non-smoking *** hotel in a very central location, especially handy if you are a good walker. Metro is nearby as is the main train station. The front desk staff simply bend over backwards to be of assistance. The hotel is clean and secure; rooms are air conditioned, The included continental plus breakfast is very adequate; tables have linen tablecloths. One complimentary computer for Internet is free but downstairs and no signal in rooms; if you bring your own laptop, bring an ethernet cable to connect to the router -- much easier. Beds seem a bit hard but we slept well enough. Three small Italian type delis are less than a block away for inexpensive lunch or dinner. Nice restaurants are two or more blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best !”
Reviews.Author: MisplacedCityGirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and walked everywhere that we went. We even walked to the Vatican City although it was quite a hike back. But how can you see the city when you are on a bus or Metro. We felt very safe, the rooms were great, the service from the front desk was wonderful ! Breakfast was one of the bests of our trips. Would highly recommend this especially if you are using the train to travel, you are close enough but not right on top of it. Would stay here again in a heartbeat ! You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good service, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kpounds3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the friendly and helpful staff at this hotel. Very close to Termini, so it was convenient to walk to many sites. The breakfast was excellent, the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Friendly Staff, Great Location: Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: sebakd01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Rome! I stayed there with my girlfriend for 3 nights. It's perfectly located, right next to the train station and walking distance to all major attractions. The staff was extremely nice. They did everything to accomodate our every need, from getting an extra pillow, to getting the right restaurant. The breakfast room was nice and coffee was excellent. Another thing very important is how the hotel and room were always clean and spotless. We had 3 days of pouring rain and the hotel lobby was always pristine. The only downside was that the wifi connection was only available on the lobby. But a great, great hotel to stay with a very friendly and helpful staff! Hope someday to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 nights at the Aberdeen during the end of March. We loved the location and the staff is quite efficient and friendly. The breakfast was good with rolls, ham, cheese, cereals , yogurt, etc. The nice woman in charge would happily make cappuccinos for us each morning. The internet area is comfortable and we were able to connect to the wireless. However the password is 24 characters and took several tries to get it right. We had a very pleasant stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: traveler59012
Reviews.Content: Once we found the hotel, which was hard to spot because there is no obvious sign and there were other hotels/apartments in the same building, we found a true gem. The rooms were spacious, the staff very helpful, and the breakfast was tasty and filling. We had a good night's sleep with very little noise after 10:00 p.m. We could walk or take the nearby subway to all the sites. All types of people stayed there, from solo travelers to families. There were about 25 stairs to walk up to reach the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff were excellent and very accomodating for a school group”
Reviews.Author: smcmangion
Reviews.Content: The hotel accommodated us for a group of 20 students - the rooms were very clean and to a very high standard. It is a place which I would choose to stay in myself if I was on holiday with family. I will certainly be taking my students there again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Reefnoutback
Reviews.Content: After more than 30 hours of travel it was a pleasure to be whisked by private transfer (worth the cost) to Hotel Aberdeen. The concierge was enthusiastic, very helpful and immediately put our 13-year-old at ease after his first international flight. The room was more than adequate and there was enough internal heating to get our Chinese laundry happening and have everything dry by the time we finished our three night stay. The morning procession of people going to work was a little noisy but shutters and windows helped to minimise that and on the weekend it was completely quiet. The hotel offered my son's favourite breakfast of our 2 month trip - good coffee. Well placed for metro and in walking distance to many main attractions - Trevi fountain etc. A very comfortable first stop which left a lasting impression on our son,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: alkiephillips
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the excellent service, fantastic hospitality and warm welcome on the weekend during our quick trip to Rome, we are extremely grateful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for central Rome. Convenient, clean, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: JLS300
Reviews.Content: We (4 people in 2 rooms) stayed recently at the Aberdeen for 3 nights. We made the decision after reviewing booking engines and reviews here. Could not have been a better choice. Booking was easy, and we immediately received a welcome email, offering to arrange taxi service from FCO. We choose the train and found the hotel to be an easy 10 minute walk from Termini. Upon arrival, will say it is a little confusing once you enter the building. There are 2 hotels from this entry, and as far as I could see, the names were only on the door mats. We went to the other one first...not that big a deal! Go to the right for the Aberdeen! Extremely easy check in, they took passports only, but did not request a CC. They had 1 room ready, we stowed all luggage there and hit the town. The rooms are nicely sized with marble floors/bath, closet with safe and sitting chairs. By coincidence, both rooms faced wach other over the courtyard, so we did not have any noise issues as described by others. Everyone at the desk were excellent. Friendly, helpful, always with a smile. We arranged for dinner reservations and taxi to return to FCO through them. BKfast was ok. I don't eat a huge bkfast everyday, they had what was needed to get the day going. Internet is not available in the rooms, but in the computer room only. There is a computer there to use as well. Most of the hotel is on the single floor, and the hallway is a winding maze! Would definitely look to stay here again on my next trip to Roma. Excellent stay and wonderful value! Pros: Nice clean rooms. Execellent staff. Location (near the Opera, 15 minute walk to anywhere!) Cons: Breakfast room is on the smaller side for the # of potential users. Selection is adequate (rolls, meat/cheese, juice/coffee, yogurt, 2-3 type cereal, canned peaches) Will say the attendant was working hard to keep up with the room!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could ask for, location, friendliness, amazing value for money and for solo traveller felt very safe”
Reviews.Author: mrsmad
Reviews.Content: Hello. I stayed at your hotel "Aberdeen" last year for three nights 7 – 10 August and just wanted to thank you. I found your hotel exceptional, close to the railway station and main road and very accessible and the two hotel managers, I believe to be cousins, just wonderful – very friendly. I am a 63 year old woman travelling alone at that time all the way from New Zealand and their help was wonderful, nothing was too difficult for them and they went out of their way to help. My room was everything I wanted as were the breakfasts where I was able to chat to other tourists – very friendly atmosphere. I also loved the fact that I could keep in touch with my family on the free internet service and let them know how I was doing – this in itself made me feel less isolated. My stay was fantastic and incredibly exciting – I hope to get back to Rome again there is so much more I would like to see. Kind regards Susan Madarasz

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value in a tourist-class hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: CLK10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aberdeen comes recommended by many guidebooks. We concur. The Hotel Aberdeen is a tourist-class hotel - meaning functional rooms, not a lot of focus on common areas and none of the usual business amenities if you are used to business hotel. (Except, there is free wi-fi downstairs and one computer that guests can share to check on flights, etc.) We can't say enough positive about the staff, including the great woman who works in the breakfast room who remembers after the first day if you want a cappucino with your breakfast. The front desk staff is also very helpful and clearly used to dealing with English-speaking tourists and their varied trials and tribulations. Mariano was especially helpful and patient with us as he used the desk phone to help us try to track down our luggage that never arrived the entire week we were in Rome. Every morning, we spent an hour or so clogging up his lobby on his phone trying to get answers. He even called on our behalf speaking in Italian to the airlines trying to resolve the issue. If you are looking to stay somewhere historic or "authentically" Italian, then Hotel Aberdeen is not your choice. You are mostly going to be surrounded by other US, UK, Australian and perhaps Asian guests thumbing through their guidebooks at breakfast. However, the location can't be beat as it is an easy walk from the train station, just around the corner from the Metro and on major bus lines that will take you to the main tourist attractions. Taxi drivers recognized the cross-street intersection which made coming home late at night particularly helpful. Our only warning is to never cease being attentive about your personal safety. The Hotel Aberdeen is on a quiet side street and fronts the National Defense agency. The back of the hotel (where our room was located) is across the street from a major bookstore of Barnes and Noble size. However, during the off-season (January), this street gets pretty quiet. We neglected to notice the locking metal shutters for our window. (They are louvered and will let in fresh air but provide needed security.) As I was too hot in the evening, I opened our window in our second floor room only to catch a person in the act of trying to climb in the open window at 4 am! I yelled, and he fled. But any women traveling alone should be aware of such things. Be aware of your surroundings and notice (as we did not) that everyone keeps their shutters closed or a metal gate pulled down over their windows, no matter on which floor they live. This did not deter us from continuing to stay at the Hotel Aberdeen, as we simply locked our shutters from then on. I never, ever felt unsafe walking on the street, even at night. And the hotel's front entrance is controlled by a buzzer so not just anyone can walk in. An investment in lights or security cameras on the rear of the hotel would seem reasonable. If you are concerned, simply request a room at the front of the hotel or don't open your windows! With this one caveat in mind, I would recommend this choice to others and would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: EilisRyan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teenage son for a week as part of a tour - so the hotel was selected for us, and it was perfect to use as our home base. Located on a quiet, narrow side street off a more major road near Piazza della Repubblica and the metro, the hotel was a great location for getting around the city. There's a mini-mart and an eatery right next to the hotel and more restaurants and gelaterias just around the corner with long hours -- so you can grab a variety of things to eat at practically any time. The hotel is very simple, but clean and well maintained. It's an older property with marble floors and high ceilings, large windows with interior and exterior shutters (I'll post photos). There are many stairs up to the entrance/ lobby and then again up to the guest rooms -- so I would be cautious if you're traveling with someone who does not do stairs well. There may be an elevator but I don't recall seeing one. Our room was a triple so they removed the third bed after the first night. For three adults, it may have been just a bit cramped but for two, it was more than enough space. It would have been fine for two adults with one child, etc... The beds were very comfortable - which meant a lot after exhausting days walking all over the city. You read a lot about hard European hotel beds but these were very comfy. The bathroom was older as well, but well maintained and clean with plenty of towels. Bring your own face cloth if you use one -- many European hotels do not supply face cloths and neither does this one. All the staff were very friendly and helpful -- You leave your key at the front desk whenever you go out of the hotel, and I found it interesting that they remembered each person by name and your room number each time you returned. It made you feel like they really cared that you were their guest. Breakfast was included each day -- cereal, pastries, juices, delicious yogurt, coffee (fyi - don't expect to find decaf anywhere in Italy :-). The room where breakfast is served was also a nice size. The common room nearest our room had a public computer with free internet access and wireless if you had your own laptop which was great. Overall, I would definitely stay here again if you're looking for a safe, clean, friendly, comfortable and reliable hotel in an accessible location. For someone looking more for the frills of a full-service hotel, they may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “terrific, friendly, great service”
Reviews.Author: russAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Very helpful. Good breakfast. Lack of lift, but not really a problem. A good safe choice for Rome.I came with a group of students and all were very well looked after. I came back to Rome in September and the Aberdeen was full but they helped me find somewhere else. Definitely my first choice

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, FANTASTIC Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sleepless32931
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with easy access to train station and subway. Staff very helpful and friendly. Stayed 4 nights. Two of the days the TV system didn't receive BBC ( the only English speaking station) and when I mentioned this at checkout they voluntarily gave a discount off the bill. I had mentioned the problem only so they could fix it. Needless to say with all of Rome to explore, the TV was not a concern. If I ever go back I would readiyl book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Special Place”
Reviews.Author: nelly8047
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel last November for 3 nights. Staff was very helpfull. Position is strategic, close to the main important sites in Rome. Rooms are very clean and breakfast was very tasty. We will come back in this hotel again and we want recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: DCgirl6
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen Hotel is very centrally located and a great value. Put on your walking shoes for an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona and the metro. Close to the Termini for easy access to the airport. Very friendly and knowledgable staff. My room was small - but very clean. I definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ellabella_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen is located on a quiet street within walking distance of the train station, a metro station, and many of the points of interest. The staff was wonderful and very helpful with directions and recommendations. The hotel was clean and comfortable and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JohnandLinda042
Reviews.Content: With two nights in Rome before flying home, we decided to stay at the same hotel we spent three night three years ago. As before the staff was very helpful in arranging transportation, restaurant reservations, and storing our luggage. The rooms are generous and we enjoyed the breakfast. The hotel is a reasonable walk from Rome Termini train station and is a good location for touring the antiquities.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but noisy and not in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AmyandChuck2010
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Aberdeen for 3 nights in April based on reviews from RS. This was at the end of a 10-day trip to Italy so we were a bit tired at this point. This hotel is near the train station but the walk is not that easy because you have to cross many busy streets. Our room was large (booked a superior double) and the bathroom was large & clean. Our room overlooked the street so it was pretty loud with street traffic. It was also down the hall from the breakfast room so we heard a lot of noise early in the morning. The customer service was just average compared to the hotels we stayed at in Venice & Florence. They do have good email communication prior to arriving and were able to pre-arrange a taxi for us back to the airport on our last day. The taxi arrived right on time so we didn't have any problems getting out. The rate was also economical compared to other hotels I evaluated in my planning. While the hotel is not close to any tourist attractions, it is well located near the Metro stop. We easily navigated the train system to all of the important landmarks using the map they gave us. We bought our tickets at the little kiosk across from the stop. There was a very good restaurant right behind the hotel in a quiet alley but I can't remember the name! Be sure to ask at the desk as the other restaurants around there aren't very good. There are two McDonalds very close for a quick snack or lunch if you're homesick. Overall, our stay at this hotel was average. If we were to go back to Rome, I would look for something more centrally located. Location (unless you want to be close to the train station--then it's a fine choice) is the major reason that I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but definitely spartan, nice location”
Reviews.Author: darkstar388
Reviews.Content: Ask for a quiet room, away from the breakfast room, which can be very noisy in the morning until noon. I would have enjoyed a more upgraded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: diggn
Reviews.Content: Day and night staff very friendly and helpful to english speaking guest. Room clean and comfortable, breakfast good, close to shops, restaurants, sights,buses, metro and train station. Desk clerks went out of thier way to help with local sights, directions, restaurant reccomendations and reservations. Even left Pastry and champagne in room on my birthday. Room had no view of outside but was therefore quiet and probably more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SVG108
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and economical hotel to stay in Rome. The location is great as it is close to the Repubblica Metro Station and several bus stops. You can walk to the Main Roma Termini Station in less than 10 minutes. (Colosseum/Forum are about 20 mins walking distance - very nice walk). The hotel has decent sized rooms and attached bath/shower. A continental breakfast buffet is served in the mornings (was complimentary with our room rate). Free internet is usually provided. The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous. Although the hotel is not fancy by any means, it is in a safe neighbourhood, clean, relatively quiet and quite economical.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lorie14
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome and the hotel Aberdeen was everything that I hoped for. The location was close to all the sites, restaurants and train station. The room was small (as expected ) but well decorated and very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and also was what I expected. Breakfast had a good assortment of rolls, meat, cheese, fruit and yogurt, cold cereal and juices. Various coffee's and tea. Capuccino and espresso made to order. The American coffee was not that good but when in Rome do as the Romans do.....drink capuccino. The front desk staff was professional and pleasant. They recommended good restaurants (I know good food being Italian myself) and were helpful in choosing touristy things to do. When I return to Rome I will definately stay at Hotel Aberdeen.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: jrb324
Reviews.Content: The location was phenomenal. The room was relatively large for Europe and had been renovated. The staff was great with restaurant recommendations and reservations. The neighborhood was extremely safe (right next to the Defense Ministry) and a 5 minute walk to the Metro as well as very close to the Termini train station. The accomodations were very clean and offered free WIFI as well as a PC in the lobby for guest use. The only negative is that the walls between rooms are apparently not soundproofed and any movement in the adjacent rooms was like the occupants were in the same room as you. We would stay again for the location, size, and cleanliness IF we could get a remote room.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mexicolovingfamily
Reviews.Content: Aberdeen Hotel is extremely well located for all the sites of Rome. The staff are very nice and the rooms nice for Europe. Each room has a private bath and a Ice Box. The breakfast each day is nice with lots of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wp72
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome and we decided not to see the Vatican or the colosseum this time. We were able to walk up to the hotel from the train station and found the sites that we wanted to see within walking distance. The hotel staff was outstanding!! They were courteous and helpful and very professional. The room was clean and well decorated and wonderfully cool!!! The breakfast was a very nice mix of pastries and fruit and the breakfast service was excellent. Overall the hotel was very elegant and clean and we would choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay - Hotel Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: essie32653
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - can get to most places on foot or take the buses close by. Bank close by. The Aberdeen people are so very generous with their suggestions Re: restaurants, places to visit and transportation to get there. They were always interested in what we'd done when we dragged in from sightseeing. Their rooms are very clean and roomy -great beds. I would rate them 4***. The breakfasts were more than continental and held us ...until a lunch of pizza! Would stay there again. Was so glad friends had recommended the hotel to us. Es - California

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations, service, and professional friendliness.”
Reviews.Author: kieft42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aberdeen for 5 days and each day brought excellent service, cleanliness, and friendliness from the entire staff. The location is close to the main public transportation terminal and within walking distance of most major attractions. The price was very reasonable. Breakfast being included was a nice touch. We would certainly stay at the Aberdeen again the next time we are in Rome. Ray & Sandy Kieft

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay while in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TimmyIrish
Reviews.Content: "I enjoyed everything about the Aberdeen Hotel during my (second) trip to Rome. First, it's in a superb location...close to the Termini station, within walking distance of many sights, and just around the corner from a bus stop on the Via Nazionale, which is a main artery to tourist attractions and Vatican City. You can pick up tickets at the Tabacchi just outside the front door and be on a bus minutes later. There are cafes, bars, and restaurants close by as well. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. If you are travelling in the summer, they are air conditioned, too! A very nice breakfast and wireless internet are included with your stay...which is not the case at most European hotels. However, the real charm of the Aberdeen is the wonderful and professional staff. Sabrina is incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. Her recommendations were very helpful during my visit! I lived in Europe for two years, and I can say that this is one of the nicest, most affordable, and quality hotels in which I ever stayed. There is no reason to look anywhere else! Stay with the folks at the Aberdeen!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: JeffS323
Reviews.Content: You can read the other reviews to get the details of the rooms, location, breakfast, etc. Our family was very happy with all aspects of the hotel itself, but it was the staff that did an oustanding job of assisting us when I sustained a serious injury in a fall at the Borghese Gallery (tip: stay to the outside on the spiral staircase when you exit) which required an urgent return to the US for surgery. They helped arrange an ambulance to the airport and even helped the ambulance personell carry me in a litter up and down the stairs. When we checked out 2 days early (they refunded our money) so I could move to the airport Hilton while I tried to get a flight out, they continued to be of assistance. Most importantly they tracked down an American doctor living in Rome who was kind enough to examine me on the weekend so I could get the necessary paperwork to get an emergency flight home. So, if you are looking for a fine hotel centrally located in Rome that is staffed by people of the highest quality, the Aberdeen would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: aelontra
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen in November 2008. It was a very nice stay. The hotel is new, clean and well located, near Piazza de La Republica (metro), 8 minutes walk from train station (Termini) and 12 minutes walk from the historic centre of Rome (you can walk to the Coliseum and to Foro Romano). Room and bathroom were spacious (see pictures). Good breakfast. At Via Nazionale, near the hotel, there are a lot of bars, restaurants and shops of all kinds.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Suzy737
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with a group of 26 colleagues on a trip on a budget. Aberdeen was the most reasonable priced hotel we could find that could also offer us all twin bedded rooms. They were also the first hotel to e-mail us after we made an information request per e-mail. Not over enthusiastic about the hotel's decoration visible on the hotel photo's, we were pleasantly suprised. The hotel is easily located, very clean, some rooms are spacious, some not so much and the decoration looks old fashioned, but is not as old as it looks like. Bathroom is ok equipped - although I hate shower curtains - and the rooms have aircos. Besides the fact that the some of the rooms were a little bit small for two persons, I have had no complaints from my 25 colleagues about the rooms. And as for most of us this was a more low budget trip than we're used to that says it all. Breakfast is not something to wake up early for: limited choice and no possibility to have a nice egg or omelet. Mariano from the reception was a great help for us in planning for our stay and arranging for the airport pick up service. I wouldn't recommend this hotel as a romantic getaway with your spouse, as it is not romantic at all. I would certainly recommend this hotel for all other sorts of stays in Rom. But all in all we were very very content with our stay at Aberdeen hotel: great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
