Reviews.Author: sarabrandy96
Reviews.Content: I spent five days at Aberdeen hotel, this is a great hotel, clean, people very friendly and helpfull. The lady at the front desk, Sabrina, she gave us all the information that we need to have a nice stay in Rome. The position is very good, walking distance to the main places to visit, and near public transportation. I will be back there for sure next future.

Reviews.Title: “Final stop of this year's trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lafrenij
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was the main reason we picked it. A short walk from the train station and close to metro station. The hotel was super clean and staff really helpful. Free internet is available (checking flights & emails was nice) and good food available near by... I know, it's Rome, food is everywhere! Nice breakfast included too.

Reviews.Title: “I love Hotel Aberdeen!”
Reviews.Author: Jan42354
Reviews.Content: I located Hotel Aberdeen through Rick Steves' travel book. He was right. Hotel Aberdeen is a wonderful place to stay in Rome! It has a great location--within walking distance to many major Rome attractions. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is very nice. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, and attractive--with air conditioning. And the cost is wonderful as well. Overall we were pleased with our stay and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was incredibly helpful, honest, and thoughtful.”
Reviews.Author: Judy944
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The staff at the desk were always helpful about answering questions about what to see and how to get around. They graciously made arrangements to get us to the airport for our departing flight. I had left a purchased item in my room, and they not only notified me that I had left it, they shipped it to me and they paid for the shipping. In this day and age, I thought that was pretty amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good, no fuss family hotel”
Reviews.Author: archeotraveler1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aberdeen in August of 2010; two adults and two children under 10. We had a nice, clean room that fit us all (one double bed, two singles), use of an elevator for our massive luggage, and a good continental breakfast each morning. The staff was helpful, friendly, and all spoke English. The "Rick Steves" rate, 135 euros a night, was as good or better than 3 star hotels in the neighborhood, and the location near Piazza della Repubblica was convenient, safe, and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful honeymoon experience”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelsavy
Reviews.Content: This hotel went above and beyond our expectations. I notified them that it was our honeymoon and waiting for us was a large bottle of chilled champaign with 2 glasses and a card expressing their well wishes for us! Next they gave us an early check in, a/c was on and the room was so ready for us. On the last day they let us have a late checkout of 4:00pm because our nite train did not leave until 7:00pm and they let us rest another hour in their sitting room at no charge. Breakfast was very nice in a gorgeous fresco'd ceiling room. They called Taxi's for us anytime we needed one and were always so pleasant. We will Stay there again. It was a nice start to our honeymoon. The staff was so friendly to us.

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: activitygirl1
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the Metro stop, the hotel was clean and pleasant. Staff was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: wowlookatthat
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Easy to walk to from train station, 2 minutes from metro, 10 minutes dragging suitcases from main Train station. Felt safe doing this even at 10.30 at night. Quiet safe street and area. Triple room. Free Internet. Great staff. 2 minutes from hop on off bus. Metro is cheap and easy but only has 2 stops that are useful for sightseeing, Vatican and colosseum.You need to walk to the rest. Bathroom had a window that opened which was good for drying washing. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Clean Spacious Friendly Accommodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I am a Hotelier in Melbourne Victoria Australia and travel to Rome in Italy annually for 2 week periods. Hotel Aberdeen offers the best value accommodation that I have found to date with the friendliest and most helpful staff. I agree with the great reviews of Lonely Planet and Rick Steves that accommodation at Hotel Aberdeen is head and shoulders above the rest. Oh! And it has free internet, it's close to Termini. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, The Parthenon etc and SAFE ... It's opposite some Army Barracks. GREAT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in great location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: severn26
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen for 9 nights in July. The hotel is located very close to the Metro and it is also very easy to walk to most of the popular tourist sites from the hotel. We felt the location was very safe. I had asked for a quiet room because we tend to get up late, and we had a very nice clean quiet room toward the back of the hotel at the end of a hall. We also were near an ice machine which was nice because it was very hot in Rome when we were there. The staff was very helpful in giving us advice and information. There was a transportation strike the Friday we were there and they told us how to manage traveling on that day. The hotel breakfast was nice with plenty of food to choose from. There was a safe and minibar in the room. Internet access and a computer where located in a small common room. The desk staff would let you use their computer to print out boarding passes when flying home. There are many places to grab something to eat nearby. The Snack Bar across from the hotel had good quick food to go when we were too tired from sightseeing all day to go out to a sit down restaurant. There was also a pizza place on the same road as the hotel which was not open in the evening, but was good for a quick lunch . When I go back to Rome, I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Juliepe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen in April and returned again in May and it was excellent both times. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms were good and spotlessly clean with everything we needed. The building is old but lovely and the hotel has a warm and interesting feel. Breakfast was very good and internet access was free. It's in a great position, quiet and we could walk to most places we wanted to see. There is a great place to eat over the road too; good food, friendly people and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Second Trip- Just as good”
Reviews.Author: trying2go
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this bed and breakfast. We were here last May. This trip we had taken the train from Venice to Rome. It was just a short walk from the train station. We were met with the same great smiles and readiness to serve. We were just staying for one nite and flying out the next day. The room was great !!! The breakfast was still outstanding. When in Rome I would not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingkellys
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Aberdeen in April and loved it. The staff was outstanding and very helpful, breakfast was very good with a nice selection of items, the room was pleasantly decorated and quiet, and from the convenient location we could walk or get transporation to any location in beautiful Rome. Another advantage was being able to walk to and from Termini Station. The friendly staff recommended wonderful nearby restaurants for dinner. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly. Richard and Piret

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for a home base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BarbaricYawp
Reviews.Content: My only regret was that this was the first stop on our trip, so we had to keep comparing everything else to the Aberdeen! It's nothing fancy, really -- marble floors, long echoing hallways, and the double rooms are two cot-type bedframes pushed together (as they were almost everywhere else we stayed). But the the place was very clean, the beds were very comfortable, the front desk people were friendly and helpful -- and, I have to say, the breakfast (included) was by far the tastiest and most complete out of our whole stay in Italy. The location is very convenient to transportation and sightseeing -- the subway is right around the corner, and Termini Station would be a very doable 10-minute walk with luggage (we had the hotel order us an airport pickup, but if we went again, we'd just take the train from the airport to Termini -- much cheaper! Just be ready to be brave trying to cross the busy streets with your luggage...).

Reviews.Title: “A good quality "Rick Steves" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomtravel23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aberdeen for two nights before a cruise. We were very pleased with the hotel. It is a very solid 3-star facility - nothing fancy, but has everything you need and very clean. It had some nice touches: marble floors throughout, good firm bed, updated bathrooms, and a nice breakfast included in the room price. I commented to my wife that it seemed to be a classic Rick Steves recommended hotel and then, later that morning, I saw a notice at the front desk for the Rick Steves tour group staying at the hotel, so it truly was a classic Rick Steves hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: pati822
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen has a great location. Near the Termini, Metro. The rooms were spotless, but lacked any great character. For the cost, we all agreed this hotel was wonderful.The staff went out of their way to assist us with all of our questions and needs. Their recommendations for dinner were great! They assisted us with luggage, printing boarding passes, etc. The breakfast was ok ( ask for expresso and they will make it for you). There is a good deli two doors away and a nice spot for a sandwich, expresso, or drink across the street. Our family enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: Linda57558
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aberdeen in Rome Italy and had a wonderful time. The rooms were simple, clean and comfortable. The staff was courtiest and helpful. We would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alebairesMilan
Reviews.Content: We are a couple from Argentina living in Milan for just one year so we decided to visit all Italy during week-ends. Last week we travelled to Rome and we had a suggestion from some friends of our concerning a good Hotel in Rome called Hotel Aberdeen. So we booked it through their website. It was very easy: we travelled with the FrecciaRossa the new train from Milan to Rome and we took a taxi to the Hotel, it is a short ride! The welcome was so warm, the staff was helpful and smiling. Wonderful fresh flowers on the desk. The room was new furnished and very clean. The bathroom spacious and well equipped. The breakfast in the morning was also very good but above all we felt in love with the ceiling in the breakfast room...really wonderful. The location is really confortable, we walked to all sites.It is really worth going to this delicious Hotel also for a short visit like ours. We recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Colleen61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights at the Aberdeen Hotel. We planned our "trip of a lifetime" to Italy, and Rome was our first stop. I contacted the staff ahead of time to advise them of our 20th anniversary plans. When we arrived, a chilled bottle of sparkling wine was waiting for us. They also arranged for a driver to pick us up and take us to the hotel from the airport. The friendly and efficient staff was one of the best parts of this trip. They made reservations for us at various places; advised us on bus/metro travel as well. Our room was small, but very clean and well decorated, with a spacious and modern bathroom. The only drawback for us was being on the street side, and it was very noisy, even with the window shut. So, if it is important to have a quiet room, ask for an inside room. Breakfast was great each morning: wonderful coffee and a good selection of pastries, cheese, meats, yoghurts, etc. Highly recommended! They made our wedding anniversary very special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gary126
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome the last 4 nights of our Italian vacation. Had chosen the Hotel Aberdeen due to positive Tripadvisor and Rick Steves reviews. We were not disappointed. The location was an easy 15 minute walk from Termini Station, and we got to partake of beautiful Plaza Republica along the way. Note that we are walkers, hence we found that all major historical, shopping, and restaurants were walkable for us.Perhaps not for everyone. We did partake of the user-friendly and clean Metro to visit the Vatican. We also used the bus system a few times, which was also easy, handy, and just 1Euro per trip. As had been promised, the staff at Aberdeen was extremely helpful and gracious at all times. Our room, while not qualifying as luxurious, was very clean and comfortable. The bath was excellent and stocked with toiletry amenities. Housekeeping did a great job as well. Breakfast was well served in a spotless and inviting inside dining room. We were well satisfied with the adequate offerings, and loved the strong Italian coffee. The only downside whatsoever to our stay was street noise, as Rome is a loud place. Personally, I prefer to accept the noise in exchange for our cool streetside window. Otherwise, you may wish to ask for an inside room. We feel the right hotel choice can play a big part in the overall enjoyment of the travel experience. We are glad we researched and chose Aberdeen. Our Rome visit was unforgettable, and Aberdeen did their very positive part. We found an excellent value and without hesitation highly recommend the Aberdeen Hotel. Gary & Maggie New Hampshire, USA .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nr5059
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel Aberdeen is very welcoming. The room was very nice and clean. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large, provided with a bathtube and very nice amenities. The position is outstanding, on walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and the Colosseum. I felt myself very safe becouse this hotel is in front the Ministry of Defence and close to the Quirinale Palace ( the Italian President House). In my opinion this hote is best in terms of location and value.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: hjackmyers
Reviews.Content: Great central location near the Termini. Walking distance (if you like to walk) to most sites and very convenient to public transportation. Sparkling clean room and bath with very comfortable bed. Some street noise in the front, but back room was quiet. Fabulous staff could not have been more helpful, both with booking and during our stay. Continental breakfast more than adequate. We will stay here again on our next trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: laneypie
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all our expectations. We stayed at Aberdeen Hotel at the end of our week-long visit to Italy, and it was the first hotel in which we had a bathtub - and boasted the most beautiful bathroom, as well. The staff was very helpful and coordinated our departure from the hotel to the airport flawlessly. The location was wonderful - right off Via Nazionale near the Termini Station. The hotel was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. The only drawback was that we had to carry our luggage up a flight of stairs and through a maze set of hallways to find our room. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen was a quiet, well maintained base for our 2 week stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: JMCGAC
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was close to the metro and major bus stops. Our room was basic, but clean, comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service from the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: mnicholsUsa
Reviews.Content: the staff accommodated us constantly with information on day trips, directions, food and destinations for entertainment. We would happily stay at this hotel on our next trip to Italy. The location was ideal for many of the main attractions and Termini is a five minute walk for transportation options. Alberto and Marciano were so very helpful and kind. Thank you for a wonderful time in Rome. We will be back. Bob & Melanie Nichols

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - Very Nice 3 Star!”
Reviews.Author: betsnow
Reviews.Content: First let me say that overall, the value for the price paid was exceptional. I would absolutely return to this hotel. The front desk staff is incredibly warm, attentive and helpful - that alone was appreciated. The room was very small (compared to the other two hotels we stayed at on this trip) but it was comfortable and relatively clean. We were in room 21 - so did not get a lot of noise, except at night when people came in and out of the big heavy door off of the street. Room 21's windows are right off of the little courtyard which was nice since for the most part you can have the windows open. It was spring break so lots of screaming and laughing teenagers running around having a good time. The breakfast was very nice and filling - this place DOES replenish (unlike other hotels) and insures that even if you come in 15 minutes before 10AM you will be able to eat. I would agree with some of the other reviewers that the breakfast gal is sort of grumpy and not overly friendly, but hey - I wasn't there to socialize with her so it in no way affected my opinion. They also have a computer for guests, and wi-fi - but you can only access the wi-fi from the library/lobby area. This hotel is VERY central. you can easily walk to the Termini and many restaurants. My husband and I found the walk from Piazza Novano and Trevi Fountain to be only 35 minutes or so. It was so central! and if you want a taste of america, you have a McDonalds literally next door. I would recommend to anyone wanting safety, comfort and traveling on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible, Noisy & in an Unsafe Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: tag324
Reviews.Content: How the Aberdeen Hotel could possibly get ANY positive reviews is truly unbelievable! The hotel is close to the train station which should tell anyone that it is in an unsafe neighborhood. The hotel is old and run down. There is not an elevator in the hotel. The room had a bowl of moldy/soft fruit that I threw in the garbage immediately. The TV is very small and outdated. The CNN station was going to be taken off the air/satellite and we were reminded of this every 30 minutes while trying to watch a program in English. The walls are incredibly paper thin to the point where we could here the people in the next room taking a shower, brushing their teeth and using the 1970's model hairdryer. I had to yell quiet and the people actually heard me say that! We also heard the pipes between the walls when the water would be turned on and off. The breakfast being prepared in the morning (6:30 am) with the carts rolling down the loud hallways made it absolutely impossible to sleep in. Glasses and plates being moved around in the breakfast room only made things worse. When the room next to ours was being cleaned, our toilet would make noises when the toilet next door was being plunged/cleaned. The hallways echo with people talking and you get to look forward to the trash being emptied at 2:30 am!! This along with the car alarms that go off in the middle of the night will only ensure that you will get zero sleep! For Rick Steves to actually recommend this hotel is insane (or he is)!! Our tour guide stated for us NOT to go out at night and to be very careful during day. Since we ended up being up from 2:30 am on, we booked another hotel for the remainder of our stay and have asked for a refund from the hotel. The only positive thing to stay about this hotel is the people who work there. They tried their best to take care of us, but nothing could have helped. We were told that we had the best room available (#50). PLEASE BE VERY CAUTIOUS IF YOU SHOULD REALLY WANT TO STAY THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cegar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel first as part of a group, then solo on my own. It's in an excellent location, near the Metro and with the golden arches at the entrance to the street it's on, you can't miss it; I used the Mickey D's sign as my reference point to the hotel street the rest of the trip. Also, it's only a 5-10 minute walk to Termini train station, so I'm not sure why some of the other reviewers chose to take a cab to the train station (unless they had a huge load of luggage or broke their foot which would make staying at this hotel disadvantageous indeed as there is no elevator). None of the members on my tour had problems getting their cabs to the airport, and one cab even stopped at this hotel and another down the road to pick up a friend without any issues. The front desk staff was friendly and the breakfast was decent. The breakfast attendant was perhaps a little bit grumpy, but she did her job and took coffee orders, so no complaints. When I needed to switch rooms, the staff was kind enough to move my luggage for me as my new room was not yet ready and handled with care my bag with my paper mache Venetian mask. They have storage for luggage in case you need to leave for a day trip and also a free internet station. Overall a good value for the price, beds are of course very firm and the bathrooms fairly small in the Italian style, but it was functional and clean. I was out exploring Rome for most of the day anyhow, so this hotel met all my needs. They also have TVs which is a bonus for some visitors. One note though, I'd request a room away from the kitchen area as it can get pretty loud in the morning if you're one that likes to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service; good value”
Reviews.Author: simpletravel10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen has amazing service. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast has a great selection of juices, pastries, meats & cheese, bread. The location offers a safe and quiet stay very close to all of the central attractions. Free internet access with a computer on premises was very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ALumbre
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our needs during our first visit to Rome! It's not to far from the terminal station and the bus and metro line are just down the block. This made it easy to come back and forth to the hotel with ease in between the daily sight-seeing for a little siesta. Safe area with the department of defense right across the street. We stayed in the deluxe room suite which were large and spacious and could sleep 3 people comfortably. The staff was great! They oriented us to the area and gave suggestions of what to see and do. We also saved a few extra euros on the continental breakfast that was offered daily. A decent spread of food that kept all of us full and helped save on time by not trying to figure out where to eat every morning. I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly, Caring hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: richardhk
Reviews.Content: Sabrina and her staff know how to run a hotel. We are veteran travelers and can rapidly tell if a hotel is run with a service oriented philosophy or is just out to get as much as they can from their guests. Hotel Aberdeen is definitely the former and we are delighted to advise other travelers of our very happy experience there .We needed some hand holding as this was our first visit to Rome.Sabrina was very kind in taking care of some special needs. A quiet, yet convenient location and a breakfast under a lovely frescoed ceiling made this stay complete. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Office staff very helpful and breakfast was delicious”
Reviews.Author: RochesterRick
Reviews.Content: The office staff was very helpful when we needed to sort out a problem with our Vatican Museum Tickets. The breakfast was simple but nice. The woman serving breakfast was very helpful and polite too. Overall we had a great stay at this hotel and would happily go there again. The only negative thing was that one night a large group stayed in the hotel with many teenagers. There was some noise between rooms and from the hall. The friendly and helpful staff make this hotel a welcoming place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Booked after seeing in Rick Steves. Good...”
Reviews.Author: Dgfvsxz
Reviews.Content: Booked after seeing in Rick Steves. Good location - walkable from central station, although just a block from Reppublica metro stop, which is one stop from the main train station. Kind desk staff. Of the two women who were working the breakfast room, the older was very nice and the younger was unsmiling and grunted at you if you said good morning. For the price, I'd say it's a great value considering the location and relatively overall cleanliness. The breakfast wasn't great, consisting of your usual continental fare. The quasi crossant like bread was not tasty at all but to each his own. One thing that was baffling was the note placed on some, not all, tables. It asked guests to speak in a hushed tone, which was fine by me, but it also asked to lift one's chair when getting up and sitting down because it made so much noise. If noise is such a concern, why not stick felt padding on the bottom of the chair legs? I did my best to lift my chair but given the tile floor it wasn't always possible to get up and down noiselessly.

Reviews.Title: “OK accomodations”
Reviews.Author: fell101
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd hotel we stayed at on our 2 week trip. For the price it was disapointing. Hard to find from the train station. Was noisy, bed was very uncomfortable. Staff was helpful and freindly. Free breakfast was welcome. The hotel was listed in Rick Steves Rome book. Would recommend if needed a place to stay for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Griffos4
Reviews.Content: An excellent value for money hotel, the location meant the metro and bus were a short walk and it was only 15 minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain. As a family with a 12 and 9 year old we were pleased with the size of the room as it easily accomodated the 4 of us, with reasonable storage space and a good size bathroom. The room was clean and reasonably furnished but without the windows open could be stuffy. My only complaint due to having the windows open was street chatter at night (we overlooked the street level on the 2nd floor) from some of the younger neighbouring tenants, so it wasn't the hotels fault. The breakfast is basic but is enough to get you going for the day. The desk staff were very helpful in providing restaurant recommendations, especially the Target and having access to the internet and guide books was very appreciated. I'm glad we also took advantage of the hotel arranging transport from the airport to the hotel, because you could easily walk past the hotel without even knowing. A tip for Rome be prepared to walk and Autumn seemed a great time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, affordable, convenient and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Buslover80
Reviews.Content: Rick Steves' knows what he's talking about! Great hotel at a great price. The location was central to everything we needed and/or wanted and made exploring very easy. The staff was helpful and friendly and had great senses of humor! We stayed for ten days, but felt at home the first night. Clean facility, excellent free breakfast, and wonderful experience. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: ancientcityjunkie
Reviews.Content: We booked the Aberdeen after reading Rick Steves' recommendation. It was a fabulous choice and not only would I stay there again, I highly suggest it to anyone planning a trip to Rome. Sabrina and the rest of the front desk staff made us feel at home immediately and did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. All parts of the hotel were neat and clean. Breakfast offererd a good range of selections. The location was perfect for traveler's wishing to shun public transportation and do the city on foot. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on all criteria”
Reviews.Author: FirenzeMom
Reviews.Content: My 20 year old son and I just wrapped 6 nights at Aberdeen. The staff was warm, helpful and low key. We enjoyed our location just 4 short blocks to metro at Piazza Republica and 6 blocks or so to Termini. Was very happy to be just far enough away from Termini for safety and quiet. Great dinner recommendation at Target on next street. Hotel is off inner courtyard behind plain wood door (closed at night), so would have been easy to miss if not for our shuttle driver. Room got very hot at night and couldn't regulate heat but we opened window on courtyard and solved it easily. Price was best I saw for better location than the 5-6 closer to Termini I checked. Would use this hotel again. Room was small as expected but clean and bathroom had small shower with plenty of hot water

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Aberdeen Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tripatlast
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aberdeen for 9 nights. The room was clean and quiet with all necessary amenities (shower/tub, hairdryer, safe, TV, etc). Hotel had good complimentary breakfast, very friendly and helpfpul staff (especially with our lost luggage!) and free internet. Would not hesitate to stay there again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round”
Reviews.Author: Princessgrumpy
Reviews.Content: Our room was large enough for 3 beds, the breakfast delicious and staff friendly and helpful. The location, close to metro, Termini, shops and supermarket was ideal. Try an espresso with panne from the bar across the road. Internet access was free and easy to use either on the computer provided or one's own computer/iPhone with wifi.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with our stay in the Aberdeen Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chasel2
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel, recommended by Rick Steves, is in a central location for walking to restaurants, cultural sights, and near to train and subway stations. Breakfast was available for several hours each morning. There was computer and internet access. In the office, boarding passes, etc. could be printed. The staff was most friendly, helpful and informative. They were always responsive to any requests. They reserved a musical event for us and an airport taxi was arranged for us for the early am. The room with bath was small but cosy, very clean and quiet, and included a security safe. It was perfect for our four night stay in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SEFloridian
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location and very friendly, efficient, helpful staff. We had an extended stay and found it very clean, attractive and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is a very convenient way to start the day. Although no Wi-Fi is provided in rooms, they provide an area with access to a computer or easy Wi-Fi connection via your personal laptop. Definitely recommend this hotel and we'll certainly be back ! Grace & Gary, Fort Lauderdale, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustWI
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen was a lovely local hotel, so much better than a "chain" hotel. Only a few blocks to the Piazza Republica (subway station here) and within walking distance to many attractions. Clean single room at a reasonable price. Free internet. Really large window in room that I could open for fresh air. Lovely hotel staff. A real winner!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ClaireSilverSpring
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully appointed with inlaid marble floors and a regal entry way. The bathroom was spacious, as was the room - even with a bed for our 24 year old daughter against the wall. Situated near Termini, and the Repubblica stop on the metro, and the local bus lines, it was an easy hop on/hop off to all city sights. Via Nationale nearby, is a bustling shopping mecca and provided distractions for a leisurely stroll, espressos, pizza, and leather goods. There is also a lovely little leather shop a block away where some items were handmade for their own leather line and the jewelry was also handcrafted. We thoroughly enjoyed this area of town and felt the local feel of the streets was a treat. The only downside is, we found everyone in the breakfast room speaking English. Hotel Aberdeen most definitely is a safe bet for anyone a little nervous about dealing with another language.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wlgolfer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aberdeen met our needs and provided excellent guest services. The staff was very helpful and very accomodating. Good location for seeing sites.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: htaylor107
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the Aberdeen in Rome. The hotel staff were very helpful with transportation and tours. Hotel is well located; convenient walking to major sights. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen is a true gem!”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeTn
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weeks stay at the Hotel Aberdeen with my 5 other family members. The reservation process to request 3 rooms went very smoothly. The entire english speaking staff were very accomadating and helpful throughout our stay. We had requested 3 rooms all with tubs and one room with separeted beds for my 80 year old mother and mother in law. The location was perfect for our stay. Very close to the metro and great places to eat. We felt very safe at this hotel as they were behind two securred doors and across from an Italian goverment building that was also very securred. Having a on-site breakfest every morning to get our day started was perfect. The assortment of fresh food and juices was great. They continously replenished everything. The front desk crew was the best. They printed directions for us, let me use their PC to print our airline boarding passes and let me break up the hotel bill in a variety of ways. They also provided on-site laundry service which we needed half way through our staff. I realize that we got an awesome price due to the time of year, but I would have paid double for this place. Even though we didn't spend much time in the room, we would have liked a few other english speaking tv stations other than CNN. The room was very quaint with a small fridge and freshly cleaned each day. Overall, this is a great place to stay and I would recomment it to anyone. There is no elevator, so request a room on the first floor if you have an elderly person traveling with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachNmargarita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located near to Termini as well as bus and Metro lines. Our twin bedded room (#39) was small but spotlessly clean. The English speaking front desk staff was most helpful and welcoming. Breakfast was served in a pleasant room and while the menu didn't vary it was a good start to the day. For the money this was a great place and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Glassgirl8550
Reviews.Content: Cute little hotel off the Via Nationale. We spent 4 nights in this very quiet and clean hotel. Adequate breakfast everyday. My husband would have liked to have a cup of coffee in the room, in the afternoon, that wasn't available. The staff arranged to have a pick-up at the airport, which we really appreciated after our overnight flight from JFK, 2 tours for us that we were happy with, and made an appointment at the Galleria Borghese for us. One thing they missed was to tell us to turn back our watches. the day we left. Turned out that we were at the train station an hour earlier than planned. Better than an hour late, I guess. But I could have used that extra hour of sleep. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very warm, hospitable hotel in convenient area of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: viajera923
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning, tired from our trip. We were immediately shown to the breakfast area for a free continental breakfast in a very comfortable breakfast room. The staff was welcoming and helpful. The restaurant recommendations were good, as were the instructions on how to get around the city on the bus. Our requests were handled with alacrity, and very pleasantly. The hotel is located on a quiet street, though it is close to the train station and many of the sights and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for Rome stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCoupleUSA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy and stayed in Aberdeen Hotel at beginning and end of trip, with visits to Florence and Volterra in between. Hotel is in an excellent location! Safe, convenient to sites, taxis, bus, etc. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and we hope to return on our next trip. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean facilities, very helpful and delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: GatorwomanFlorida
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aberdeen was recommended to us by friends who had stayed there several years ago. We had a group of 20 family and friends who needed three nights lodging in connection with a cruise we were taking out of Citiavecchia. In the months leading up to our visit, I was in email contact with both Sabrina and/or Mariano at the Hotel Aberdeen regarding the arrangements we needed and they were always so gracious and helpful and made things so much easier for our group overall. The rooms were very clean, the hotel was in a good central location, and every person connected with this hotel were just totally delightful. I would highly recommend it and would stay there again in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very nice place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: exuaer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. Our room was very comfortable and nice sized. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Their suggestions for eating in the area were on target. They saved us standing in a very long line at the Vatican to pick-up our tickets to a Papal Audience by letting us know you can also get tickets the evening before at the Santa Susanna Church two blocks from the Hotel. They served a pretty typical continental breakfast, Breads, Cereal, juice and coffe with a single selection of meat and cheese. Note: We stayed 8 days and the breakfast selections did not change. The Location was on a quiet street close to Republicca Plaza with very easy access to the Metro and Bus.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Convenient and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JaneRacine
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Aberdeen. Very easy to get around...close to the Metro and also Termini and city sights. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was OK...not the best we've had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent concierge support made our three-day stay a success”
Reviews.Author: aram70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near surface and underground transportation. Also it is within walking distance of many important sights. We had no skills in Italian but the superb front desk personnel helped us find excellent excursions where English is spoken and they recommended transportation for our sight-seeing. They also helped us find good local restaurants. Additionally, we are Tango dancers and the front desk helped us find safe dance venues. In our case that was crucial since not all locations in Rome are considered safe for visitors, especially those with limited Italian. The rooms were quiet, clean and the breakfast was substantial. Definitely a hotel to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkZeke
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Aberdeen. Friendly staff and great service. Went out of their way to make me feel welcome. Great location, near Termini. I was able to walk to and from the train station, which was convenieint for day trips to Florence and Pompei. Also close to the Republicca metro station, which was convenient for trips to the Vatican, Spanish Steps and Colosseum. Continental breakfast was basic (cereals, yogurt, pastries, coffee/tea/juices, etc.), but perfect for a quick bite before heading out. Room was small (full size bed, but a tight fit), but very clean. Plenty of hot water. Bottom line: clean, quiet, affordable, friendly, well-situated.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd Time - Will Keep Going Back”
Reviews.Author: bettyh
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Aberdeen in 3 years. Again, it was everything we expected and more. The hotel staff is exceptional, friendly, helpful and speak excellent English. They called taxis, made restaurant reservations, obtained Borghese Gallery tickets, took our bags to our rooms and generally went out of their way to assist us. Before I have been with my husband in a double room but this time it was 3 ladies that shared a room and there was amble room for all 3. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. Do note that there is an elevator but it is hard to find - so ask the desk. Also, there is free internet available. The breakfast is nice and in a very pretty room and comes with the price of the room. Don't miss the restaurant just around the corner called Target. We ate there 3 times on this last trip. Excellent food and outstanding service. Enjoy Rome - it is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Service”
Reviews.Author: 25YearsAbroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aberdeen, Rome for 3 days on our arrival in Italy for three months. The hotel offered to arrange a flat rate driver to pick us up from the airport which we were glad we took advantage of. The driver was waiting on our arrival with a sign. He didn't speak English but had the address on a bit of paper which he showed us and we nodded that it was correct. So off we went at dawn on a beautiful day into Rome and he took us right there and we didn't have to worry about haggling over price or trying to find the hotel which was good as my husband was sick when we arrived. The staff at this hotel are great and all spoke English and after exploring the city we felt it was one of the best locations we could have had. Central and on a quiet street across from the ministry of defence and just a block from Via Nazionale and tons of shops and restaurants and within walking distance to Termini Station. We loved it. Our room was tiny but spotless with big windows overlooking the quiet side street. It was a beautiful old heritage building. There was air-conditioning, shutters and modern sound reducing windows. The bathroom was spotless and beautifully tiled in lemon and white. The continental breakfast was very good yet simple. Great yoghurts, fresh pastries, and my only complaint would be that without any doubt at all it had the absolute worst tasting coffee I've ever had, consistently each day, which was the last thing I expected to complain about in Italy. But there are great places to get good coffees all around so don't despair. I found it amusing more than anything that coffee in Italy could be that bad. Our flight arrived at 7am and we went straight to the hotel and not only were they kind enough to let us check straight in to our room but they offered us to enjoy the free breakfast going on which we were not really entitled to until the next day. So that was much appreciated. There are many great side-streets off Via Nazionale where you can get eat like the locals. We walked straight down Nazionale to Dei Serpenti and turned left and at the end of the street you can see the Colosseum looming so we just walked there and enjoyed the street life along the way in very safe areas. The hotel had a lovely internet room to use and another little room off that to sit and read. As my husband could not shake his stomach bug and needed antibiotics we asked the hotel to recommend an english speaking doctor and they immediately arranged for him to see an American doctor who was referred by the consulate. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “No-frills, nice hotel room, stayed as part of Rick Steves tour”
Reviews.Author: Admiral_Zheng_He
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of a Rick Steves tour. The room is expectedly on the small side, being in Rome. The bed was comfortable, we had a room right next to the stairs so we could hear passersby, but that did not bother us too much. Air conditioning worked great to keep the heat down, as we were there in August. This hotel is not the most convenient location in terms of exploring the Roman Colosseum or the Roman Forum independently, but we were part of a tour group so this did not really negatively impact us. The hotel keeps the doors locked at night so that if you come back late, you have to be buzzed in for admittance back into the hotel, so the security is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: scootertoe
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Aberdeen for a 3 night stay and were warmly greeted by the gentelman on duty at the front desk. He advised us that our room would be ready in approximately 20 minutes (we were there 4 hours prior to check in time) and sure enough, in 20 minutes, the room was ready and our bags had been brought upstairs for us. The hotel exceeded all our expectations. The lovely decor, the cleanliness, the size of the room and bathroom and the helpful staff all made our stay one of the best of our trip to Italy. I would recommend this to everyone and would absolutely stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect, reasonably priced Rome hotel.”
Reviews.Author: msoz45
Reviews.Content: We were very, very happy with the Aberdeen. Clean, modern, quiet and well situated to metro and bus lines for easy access to all the sites, as well as the train station. The staff was extremely helpful – making dinner reservations, calling taxis – courteous and knowledgeable. The room was roomy and comfortable, the bathroom clean and modern. The breakfast spread was the biggest during our vacation in Italy. We will definitely stay there whenever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Grundsu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was part of a tour group (Rick Steves). I checked in a day early, and couldn't have had a nicer stay. The room I had was roomy, with a full-sized bed, private bathroom, and refrigerator. The room was also air conditioned which was very nice after spending a day in the heat. The bed was very comfortable and I slept great. They have a nice breakfast room, and offer a continental breakfast that included sliced ham and cheese, yogurt, several cereals and pastries, and juices. They have regular coffee in an urn but will gladly make a cappaccino for you. Housekeeping was more than adequate - my room was always spotless when I returned from a day of sightseeing. The location was perfect - just around the corner from Termini Station, walking distance to almost everything. There's a nice place for Gelato across the street, and an internet place around the corner. I'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the basics so pay less than we did.”
Reviews.Author: csgc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aberdeen for 5 nights in September 2009. This hotel was satisfactory and in a fine but slightly inconvenient location but at $260/night was way overpriced. We selected this hotel because Rick Steves suggested that the hotel and staff were personable which was not really the case. The desk staff was professional but did not greet people as they entered the hotel or try to be friendly or helpful. The breakfast room attendant was surly and had loud angry telephone conversations in the clean up kitchen. The Superior Double room was large but the extra space containing a love seat was separated from the rest of the room by a half wall so it wasn't particularly useable as a sitting area. The mattress was old and covered in plastic that crinkled as you moved. The breakfast food selections and toiletries in the bathroom were minimal. The internet was broken all 6 days of our stay. For tourists I would suggest a hotel closer to the Pantheon or Piazza Novena. This hotel was a 20 minute walk to most tourist sites but was convenient to the metro. This would be a perfectly acceptable budget hotel but was not presented as such and charged much more than that..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mvflores
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to transportation, you can walk to many tourist atracions. Service is great, it was our first time in Rome and the hotel personel made sure to provide us with all the information we needed to go around starting by a city map. Room was a good size, nice bathroom, confortable. If you travel with your loptop ask for room # 18, you can get free Wi-Fi in your room!!. The breakfast was ok, nothing fancy but enought. Overall a great experience we highly recomend this hote.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Service is what makes this hotel stand out”
Reviews.Author: emanc0209
Reviews.Content: My wife, two sons and another family traveled to Rome before leaving on a cruise on the new Celebrity Equinox. The rooms were clean and centrally located to get around either by foot or the subway system which is extremely convient-especially if you have limited time in Rome. Location is extremely important and the Hotel Aberdeen is in a perfect neighborhood. The staff at the hotel also is what makes this a place where my family would not hesitate to stay at in the future. When we requested informaion on great places to eat to the best way to get to the airport to time events opened and closed so we could evaluate what to do when-the staff was by far tremendously helpful and accomidating. Everyone make you feel like you are part of their family and they bend over backwards to make sure your stay in Rome is memorable. I would highly recommend Hotel Aberdeen for four main reasons: 1) A clean and comfortable room 2) The staff goes out of their way to make sure you are taken care of 3) Price-very reasonable 4) Location-very convient

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: bllynch
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my 19 year old daughter and everything about the Aberdeen was wonderful. Staff was exceptionally helpful, we were within walking distance to train station,bus and subway stations. Rooms were very clean and lovely. Breakfast was very good. A great find!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: eurolady28
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel....room was very clean and spacious.....we noted that some people that staying close to the breakfast room complained about early morning noise....this did not bother us since we like to get up early and get started on our day. We enjoyed the bountiful breakfast and appreciated the helpfulness of Mariano on the front desk. We walked almost everywhere from here, but the Metro is very close for those times we wante to head towards the Vatican area......there is also a grocery very close by and several nice places to get a coffee or gelato. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: blondetraveller99
Reviews.Content: I can not say how disappointed with this hotel we were. Having stayed at five different hotels across Italy during our trip this is the only one that we would not return to. Upon check in the receptionist was booking her summer holiday over the telephone and kept us waiting for over 20 minutes, without acknowledging our presence. When she finished her conversation she did not apologise or even greet us, instead shoved a form to sign and complete at us - no please or thank you's or even a smile. We headed up to our room and it was the tiniest room I've ever seen, most of our bathrooms were bigger in the other hotels. The bed was like a camp bed, really squeaky whenever you made the slightest movement which kept us awake. It also had no support slats / springs underneath. The room was extremely dusty and this did not change during our stay. We had to request soap and hand towels. The room was also next to the breakfast room so at 6.30am we were woken by the rather loud breakfast staff laying out breakfast and the consequent guests talking loudly on their way to / from an during breakfast. Don't dare ask for any more croissants, the breakfast staff are so rude and unhelpful and tend to shout at you if you ask for anything! The hotel is in a fairly good location, which was why we chose it - close to the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain and the train station / metro but the area is lacking in restaurants and nightlife if that's what your interested in. Rome is a brilliant place to visit with so much to see and do but don't stay here, it's at the very poor end of the 3* rating and you could get much more for your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not the fanciest of places but one of the best that you'll ever want to be”
Reviews.Author: iank14
Reviews.Content: I had had that the fear that since hotel would be so near to the central train station, it would have been in a seedy area, but it wasn't. In fact it it was opposite a government building in quite a nice area with small restaurants and shops at a point that made it easy to get many of the sight-seeing spots without having to a car or even use public transportation unless you really want to. The hotel itself is in a rather large building with a courtyard, but only occupies a part of it. The rest seems to taken up by other hotels and maybe private residences. The first thing that hits you as you enter your room is that it's a lot smaller than you expected but the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff soon throws any disappointments you may have. The rooms are clean and quiet and comfortable and there is a sense of security that you have even though you are in the middle of the city. Also, I never thought that I would have cared, but the free breakfast each morning was good and a blessing. After having it, it sort of fortified you and prepared you for the rest of the day. Plus it gave you an opportunity to meet with the other guests and share ideas and get valuable tips.

Reviews.Title: “Clean affordable + breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kingofp
Reviews.Content: This hotel,near the Rome Termini is clean, and affordable. The AM breakfast starts at 7 and includes cold cereal (4), meat, juices pasteries yogart, fruit, and cheese. The staff is responsive and an early arrival found out bags delivered to our room when we checked in later. We stayed 6 days (4 than 2). On our second arrival they made every effort to get us a room early. Both times they made an effort to get us a quiet room. I can only suggest they buy a cheep scale and put it in the reception to help the flying US crowd balance the suitcase load below 50 pounds a bag as an overweight bag is 190 euro. (8/09) Their wireless internet at their internet lounge was fast and effortless. The staff spoke very good English. They helped us team with another couple who were asking for another family to share van costs to the cruise port. They cared for their guests. There is a small minibar in the room which had enough room to put a water bottle and a coke. (rome was 97F) They mapped out bus connection stops for us to get to some out of city catacombs. Some rooms were small but thats life in the big city. Good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fabulous Staff!”
Reviews.Author: no1hockeymom
Reviews.Content: Where to start! I would have to agree with every positive comment I have read already on this site. Location is great, rates were very good, our quad room for a family of 4 with 2 teen boys was excellent. The breakfast was by far the best of all the hotels we stayed at. The lady who manages the breakfast room works so hard and keeps the tables cleared and everything topped up at all times. The internet was lovely to have especially after paying for it. Most of all we would have to compliment all of the staff including Sabrina, Mariano and Alberto and all others. My husband and I both work in hospitality and were so impressed with everyone we came in contact with. They were always so helpful and friendly - always smiling. Whether it was directions, restaurants or anything at all they always had great tips and advice given with a sincere smile. They accomodated us 1 night earlier than we had booked providing us 2 rooms at the price of one quad that night. They go out of their way to accomodate their guests at all times. Hotel Aberdeen was a highlight of our trip and we would recommend it to anyone for location, cleanliness, value, the breakfast but most of all for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for sight seeing in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SACALosAngeles
Reviews.Content: There are lots of hotel choices in Rome, and we did our homework successfully. The Aberdeen Hotel is very well located for site seeing in Rome. It is on a quiet street and is just a short walk from the metro and major bus lines which quickly get you to all of the major site seeing areas. We also just walked to some of the closer sites. The hotel is very clean and our room was fine. The desk staff is knowledgeable and very accommodating. Mariano sent several emails to us before the trip with information and advice to make our stay in Rome even more perfect! We talked with people who also liked their hotels, but had difficulty getting around. We were very happy with our choice and would gladly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen offers a great location, gracious and helpful staff and excellent value for your stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrojan
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 quads and a triple for our stay in Rome prior to a Mediterranean cruise. The location, as mentioned in previous reviews, is conveniently located so that the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, many ristorantes and pizzerias, shops etc are within walking distance. But if you prefer not to walk, then you can easily take the metro, which is 5 minutes away and costs 1 euro per person for any commute within an hour and a half. We took the metro to get to the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel, walked in to a ticket counter to reserve a spot for a guided tour, which started within 20 minutes. Doing the Museum first has the added benefit of being able to take a short cut to St. Peter's Basilica if you take the exit on the right hand side as you exit the SIstine Chapel... no long queues a second time around! ( The left exit takes you back to the Museum's entrance/ lobby/gift shop) We enjoyed the staff immensely - Thank you to Sabrina, Mariano and Alberto who were extremely helpful and accomodating in making recommendations for dinner (rather daunting as we were a fairly large group of 11), then calling to make the reservation for us. They also took care of airport pick-up and drop-off, and transportation to the cruise ship as well as picking us up. They kindly let us leave suitcases we did not need after the cruise was over, so we could continue our land tour of Italy for another week more "streamlined" and less encumbered since we were returning to stay the night before our flight back to the US. One other thing I'd like to note from a parent's point of view is that we are always conscious of how hotel staff react to a group that has 5 adults, 3 children and 3 young teenagers, and I commend the Hotel Aberdeen for their welcoming attitude, cheerful "Ciao!"s to the kids, patience with providing keys after getting locked out of our rooms,etc. Very family friendly if you happen to be traveling with kids. Having checked and initially contacted numerous hotels that had quads and triples, Hotel Aberdeen offered very good value. What can I say? Traveling in Europe is pricey, but staying at the Hotel Aberdeen took the sting out of the cost of meals and many gelatos that we so enjoyed and consider one of the most important aspects of traveling in any country. This is a Rick Steve's endorsed hotel, and his tour groups do stay here, so you know how HE feels about this place if he puts his name to it! Breakfast was filling and satisfying with varieties of pastries, cereals/ granolas and chilled yogurts (very nice after having our fill of room temperature yogurts throughout Italy) and fruits, and brewed coffee you could help yourself to. The staff however gladly served you a cappucino, latte, or expresso... whatever you wanted, they were happy to make it to order. The free internet was greatly appreciated by our group (especially my teenage son who was thrilled he could check his Facebook account each day). They have one computer for use, but if you have your laptop, or iphone, there is a password they give you so you can get wireless connection in one of two areas on the first floor. Although not luxurious, the guest rooms are clean, comfortably furnished, air-conditioned, towels and sheets changed each day. One wonderful addition that the management might want to consider would be a mini-fridge... it is VERY HOT in Rome in July and August, and we were constantly buying waters and other drinks at the small neighborhood markets. That is the only thing I can think of that would have made this stay a perfect "10", but all in all, our group was very happy with the Hotel Aberdeen and would without a doubt stay here again. Mille Grazie for your warm hospitality from your Californian friends...until our next visit to Roma!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean place and a good value”
Reviews.Author: susanm3320
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel for one night in June of 2009 before leaving on a cruise to Greece and Turkey. The hotel is clean and attractive, and the location is great; it's not too close to the most popular tourist spots, but within walking distance. The hotel management requests that guests keep their voices and their noise level low in the breakfast room. I'm sure it's great if you are trying to sleep in, but it does inhibit conversation with other tourists and gives the place a bit of a stodgy feel. Nonetheless, I'd stay there again in flash.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend it”
Reviews.Author: DublinSliotar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and enjoyed our time there.We have a family of 6,2 adults 3 teenagers and one 7 year old.We booked 2 adjacent rooms and although the rooms were on the small side they were clean.Staff were friendly and helpful.Location very central and close to Termini station and main attractions.Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Beccia
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very comfortable and even though we were overlooking via Firenze, it was quite. The staff especially Alberto at the front desk was quite helpful. The rooms were clean and had nice decor. I loved the shuttered windows and bidet. The breakfast was good but maybe a little more fruit and cold cuts. It was very close to Termini Station, you should definitely walk. The taxi drivers in front of the station want to charge you Euro 50,00 to go four blocks, beware!!! Don't be a fool and get ripped off big time! Pack light and use your map, it is 2 blocks from Piazza Repubblica which is directly in front of Rail Station Termini. I'm a travel agent and give Hotel Aberdeen a thumbs up (5) for the moderate and thrifty traveler that's not afraid to be more European. Why are you going, if you still need all the comforts of home and like to complain?

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: Traveler121709
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short 10-15 minute walk from the train station located near a great shop for pizza and calzones. The hotel staff is friendly, but the hotel lacks distinct personality and homeyness. The hotel is located right near the metro to zip you to the Vatican and the Colosseum, but it is tricky to find your way to Campo de Fiori and the ‘center’ of Rome. The rooms were small, provided air conditioning and the basics needed for your stay (and small European bathrooms). It is a fine hotel, with free internet and a basic European breakfast (rolls, jam, cereal, yogurt, coffee and juice). If don’t mind being out towards the train station, this hotel is clean, comfortable and is a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a convenient area of Rome-very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: gunvor
Reviews.Content: We reserved 3 rooms for our family trip this summer, and enjoyed our stay very much. Each room was unique, but comfortable. THe bathrooms were very clean and modern. Breakfast was delicious and ample. The nearest metro stop was about 2 blocks away, which was great as we used it to get everywhere. Several yummy gelato places nearby-the kids especially liked one on Via Napoli, I believe- and some nice restaurants nearby as well. WE loved our stay, and would definitely stay here again, if we ever get back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel refuge in desert of touristy hotels”
Reviews.Author: HMB2
Reviews.Content: Great staff and comfortable rooms. Once you were inside, the heat and bustle of Rome was closed out, giving you an opportunity to relax and savor the day. The breakfast was good and the rooms were clean and inviting. Another plus is the most comfortable mattresses I've ever encountered in Italy. We had a great stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: deuce1011
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. our room was large and clean. the staff was very helpful, and the hotel is close to the metro and bus stops. breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “great, friendly ,service oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParkerWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Very clean and friendly service oriented hotel. Easy walk to most popular tourist sights and very close to metro stop (Repubblica). Breakfast was typical of most in Italy but very adequate. Front desk personel extremely friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel. Free highspeed internet was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Bechaz
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at Hotel Aberdeen, June 2009. The people at the reception desk were the most friendly of the 4 hotels we stayed during our Italy vacation. They were excellent with English, friendly and provided good service. Fresh towels daily, free internet service and a good continental breakfast. Also we got a great price. I highly recommend Hotel Aberdeen.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen is a great value, at a great location, for a Rome vacation”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller24
Reviews.Content: My family of 4, including two grown children ages 20 and 18, spent many days at Hotel Aberdeen in June, 2009. The location is very convenient to the train station, sites, and subway to get to other sites. We had two adjoining rooms and were pleased with the size, the air conditioning, and the cleanliness. The service is first rate. All of the employees were very friendly and accommodating. They gave advice on restaurants, help with transportation or museum reservations and engaged in friendly conversation. I will certainly return to Hotel Aberdeen.

Reviews.Title: “Aberdeen Hotel is quiet and cosy for Rome”
Reviews.Author: amlee71
Reviews.Content: Rick Steeves recommends this hotel for the location and price, so I stayed one night there recently while in Rome. I was impressed with the staff and the room was neat and clean. This hotel is really quiet for Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ALLI48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen for 4 nights on the recommendation of Rick Steves. We wanted a quiet, friendly hotel located close to the train station. We were not disappointed. Our room was quiet and clean, the bed was good, the breakfasts were tasty and substantial. However, the best part of Hotel Aberdeen was the staff. Not only did they help us with transportation options and good local places to eat, but they were incredibly helpful following a bicycle accident when they shipped our bicycle containers to us in Berlin. We will stay at Hotel Aberdeen on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Free computer and internet”
Reviews.Author: AustinAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise to find a hotel that provides a computer for free in a lobby area. This is such a convenience on a trip. The staff here is helpful and the atmosphere of the hotel friendly in part because of the type of people who stay here. There are both a small refrigerator and a safe in the room. The location is great. This is a perfect place for a traveler who likes comfortable small European hotels which are centrally located and who does not expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - restful end of the day”
Reviews.Author: teacherdave
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast / breakfast room. Room clean and tidy. Staff attentive and helpful. Have already recommended to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Clean, safe, friendly. Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: chelru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aberdeen Hotel for 5 nights in June, 2009. The hotel is conveniently located to the public transportation: metro, bus, train station, shopping and restaurants; easy to find. My room was very nice; small, but there was enough space for one, and everything I needed. The bathroom seemed to be recently renovated; the air conditioner worked fine; I did not need it much; the room had a large window facing the quiet courtyard; I could keep the window open all night for fresh air. The breakfast was served from 7-10am; it was simple, but enough for starting the day. The personnel are very friendly, helpful, speak perfect English. I had very positive experience. I would like to congratulate Sabrina, Costel and others for doing a great job. Thank you. Elena K.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen is Efficient, Clean and the Staff is Courteous”
Reviews.Author: ItalianStallion54
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen in Rome. This hotel was recommended by Rick Steves. Hotel Aberdeen is located a few blocks from the train station in a relatively quiet street (as Rome goes). The hotel staff was courteous and friendly and went out of their way to make our experience enjoyable. The room was clean and air-conditioned. There was a lift available as well. The hotel is conveniently located to train / subway and bus. The cost of the room was approx $150 Euro, which is reasonable in Rome. My daughter and I both would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Clean and pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: jasonbostoncl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at Hotel Aberdeen and were pleasantly surpised with the hotel. The location was great, it was a short walk to the Termini station and within walking distances of the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain. The subway station (Republic) was just around the corner and this made it easy to travel to Vatican city and other places in Rome. The staff was helpful and gave us directions and recommendations for food. The breakfast is minimal, but it was just enough to get us going for the day. The room we had was clean and the bed was comfortable. We were on the lobby floor and didn't have any issues with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Value for Money and location”
Reviews.Author: hallmags
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for one night in Rome, before going to Perugia by train. I chose an hotel near the station. I was not expecting such a nice hotel. The only reason I gave 4 stars for the room is that it was rather small. It did not bother me, but might some people. I could not find the elevator to my room, but it was not a problem, my bag was carried up and down the stairs without me having to ask. The hotel is very nicely decorated - lots of marble. Breakfast was good. The staff very friendly (spoke good English) and helpful. The hotel was in a very good location for seeing the sites. I highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Clean hotel near the Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: ccoqui
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel for a total of 5 days. I found the hotel through the recommendation from Rick Steve's guides. My first impression as I went in was the cleanliness of the place, spotless! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had the small double French style rooms but it was just perfect for the two of us. The bed matress was not that comfortable but after a long day of sightseeing you really don't care. The bathroom was small but so clean that nothing else matters. The breakfast, included with the price, was a typical European breakfast but also included ham and cheese where you can make a mini sandwich also it had fruits, croissants, cereals, yogurts and the attendant will make you expresso at your request, excellent coffee! If we go back to Rome we will stay here gain.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen in Rome made us feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: JMats
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen in Rome was excellent overall. We will stay there again when we return to Rome, and would recommend it to others who want a good location (very near the Repubblica metro station), a clean room, silence at night, free 24-hour Internet access, and a very helpful staff. Mariano was particularly helpful in securing us a room in Milan. He also pointed us to a very good and nearby restaurant called Target.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quality and service!”
Reviews.Author: vacatioins
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen is in an excellent location for travel by train, bus, metro, and for seeing the sites in the area. The staff was efficient, friendly, extremely helpful, and able to communicate in English. Our room was typical European, yet had the charm and character one wants when in a foreign country; the front door entry is the first evidence you'll see. Our three night stay was wonderful--an excellent value and quality! We joined a tour group after being at the Aberdeen, and the four other hotels we stayed in with that tour were quoted as 4 star---if they were 4, the Aberdeen was a 6 star! We look forward to returning one day!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, convienent location, helpful staff, clean”
Reviews.Author: trhattan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an ideal location between the termini train station and Republica metro stop. It is very clean with a good selection of breakfast foods: cheeses, meat, yogart, cereal, pastries, fruit, beverages. Very helpful and knowledgeable English speaking staff. They were very helpful with taking messages from the airline regarding my lost suitcase. A computer for guest use as well as a modem for laptops. Rick Steves' tour groups stay at this hotel. Lots of nearby eateries including McDonalds on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get a room on the street side!”
Reviews.Author: MRSCNewYork
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at the Hotel Aberdeen were wonderful! The problem is that if you are in a room on the front side of the building, you will hear the heavy wood front door shut every time (all night long). You will also hear every conversation happening outside. Another downside was the breakfast was not very exciting. The first time there was not even water in the pitcher and no staff available to get more.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay at the Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: clayto3
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic central location just minutes from the Repubblica Metro Station. Many attractions within walking distance , this tidy little family run hotel is tucked away on Via Fienze between Via Nazionale and Via Settembre. The staff is very friendly, competent and willing to help out in any way possible to make your trip to the Eternal City memerable. A nice breakfast is included with the lodging. A Tobaconist Shop is just down the street and a Snack Bar and local Pizzeria are on the next block. Your sense of security is enhanced knowing that the HQ for the Italian Ministry of Defence is located across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, value”
Reviews.Author: pegmbakere
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Aberdeen was delightful: wonderful staff, location, attention. Our group of 8 people spent 2 nights upon arrival in Rome and another night prior to our departure home after 2 weeks in other Italian locales. The staff assisted with computer use, arranging for taxis, recommending restaurants. They couldn't have been more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bhxteacher
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at this hotel and had a great time. Its location was great. We were able to walk from and to the Roma Termini (train station) in about 10 minutes pulling our small suitcases. The nearest Metro stop (Republica) is just 5 minutes away. We were actually able to walk to some of the major sights - Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, and many more. Lots of eating places within minutes - including a McDonalds if you need a touch of home. The hotel is spotless. I have never seen a cleaner bathroom. The included breakfast was a very adequate buffet. No one should go away hungry. The hotel staff was very friendly and eager to answer any questions we had. When their free public computer there was down, they were happy to let us use the computer behind the front desk. Mentioning RIck Steves in our on-line reservation request got us a discounted room rate. (His tour company had a group arrive towards the end of our stay, and except for the welcome sign posted on the lobby desk, you would never know a group was there.) We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: LI_kayaker
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen and I highly recommend it. It is a small, family run hotel near Piazza Republica (Metro station and bus stop) and near the train station. What I like most about it is: the friendly, helpful staff who answer all questions, give directions and recommendations for restaurants, etc.; the great location which makes it easy to take the Metro or bus; the safe neighborhood; the clean rooms. They also have internet access and a computer for guests to use. Breakfast is a nice buffet of cheese, meat, cereal, danish, juice, coffee, fruit and yogurt. They also offer triple rooms which I needed on my second visit since I was traveling with my two adult children. Here is an example of what makes it special: when I arrived at the hotel on a Saturday afternoon last year, my friend and I mentioned to the man at the reception desk that we wanted to go to Mass at St. Peter's Basilica the next day (Sunday).
