He told us that if we went to Mass there that day, the Mass would be inside the Basilica with a small number of people and if we went the next day, the Mass would be outside with many hundreds of people. He called to confirm the time of the Mass on Saturday for us. We chose Saturday and had a memorable experience attending Mass with less than 60 people inside St. Peter's. We would not have had this experience if he hadn't told us about the mass on Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: TRIPPER60
Reviews.Content: The Hotel offered a really nice room with excellent cleaning. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great!!!! I would highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, seem to cater to English speaking tourists.”
Reviews.Author: vfg8407
Reviews.Content: A little hard to find, especially after just getting off an international flight and dragging our bags from the Termini station. As soon as we walked into the lobby we were warmly greeted and fortunately our room was ready (before noon). The room was comfortable with modern bathroom ( the only hotel with a bathtub of the 4 we stayed in Italy). A little street noise at night but earplugs did he trick. Breakfast was fine with cappuccino served at your table. The best part of our experience there was the good advice we received from the desk staff regarding directions and restaurants / bars that met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, fantastic staff and very, very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gone2Germany
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my parents and my children and this was a great place to stay. The staff was extremely helpful. Would recommend this hotel highly. If you wish to sleep in you should request a room away from the breakfast room. The staff arranged a van for trips to and from the airport and when the internet connection was being rerouted allowed us to use their computer! Truly amazingly accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful comfortable convenient hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Babaura
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen was recommended by the Rick Steves guidebooks and we were delighted with our stay. The front desk staff is very friendly and accomodating. The hotel has 34 rooms and is entirely tiled with marble flooring which was quite beautiful. The rooms had beds, desk, one chair TV with remote and private bath. There was a USB port, so I assume there was in room internet, but we didn't bring a laptop to try it. There was a computer area off the lobby which had a public computer and USB ports for laptops. When the public internet went down one day, the staff let me use the computer and internet at the front desk, which I thought was unbelievable. Breakfast is served from 7 am till 10 am and has juice, coffee, pastries, cereal,yogurt, ham and cheese. There is one staff member setting up food and clearing tables. They will make cappuccino for you as well. Perhaps the best thing about the hotel was proximity to Termini train station and the METRO. We took the Da Vinci express train from the airport to Termini and then walked to our hotel - less than 10 minutes. The Republicca METRO station is literally three blocks away. The main bus lines (40, 64, and H) pass 2 blocks from the hotel, but are often packed - if you walk a litle further to the Termini Station where the busses originate you will always get a seat on an empty bus which is what we did. A snack bar, alimentary , pizza store and McDonalds are within a block, There are good restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel, but for us the more memorable restaurants were in the older part of town near the Pantheon or in Traveste which are accessible by transit. It is definitely walkable to go to the Spanish stairs or Trevi fountain from the hotel and we did that a number of times, but it is a bit of a walk. We booked fairly far ahead of time and reserved a quad room for myself, my wife and 2 kids. When we booked the room I thought we got a very good price. For whatever reason, the quad was not available and they gave us two rooms at the price of the quad room we had reserved which I thought was great. We will definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kathleenkr
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler going to Rome for the first time, I spent hours and hours preparing for this trip. Not much time was needed, however, to select this hotel (recommended by a friend who stayed there on a Rick Steves tour, as well as the RS tour book)-- or to reserve and get confirmation for a room at a great rate, including breakfast in the breakfast room. The excellent booking service was but a prelude to the warmth and helpfulness of the staff throughout my stay. A central location made it so easy to get to all the near and farther out parts of Rome, including St. Peter's and the Borghese Gallery, using public transport. At the end of a long day of seeing the city sights, it was always a pleasure to return to the comfort, security, and loveliness of Hotel Aberdeen..

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in great location, and great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Trezdale
Reviews.Content: After an extensive online search for hotels in Rome one of the best deals I was getting was at the Aberdeen Hotel, so true to form i checked out tripadvisor to read previous reviews and was pleased to see such great feedback. On this basis I booked it straight away due to the cost. (Check the main travel comparison sites for prices, you can uncover some great bargains) Me and my girlfriend have just returned from a great trip in Rome and this is my experience of the Aberdeen Hotel:- LOCATION AND TRANSPORTATION LINKS:- Firstly I wanted a hotel in the centre of Rome so that most things were walkable or accessible by public transport, the Aberdeen Hotel is perfect for this as its around the corner from the nearest metro station (Reppublica) and about 5-10 minutes walk from the Termini station and main bus station. There are also bus stops down the road on Via Nazionale (the nearby main road). I didnt anticipate getting a bus when I was there however they are so easy to use and actually quite fun plus you get to see a lot of things en-route. (There is never nothing to see in Rome!). All public transport is dirt cheap aswell, check out the ticket options you have at the ticket machines or local vendors (its only €4 euros for a day pass which lets you travel on all metro, bus or tram services! €11 for 3 days or just €1 for a ticket valid for 75 minutes) THE HOTEL:- The hotel itself is very clean and bright, and as its family run its more of a touristic hotel rather than corporate which is good for young couples like us. You get the small family run feel as you walk through the front door. The staff are all very welcoming and friendly, for example when we checked in the receptionist gave us a map and circled areas of interest and also advised on how far they where if walking or what public transport to get to them, the map is excellent with extreme detail and any questions you have they can answer. The breakfast is adequate mainly comprising of cold meats and cheese, croissants, cereals, fruits, yogurts, tea, coffee and juices plus little additions here and there on different mornings. The hotel internet is free however they only have 1 PC so can be quite difficult to get on especially at busier times i.e. weekends. We had no problem until a group of young Americans turned up then you could never get on it due to their facebook obsessions!! however if your on business and have your own laptop then they do have a seperate ethernet cable for your own usage, to quash the problem of having to wait. The hotel is staffed 24 hours so returning late after a session is not a problem!! THE ROOMS:- Our room (33) was a reasonable size, the bathroom was very spacious and the bed was comfortable and plenty big enough. The room has your usual i.e. tv and wardrobe/chest of drawers, hangers, plus a free safe, a minibar, and window shutters to blank out light if you fancy a siesta in the day, but also great to control the amount of light let into your room if you like sleeping in total darkness. The floor is marble (Romans like marble!) and the decor is nice, quite homely making it easy to relax. It was cleaned and tidied daily and always very nice to come back to after a long day walking. There really wasnt anything to complain about but if i HAD to grumble about anything, it would probably be about some of the outside noise. I seem to get woken up by any slight noises so maybe im an exception, but now and again you can hear the odd motorbike grumble and sirens going off and late night session folks returning back but my conclusion was you are in a city centre so you have to expect it. The aircon is good so if you shut the windows fully you can blank it out well and it is not enough to keep you awake all night, I just found it a little more difficult to fall asleep then i normally would thats all, but if you are a better sleeper than me then you wont have a problem (aka my girlfriend who snores her head off after 5 minutes). The bed did comprise of 2 single beds stuck together, but you couldnt notice this really and im sure this isnt the case in all rooms. All in all a very pleasent hotel which i recommend highly, a must if you get a good rate. Some tips on Rome itself would be:- when visting the Colleseum do a tour of it, some also include the Roman Forum aswell. Its just you get told what you are looking along with the history of the place plus you get to skip queues!! it makes for an overall more memorable experience. Also do a tour of the Vatican i.e. St Peters Basillica and the Vatican museum/Sistine Chapel. Im not a great art lover but seriously it doesnt matter, this place will blow you away! but it you do an official tour with a guide, you will know what you are looking at and get the full history! it really is worth paying the little bit extra plus again...no queues!! (this is coming from the tightest bloke you will ever meet!). With regards to eating and drinking, DONT eat on the main Piazza's as the restaurants are not as good as the ones down the side streets and are overpriced, also restaurants that are busy with locals are always reliable, but venture down to Travestere around the streets of The Piazza Santa Maria as some of the best restaurants and bars are located in this area. Testaccio is also a good place to go drinking or clubbing. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: HMoo
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very helpful always friendly. Room small but warm and clean with all requirements. Breakfast had fruit juices, ham, cheese, cereals, croissants (very fresh and tasty) coffee etc. Trip: if you want nice coffee ask the waitress, she has machine out back and will make it for you. We walked from station to hotel and back no problem. Easy to walk from here to all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: jovannafeldman
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Aberdeen was wonderful. The accomodations were great- very clean, quiet, and nicely decorated/furnished. The staff at the hotel were excellent as well. They were extremely helpful with everything from obtaining stuff like the train schedule or how to get somewhere, there wasn't a questions they couldn't answer. The location of the hotel is very convenient and safe too.

Reviews.Title: “personal attention”
Reviews.Author: makana073
Reviews.Content: Saw the site listed in Rick Steves and so booked it and was very pleased with the location. It was about 10-15 minute walk from the main train station. We walked almost everywhere, to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Borghese Gallery. Maps provided with directions drawn for us. We were also able to print out our boarding passes. We were given a discount for showing our Rick Steves book. Enjoyed the use of the free internet. Quiet, spacious room, private. When we had to leave early to catch our train and didn't have time for breakfast, they quickly grabbed some croissants for us to take.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: TravelholicEngland
Reviews.Content: We decided to go away for a 5 day break to Rome and its always hard to know which hotel to pick when reading all these reviews. So I just wanted to share my experience with you all..... so it may help you decide. Firstly , what a great location hotel Aberdeen is . Its very near the metro Republica about 3mins walk. Bars, restaurants, clothes shops all in few minute walking distance from the hotel. You can walk to most of the attractions from the hotel also but seeing as the Metro is so close, cheap and very easy to use we used that everyday. The actual hotel was very impressive to look at. I liked the fact that it only has 35 rooms in the hotel so it had more of a personal feel to it. The staff were fantastic, so friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them. They recommened some excellent local restaurants for us to eat in. The actual rooms were lovely and large with nice paintings on the walls. The bathroom was big , with a very powerful hot shower. The rooms were very clean and lovely and warm for us in January! There was plenty of breakfast on the go, breads, cheese cereal, pastries, fruits etc. A good to start the day before sightseeing. Everyone has focused in these reviews on the breakfast room. The only thing I would say is that where it is located you have to walk past a couple of peoples rooms in the morning so it may be a bit noisier for those staying in them , but it you are getting up early for breakfast to go sightseeing then it wouldnt affect you at all. Bear in mind the main bulk of the rooms are on the complete opposite side of the hotel, so you could always ask for a room on the opposite side. Overall the hotel was excellent value for money and in a great location to go sightseeing in. I highly reccommend it so please do not overlook this beautiful little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aberdeen Hotel on our last leg of our European tour and we definitely saved the best till last! The rooms were immaculately clean and the location was so central. The service and staff were also exceptional. The breakfast provided included a wide range of foods which certainly helped you kick start your day. We highly recommend this hotel and will be definitely returning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: ElliedTexas
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel Aberdeen for 7 days as part of a Rick Steves tour. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and will definitely stay here when I return to Rome. I arranged a stay a day earlier than the tour and booked directly with the hotel via email. Mariano was wonderful and patiently answered all my questions prior to my arrival. I utilzed their airport pick-up and drop-off service which was about what a cab ride would have cost and it was money well spent for the peace of mind since I was traveling alone. LOCATION: As other reviewers have noted the location of the hotel couldn't be beat! The hotel is right around the corner from the metro and bus station. Places to eat were in short distance (next door, across the street, around the corner)! The Tabacco shop to get metro/bus tickets was a few doors down and the hotel is right off Nazionale - a MAJOR street with lots of eating options and shops. And.... the majority of the major sights are within walking distance if you don't want to take the bus/metro. STAFF: The location alone is reason to stay at Hotel Aberdeen but the hospitality of the hotel is why I would return. Sabrina and Mariano were the hotel receptionists the majority of the time and they were the best!! Be sure to ask them about dinner options! They have a variety of suggestions right in the neighborhood. The bedroom and breakfast room attendants were all very friendly and accommodating. ROOM: My first night I was in a single and then moved to a double when the tour started. I loved both rooms...very European! The single room was in the vicinity of the kitchen so as others have said it's a great wake up call if you need to be up at 5:30 am... but will be problematic if you were hoping to sleep in. The double room was located right across the hallway but was in an enclave so I barely heard the kitchen noise. BREAKFAST: I enjoyed the breakfasts: croissants, pastries, ham, rolls, cereals, fruit, granola, american coffee, juices, and cappuchinos! Italians customarily eat later than we do in the U.S. (arriving to dinner at 8pm or later) therefore breakfasts are lighter and lunch is heavier. MISC: -heated towel bars in bathrooms very nice! -Right around the corner is a late night internet cafe that sells international phone cards. 200 minutes for 5 euros!! Can use them to call the US from your hotel room with no additional charge! No need to mess with cell phones, SIM cards, etc. -a free computer/internet access in the hotel -at the end of the street is a mcdonalds if you need to grab a cup of american coffee after the breakfast room closes. OVERALL QUALITY: In the US I am a Sofitel, Westin, Hyatt, Omni hotel gal. But overseas I like to stay in local establishments. Hotel Aberdeen is a small, quaint, "inn" type hotel that had a wonderful local flavor to it. I definitely recommend this hotel if that's what you are looking for as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, and Central”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Librarian
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen on Via Firenze is a great place to stay in Rome because of its friendly staff, meticulous cleanliness, and location. It is just a couple of blocks away from the Termini train station. A metro stop and numerous bus lines on Via Nazionale make it convenient to any part of town. At the same time, we were able to sleep without city noises. The hotel provides access to two Internet connected computers. We also were provided with breakfast. There is a minibar in each room. Prices on minibar items are equal to the price charged by street vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: yamato8
Reviews.Content: Looking at the facade of the Aberdeen didn't strike us that it is a hotel. We were let off by the taxi in front of a building with two huge closed doors - sort of a fortress. We found a small panel on the right with the hotel's name on it. We used that to call the attention of the hotel staff to buzz us in. Hotel staff was pleasant and helped us carry our luggage using the stairs to the 1st floor. Going to our room was like going through a hallway maze. The room size is bigger than the other hotel we have stayed in in France but the interior furnishings are modest. They have an electronic safe which we appreciated very much. Some bathroom tile and tub caulking could use some regrouting. Our room is beside the kitchen and as others have pointed out it's quite noisy in the morning. We did not mind this as we made the noise as our alarm clock. Well it was also noisy on the street outside despite the double paned window. They have better selection for breakfast having cereal and fruits along with the usual ham, cheese, bread, etc. They also have a cappucino machine which us guests apprecited very much. They have Internet to check email and help find attractions to go to. Location is very good as it is close to a Metro station - Repubblica; and once you are on the Metro you can go to most attractions. Hotel staff helped us on directions along with tips on where to shop. Overall our stay was pleasant and we therefore recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: atraveler22
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen Hotel is a Rick Steves recommendation, which usually means that it is an efficient hotel (few bells and whistles) but is a reasonably priced hotel that is in a central location (and usually surrounded by a lot of local character). I found this to be true of the Aberdeen Hotel. What I loved about this hotel: -Location (in a great part of Rome, plus only 2 blocks away from a Metro (subway) stop) -Friendly and helpful service -Includes a free continental breakfast every morning (with delicious cappucinos) -Clean rooms -Shower head is adjustable up/down (tall travelers will appreciate this in Europe) -Free internet access in the hotel's small computer room The only things I disliked about this hotel: -The simple continental breakfast seemed bland and boring after a few days -Had to keep the windows closed at night due to outside noise (and slept with my earplugs in a couple nights) Overall, for the price and the location/convenience, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again. When I travel to a city like Rome, I want to spend the majority of my time out exploring the city, so I do not mind staying in a hotel without fancy linens or lighting, because I do not spend most of my time in the hotel! If you are the same way, then you will like the Aberdeen Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy setting”
Reviews.Author: CyclingGeo
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Aberdeen. The previous visit was good, despite a plumbing leak in the bathroom. This time the main problem was noise throughout the night. It was difficult to tell whether or not the noise was from outside or from within the hotel. I believe it was both. It was very hard to sleep. Otherwise, the staff is very helpful and the breakfast is good. Location is good, as the train station is nearby. Metro station is also very close.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: newmurphy
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 5 nights. It is a very nice hotel. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful--they all spoke perfect English and politely answered all our questions. The breakfast (which is included in the price of the room) is very adequate. You can have coffee, juice, cereal, fruit and/or pastries--plenty to get you started for the day. The location is great for public transportation. The Termini train station is just a 10-15 minute walk and you can catch the two main tourist bus lines #40 and #64 just two blocks away. If I ever visit Rome again, I will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome City Break”
Reviews.Author: elpresidenty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights - just back. There was very little that we could complain about while staying at the Aberdeen Front Desk Staff Very helpful and friendly Breakfast Adequate if a little basic by UK standards Rooms Clean and well furnished although rooms in general in Rome are small Location As good as anywhere for main attractions Overall I would certainly consider the Aberdeen if returning to Rome. Tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms would be a very welcome addition.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cpstets22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aberdeen as part of a Rick Steves tour and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. it is well located near the Termini Train station, buses and the metro and is within (long) walking distance of many of Rome's sites. Nearby is a variety of restaurants. We recommend the Giglio -- interesting menu, well-prepared food, clientele both Italian and tourists. Our room at the Aberdeen was the largest I've stayed in in Europe, clean and comfortable. The tv offered one English channel -- CNN Business. Even though the Via Firenze where the hotel is located is not a main street, our room overlooked the street and was somewhat noisy well into the night. The bathroom was of a good size, clean and well-appointed except for an antique hair dryer. The breakfast room was down a long labyrinth but the breakfast was fine -- nothing exceptional. Beware the dark colored cereal -- it's not whole wheat or bran; it's chocolate flavored corn flakes. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel offered free internet service, making a computer available to guests -- a nice perk. All in all, the Hotel Aberdeen is a great value. I would stay there again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: NYC_W0rld_Traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Rome that's close to the sights and public transportation, look no further! I stayed at Hotel Aberdeen as part of a Rick Steve's tour, and could not have been happier. The front desk staff are very helpful and are fluent in English. The hotel itself is just a block from Via Nazionale, one of the major roads in Rome. There are several bus stops right along that route, and the Republicca metro station is right around the corner at Piazza Republicca. If you like to shop there are a number of fun stores right on Via Nazionale, so you don't have to venture far for a bargain. There are also some fabulous restaurants and gelato places nearby. If you need laundry while you're there, just drop off your items at the front desk in the morning, and they will be washed and pressed for a reasonable fee by the time you return. The business center is really just one computer, but it was pretty accessible and there wasn't too much of a wait for it most days. The only word of warning I would give folks is that the cell reception inside the hotel is awful -- some said it was because of the Italian Ministry of Defense (equivalent to our Pentagon) across the street scramble cell signals for security reasons. But it's a small inconvenience to make calls before or after you leave the hotel, and one that's totally worth it. I can't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck.”
Reviews.Author: Uncle_Al_47
Reviews.Content: Nice budget hotel (well, budget for Rome). Best staff we've ever encountered in Europe. Desk staff is extremely nice and very helpful and they all speak English. Very nice, but snug, rooms. Clean, well maintained, simply couldn't find a reason to complain (well I hate yogurt, but that's another story).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LifesG8T
Reviews.Content: In September, 7 women friends and I had an opportunity to travel throughout Italy by train. While in Rome, we stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel within walking distance of the train station. I chose the hotel based on TA reviews and Rick Steve's guide book. We were not disappointed. Our group ranged in age from 53-68. We knew to travel light, one carry on suitcase and one day pack each. Walking to the hotel over cobblestone streets while pulling our suitcases was no problem. It took us about 10 minutes. Once at the hotel we were greeted by a very pleasant and knowledgeable gentleman at the front desk. He spoke beautiful English and he was very tolerant of my effort to communicate with him in Italian. We had an issue that he was very helpful in resolving. Arrangements had been made for us to attend the Wed morning audience with the Pope. The problem was that we were told to pick up the tickets after 2 pm on Tuesday. We had a private tour scheduled at that time. The gentleman arranged for a messager to pick up our tickets and deliver them to the front desk for us. The fee was nominal. Breakfast at the hotel was great. An abundance of assorted fresh fruit, meat, cheese, yogurts, cereals, etc. The internet was free so we were able to touch base with loved ones at home very conveniently. We stayed in 2 quad rooms and the rooms were large. Very comfortable. We requested extra pillows and got them right away. This hotel is well located, within walking distance of the historic sites. It helps that our group enjoys walking. Somehow, that balances out all the gelato! There was a Rick Steves tour staying there at the same time so we had fun talking with those people. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tadbit
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aberdeen was wonderful. It was spotlessly clean, in a fantastic location near the train station and the desk clerks couldn't have been more helpful. They all spoke wonderful English and they greatly contributed to our enjoyment of the city (which was fantastic too). I was able to make all the arrangements by email and they gave a special rate if you mention Rick Steve's name (travel author).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLolly
Reviews.Content: I am just back from my stay in Italy. I spent a week in Rome and I stayed at ABERDEEN HOTEL. The Hotel is great. The front desk excellent they gave me all information about the city, they made bookings for Colosseo, Vatican Museums, Galleria Borghese. The hotel is very clean, and the breakfast is great. The location is perfect, near the train station, subway station, bus stops, and also it is easy to get to the center. It was my birthday during my stay in ABERDEEN HOTEL. They left in my room a bottle of ITALIAN SPUMANTE to celebrate my birthday. I will suggest this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: catsmomAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen for a night after a long flight from Australia. Found the staff very welcoming, and the rooms clean and comfortable. The airconditioning did battle a little to cope with the very high temperatures, but we certainly managed to sleep, as it was very quiet at night. The hotel is so conveniently placed, an easy walk to Termini Station, and in fact so many places were within easy walking distance. There is a little coffee shop in Via Torino which makes the best coffee in Italy, and is part of an Enoteca which has the best selection of interesting liquor. We returned for a night before our flight back to Australia, and would not hesitate to book this hotel again, as it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Back To the Aberdeen? In a Heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: chartergirl
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the door, the Aberdeen Hotel was great! The twin room was spotless and quiet; its location (Republica Metro/ Via Nazionale/Termini) couldn't have been better. We especially appreciated the helpful men on the front desk staff...Alberto and ??? (sorry!) They went above and beyond with directions, recommendations, reassurance. We will definitely stay here when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anneandgerald
Reviews.Content: This is really a great hotel, terrific location...we were able to reach everythig walking. Helpful staff, they make us feel like home, they provided us whatever we asked and we had so many requests because we travelled with our 11 months baby. Above all we have to mention an incredible fresco on the roof of the breackfast room that made it unforgettable. Really impressing expecially considering this is a very convinient hotel. Anne and Gerald from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Big Deal”
Reviews.Author: vdelmona
Reviews.Content: In times where finding an hotel in Rome has become a stressful exercise, Hotel Aberdeen appears as the solution to pursue. Very conveniently located in town: straight in the center, very close to all major (few) city transporation means, out of the narrow and tourists busy streets of the deep historical center but still at a walking distance from it. Room and services: outstanding with reference to both. Price: a real deal for the town, expecially when compared with what you got. Loved the most: hospitality of the owner available to help you even with the minor of your possible issues.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: italygirlSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last night of our Italian trip (3 weeks) we wanted something near the center sights (Trevi, Pantheon) as we stayed near the Colisseum for the beginning of the trip (Hotel Lancelot - great hotel). The hotel is clean and adequate. The desk staff is helpful and the internet is free. They will let you print your boarding passes which is very convenient. The area is near the Ministry of Defense so there are a lot of sirens and police car activity. It is not a pretty or great neighborhood to stroll in but it is about 15 minutes to the Trevi. The breakfast was the worst we had on our trip and we ended up going out to a bar for capuccino and a pastry. The rooms near the breakfast room are noisy so request something far away from that end of the hotel. I would not stay here for more than a night before departing elsewhere. The hotel caters to the "Rick Steves" traveler so if this is what you are looking for then you will like the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: theyoungdenise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us, and we were so glad we stayed here. We were coming from a cruise ship and took the train into Rome. The hotel is very close to the Roma Termini (train station). The directions they gave us were perfect. They helped us with our luggage to our room (up a flight of marble stairs). Our room was spacious by European standards. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were a little flat. We had a nice sized bathroom with a tub and shower combination. Our room, and the hotel, was decorated very nicely. It was very clean. The continental breakfast was good with cereal, fruit, pastries, juices, tea and coffee. Espresso was available if you asked. The location was perfect. There were subway and bus stops within a few blocks. We walked to quite a few attractions easily (Pantheon, Spanish steps...) The ministry of defense is right across the street, so the neighborhood felt very safe. There were several snack shops and nice restaurants very close by. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Aberdeen Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emmasnana2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel both pre and post cruise. We chose it based on Rick Steves Guide Book as well as comments on this site. The accommodation was more than satisfactory and reasonably priced. The rooms, including the bathrooms, were very efficient, clean and well maintained. The staff was very professional, courteous, friendly and a pleasure to deal with. The breakfast provided was a great start to each day! The Repubblica metro station was a five minute walk away. Very convenient for our trip to the Vatican one day and the Colosseum another. We would not hesitate to return in future and definitely recommend Hotel Aberdeen to anyone requiring accommodation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up for the hotel aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: veruca01
Reviews.Content: I had the best experience while staying in Rome, at the Hotel Aberdeen. The registration staff were extremely helpful, knowledgeable andprofessional. When I requested a good restaurant in the neighborhood , the hotel staff recommended an amazing restaurant which had fantastic food. They were able to problem solve matters for me with ease. Rooms are clean, comfortable and cozy. Breakfast is ok. It would return again in a heartbeat, as the service was terrific.!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Adberdeen in Rome, an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: gctravelerCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the night before our return to the United States, based on Rick Steves's recommendation and its proximity to the Rome Termini train station. We found Steves' favorable thumbnail review to be accurate in all respects. A couple of "above and beyond" services marked our experience. First, we were given ample boxed breakfasts "to go" for our departure before the opening of the hotel's breakfast room. Second, the reception desk attendant on duty at night was most helpful in our effort to get our boarding passes online via the desk's computer/printer. We enthusiastically recommend Hotel Aberdeen for a reasonably priced ---150E/dble---, well located, clean, and warmly friendly hotel in Rome. S and B, Arcadia, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Bella1948
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. Great location. Close to the train station. Very clean and neat. Great hospitality. We surely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Aberdeen is Great!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelestravelor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aberdeen for five nights, went on to Venice, Florence, and then returned for an additional night before heading home to the States. The staff at the Aberdeen could not have done more to make us feel at home. After leaving the hotel for the other cities, returning there was indeed a rewarding experience. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy we chose the Hotel Aberdeen!”
Reviews.Author: MassLass
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen for 4 nights in April . We chose Hotel Aberdeen based on Rick Steve's Rome hotel selections and we were extremely happy, We booked well in advance via e-mail and received prompt and courteous replies to any and all questions. From the moment of our arrival to our departure, the staff , and especially Sabrina, was very friendly and helpful. Our room was smaller than some more expensive hotels might be, but certainly large enough for comfort. It was clean and quiet, as we had requested. The exterior of the hotel has wonderful wooden doors that are locked at night and provide added seclusion as well as security. An elevator is available to assist people with their luggage to upper floors. The continental breakfast offered many tasty and nutritious selections from rolls, meats, and cheeses to granola, yogurt, and fresh fruit as well as delicious cappucino, tea, and juices. We tried several near-by restaurants that were suggested by the staff and were very pleased with each one of them. The Via Firenze is a quiet side street just steps from the Via Nazionale where you can easily get buses, the metro, or walk to the Termini train station. The staff at the front desk was always very helpful in telling us which bus or metro stop was needed to reach a sightseeing desitination - complete with maps they provided. We also enjoyed visiting the Baths of Diocletian and Sta. Maria Dei Angeli church right in Piazza Repubblica. The day before we were leaving we put in a request for a taxi to Da Vinci airport and it arrived promptly at the requested time with a driver who was very honest and assisted us with our luggage. We were both extremely pleased with the Hotel Aberdeen, its location, and staff and we would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like at home!”
Reviews.Author: macdonald_jack44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aberdeen with my wife and two kids and must say that we had a fabulous time! As soon as we arrived we where greeted by a warm and wonderful lady who gave us all the necessary info and then directed us to our room. The room wasn't extremely huge (considering space problems in Europe) but it was just right for the four of us. It was spotless and equipped with all the main amenities like: private bath, minibar, digital safe, hair dryer..Buffet breakfast was served every morning and it was deliciouuusss..especially the good'ol nice Italian cappuccinos. The location was also great as it was only a 15 minute walk to the main sites. Being on a quiet internal street and right in front of the Ministery of Defence you could no be any safer.The whole hotel staff was genuenly friendly and more than helpful. We would defintely recommend it to everyone as we really felt like being at home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dlk33
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Rome and always felt like we were coming 'home'. The room was lovely--very attractively appointed with french doors to the outside, as was the entire hotel. Breakfasts were delicious, varied and generous (granola, yogurts, bakery, fresh fruits, etc.) along with the great cappucino. The concierges (plural) were all lovely and helpful. Sabrina in particular, took extra special care of us-as I was traveling with my 'elderly' mother. The only downside to this lovely hotel was the lack of 'sound' insulation between rooms. It was a bit noisy some nights. Otherwise a lovely and enjoyable hotel close to food and sites.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Reran
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter (26) and I spent 3 nights at this great little hotel before going to Florence. When we returned from Florence we stayed here the night before flying back home. I can't say enough about the service and the staff. Everyone was extremely helpful, with recommendations for restaurants, tours etc. The room on our first stay, though not overly spacious, was fine for the 3 of us. The bathroom was large and had a tub (Hooray). We were down the hall from the breakfast room but the noise that other reviewers complained about did not bother us. The sound of the cappucino machine was a pleasant wake-up call. The breakfast was fine and normal for Italian hotels. My wife and daughter loved the rolls. Suggest you ask for the cappucino instead of drinking the coffee. When we checked out to spend a few days in Florence I was able to leave one of my suitcases at he hotel. It was locked in a storage room and safe. Just another convenient service of the hotel. On our return we were given a very spacious room. I had a rental car this time and Silvia filled out the paperwork so I would not get fined for driving in a NTZ (no traffic zone). She then got directons for me to the nearest Avis so I could return the car. That last night my wife got food poisoning from a restaurant in Piazza Navona (not recommended by the hotel). She was pretty sick most of the night. Silvia directed me to a pharmacy and then cut a lemon from a tree in the back for a home remedy. Where else would you get this kind of help? I don't recommend that restaurant. Can't remember the name but when you enter the Piazza from the east (Pantheon) turn right and it will be the second restaurant. It starts with a "P". Food was overpriced and they tried to con you into leaving an extra tip by telling you the service charge on the bill was tax not gratuity. Most expensive meal we had on entire trip and the worst. IF you do want to eat at Piazza Navona then go to Tre Scalini on the west side. A little pricey too but good food and great view. The location of the hotel is convenient to most attractions. If your prefer a taxi the desk clerk will call one for you. It only takes 3 minutes to get a taxi. Being on the same street as the Ministry of Defense it is pretty safe. I plan to return to Italy again within a few years. When I do I will definitely try to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Staff, OK+ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepponde05
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen has good service and staff. They definitely aim for you to have a great stay. I went for my friend's birthday, and they even gave us a complementary bottle of chilled prosecco on the big day, which was greatly appreciated. The facilities are above average, newly remodeled and very clean (although not of the utmost quality...you get what you pay for!). The rooms were comfortable and had everything you would need--perfect for those who plan to spend their days exploring the city and just need a comfortable place to lie their heads at night. You can also find GREAT deals through their website; in early March I paid 90 euro per night (including weekend) for a large double room with two beds...a fantastic deal! One major negative for me was the lobby and computer area, which smelled very smoky all day and all night. Maybe that is the price you pay for non-smoking rooms in Rome these days (EVERYONE smokes EVERYWHERE), but with a covered courtyard, I think this could have been better. Speaking of the courtyard, that is one of the greatest charms of this otherwise average hotel. The outside and inside both let you know that this building has been around since the 1800s, although the rooms and hotel areas do not feel old or outdated. Although the staff as a whole offers a great experience, don't expect to get to know the people who work there as you might in other hotels. Whether day or night, the person at the front desk will probably change each day. The breakfast host was consistent during my stay, and he was courteous and helpful. On the whole, I would rate this as an average experience, lacking and stand-out features. However the price, safety (close to the Termini station, but across the street from the city's police guard headquarters), and location--3 minutes walking to the closest metro and no more than 20 to most major sights--make it a great deal for the non-fussy, or for those traveling on a budget . PS--If you plan on sleeping in, ask not to stay in rooms 44, 45, or 46. They are some of the larger rooms available, but they are located in close proximity to the breakfast room, and guarantee that you'll wake up to the sound of chairs scraping the floor and a cappuccino machine whirring away no later than 7:30 am!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: DinahLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen during a Rick Steves tour earlier this month. I was able to reserve a room for two days before the tour and a day afterwards. I can highly recommend the hotel. It is about a 15 min walk from the train station. We found the hotel very easily with their instructions. Both the metro and bus lines are nearby making it convenient to get around. It is also walking distance to many sights. A grocery store is walking distance as well. The hotel offers free internet service at two computers asking only that you sign out to use it. This was a very convenient service. The room itself was very comfortable. The staff was more than willing to answer any questions we had. They allowed us to leave our luggage on the day we checked out while we toured around for a few hours. The breakfast had a nice selection too.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Hotel Aberdeen!”
Reviews.Author: bootsGA
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights in Rome at the Hotel Aberdeen the beginning of March and we highly recommend it for anyone visiting the great city of Rome. The staff were warm and welcoming and very helpful. The Hotel is centrally located with most areas walkable in 20 to 30 minutes and of course it is a quick walk to the Terminal to make train connections. The hotel is located a short block off of via Nazionale, one of the main drags for buses, so it's easy to hop on one if you get a little tired of walking. We had a nice, double room that was very clean with ample space and bathroom. I loved that the room had a mini-bar, it's always a nice option if you forgot to get that bottle of water while you were out. The continental breakfast was perfect and we Ioved that they made you cappuccinos . The 3rd night we stayed was my girlfriend's birthday and when we returned to the room after our long day of site seeing at the Vatican and Saint Peter's, we were surprised with a bottle of chilled Prosecco and had a lovely toast to the special day and the great time we were having on our trip to Italy!" ! I wanted to take credit and she even kept asking, "you told them, didn't you?" and I kept having to tell her "I swear, I'd love to take the credit, but it was the hotel!" (They get that information from your passport when they enter your data upon check-in) That was very, sweet and thoughtful. When we return to Rome someday we will come back to Hotel Aberdeen.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at Hotel Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: JodyKellerman
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently travelled to Italy. We stayed at the Hotel Alberdeen in Rome for the last week of our trip. I highly recommed Hotel Aberdeen. Our room comfortably slept four. The breakfast provided was quite nice, and delicious cappuccino was available upon request. Sabrina, a member of the hotel's staff, went out of her way to be helpful. She booked soccer tickets, recommended restaurants, directed us to flea markets and reputable shopping areas, and arranged a car to take us to the airport. She was always very friendly, polite and willing to help. Molto bene! Jody Kellerman

Reviews.Title: “Bad sewer smell and noisy”
Reviews.Author: WhereRWeGoingNext
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy. We stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel the night before we headed home. I really wish I could give this hotel a better rating because the service was fantastic and the room looked really nice and appeared very clean. However, the room didn't smell clean. When we entered the room for the first time we were struck by an overwhelming sewer smell. So, we opened up a window and then left for an evening out. When we got back, the open window seemed to have done the trick because the smell was nearly gone. We closed the window when we went to bed. When we got up the next morning, the smell was back but this time even stronger. It was like waking up in a mens bathroom that had not been cleaned for a while. Gross!!! I almost gagged. I couldn't wait to get out of there. On top of the smell, the walls seemed paper thin. When we were in bed, we could hear every noise in the surrounding rooms. We were in room 18. Maybe the other people who gave much more flattering reviews stayed in better rooms. I would have asked to switch rooms if we were staying at the hotel longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Rob_and_Lynda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen from Thurs 7th Feb to Tues12th Feb 2008 on B&B. It`s tucked away in its shared courtyard. On arrival which was about 22.00 Thursday night and booked in the gentleman on reception was very helpful and sorted everything out. This was the same all through out our stay, always a cheerful welcome and spoke excellent English, the room was excellent cleaned each day to a high standard, the buffet breakfast was self service and sufficient with a selection of cereals fruit rolls pastry ham and cheese and as much coffee and juice as you wanted. The hotel is situated in the heart of historical Rome within walking distance to most tourist areas. Go on the hotel web site for more detailed information about the hotel. What we did was catch the metro to our furthest point, this costs 1 euro for 75mins and gives you more than enough time to get where you want to go then meander back taking in magnificent squares, churches, architecture many not even on the tourist map at almost every corner, stopping on the way for refreshments at the many bars and restaurants. The hotel Aberdeen is an excellent hotel from which to base your sightseeing of Rome. And I have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: minxgal
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen, Rome last September and when I arrived discovered that I had problems with my banking cards/mobile phone. The staff at the hotel were soooooo helpful in helping me resolve these problems by finding website addresses for me and accessing contact telephone numbers to enable me to contact the relevant organisations in order to resolve the issues I was experiencing. Location was excellent, a decent walk away from all the sites but if you're fit not a problem (Trevi Fountain 15 mins away). Good standard of room, slightly small but for all the time we were in the hotel. Just down the road from la plaza della republicca. I would definitely recommend it. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: harri57
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in August 2007. Hotel Aberdeen, its small / quaint and easy reach for everything. Book the 'Terravision' bus from the airport to the station in Rome and the hotel is approx. 10 min walk away from the hotel. You can walk past the hotel as its like a house but press the buzzer and you can get it.. Tip... if you get to the armed guard at the the top of the incline you've gone too far. !!!! You can walk to all the attractions from hotel but, get on one of the open top buses (cost about 10 euros) and it will take you round to all of them and you can hop on and off as much as you can. Tip... for us women, dont wear heels as there are loads of cobbled streets and your ruin your shoes !!!! The breakfast in the hotel is pretty basic but there are loads of bars/ restaurants within easy walking/ staggering distance.

Reviews.Title: “I Wanna Go Back....”
Reviews.Author: msgardendivine
Reviews.Content: My week stay at the Aberdeen was a delight. I was staying alone, but due to previous reviews, I upgraded to a Double room with a tub. My room was plenty large, as well as fastidiously clean. I had two French-doors that opened out onto a small balcony. The people at the front desk were always helpful. I needed taxi's called at least twice a day, and they were always pleased to call them for me. The taxi's never took longer than 3-5 minutes to arrive. The rooms were cleaned daily and were always spotless. The breakfasts were always well done, if not varied, with fresh pastries brought in each morning. The coffee was not to my liking, but all one has to do is ask the breakfast room waiter and he will bring you a fresh cappuccino or espresso, free of charge. One night I had a medical emergency, and needed advice for obtaining medical treatment from the front desk. He advised me to go to an emergency room, and called me a taxi and also provided the address for me. The next morning the kind lady at the front desk inquired as to how I was doing, as she had been informed of my problem by the night person. The only drawback I found was I felt the bed was very hard. However, after reading other reviews for other hotels in Rome, I guess this is a common condition... I loved this hotel, and would definitely would stay here again. A wonderful experience and a wonderful value !!! Hooray for Hotel Aberdeen !

Reviews.Title: “good spot for rome”
Reviews.Author: LIVETOTRAVEL8
Reviews.Content: Hotel aberdeen were good. they would phone to check on tours. they were a good central location. when booked tours that start early there is no breakfast ready. some times if all tours in am then wont need breakfast. you could get tea bags and couple of things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: julianneandbpb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Aberdeen for 5 nights last June, at the conclusion of a Greek Isles cruise. We were able to navigate from the port in Civitavecchia by train to Termini station and then on foot to the hotel. Not far but if you exit at any of the "mid-station" doors of the train station, the area is a bit seedy. (This can be solved by proceeding to the north end of the station and will put you near the Piazza Republica.) The hotel is easy to find and in a safe location being near several law-enforcement establishments. In addition, it is a reasonable walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, shopping and even the Forum and Colosseum. (After all, what better way to see historical Rome than to walk!) Our room was comfortable and clean and boasted a small fridge (with mini bar), a safe and a tub-shower. Anna Maria spoke english well and was helpful in contacting a tour group so we could see the Vatican Museum. We would stay at the Hotel Aberdeen again.

Reviews.Title: “LITTLE JEWEL”
Reviews.Author: VIOLETTA22
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for one month and don't regret one minute or money spent to stay here.This Hotel is definitely a Jewel of Rome.Location is very central,safe compared to some others,close to all facitlites-bars, shops, banks,restaurants,train station,bus and tourist attractions. Rooms are very clean,the staff is very helpful and go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible.Breakfast is served fresh everymorning,but for lunch and dinner it is up to you.All it takes is a two minute stroll down the street and the selection is enormous and reasonably priced,depending on your tastes,of course. A wonderful Hotel and Staff

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value for Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cloud9west
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel in Rick Steves’ book after leaving a horrible hotel up by the Spanish Steps. Because of the Steves’ book, we were given a Rick Steves’ rate which brought the rate to 96 Euros, which was excellent. We were given Room 50, which was a wonderful large double, with a balcony overlooking a kind of side courtyard. The room was well appointed, spotlessly clean with an impeccably clean bathroom. The breakfast bar in the morning was fresh and a very nice spread. The staff at the hotel could not have been more accommodating. They even stored our luggage safely for three nights while we went to Sorrento. Because we were a last minute booking, we had to move to two separate singles for our last night and each single was small, but the beds comfortable and again, bathrooms extremely clean. The location is terrific – about three blocks from the train station, close to all the bus lines and subway with a host of places to eat and grab waters, pieces of fruit, etc. The only hiccup was when we returned to the Aberdeen after visiting Sorrento and had been promised Room 50 again. Instead we were given Room 35, another double, but in the front on the street (where countless Vespas were parked and noisy). The room had obviously not been refurbished, and it smelled funny because, as we soon discovered, the ceiling in the bathroom was covered in mold. The hotel was sold out that night (we were late arrivals) and we were being picked up at 4 a.m. for the airport, so we had little choice but to take the room. It was, however, the only bad thing we have to say about this otherwise wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: erm621
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Rick Steve's tour and absolutely loved it. It was on a quiet street behind the Ministry of Defense, so completely safe, off the "tourist track" and still within walkable distance to city center. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. The internet connection was a little slow to use but still nice for checking in to let our families know we arrived. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ABStafford
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen was a good choice - a good value and very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. The location was convenient to the train and bus station. Breakfast featured a variety and the breakfast room has a wonderful painted ceiling. We were pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was considering our room overlooked the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Starbuck48
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Aberdeen, the staff was just wonderful and friendly. They helped us with a taxi, directions all over the city and recommended a Vatican tour that saved us many hours waiting in line. The insulation between the rooms is not great, but that seems to be the case at hotels in the old buildings. We had a very quiet room on a side street. The hotel was not very busy, but we found it quiet. The room size was very good, bathroom was fine and everything spotless. We would stay there again, due to the location and price alone. It was a short walk from Termini Station, and about a mile to the Coliseum.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merliemom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. It's centrally located within walking distance of the Termini Station. The rooms were very nice and incredibly clean. The staff at the hotel desk were very helpful. They recommended a restaurant which turned out to be very good. There were two computers available with free internet which was extremely helpful. The staff at the hotel desk called a taxi for us at six in the morning, and it arrived within five minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and if I'm ever in Rome again, I would make arrangements to stay here. Communication by email directly to the hotel worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: lpsmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location- a 5-10 minute walk to Termini train station. We enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very helpful, rooms were clean and nicely appointed and the breakfast was quite good. We did have Room #45 which is next to the breakfast room and it could get a bit loud in the mornings, but we were usually up by then so it didn't really bother us. I would have liked to have seen WiFi in this hotel, the computers they have for internet access were extremely slow. Overall, a nice place to stay and the owners were helpful with recommendations and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FulhamTom
Reviews.Content: Late review but we really liked it. It was hidden off the Via Nationale in Rome. Only a small sign on the outside of the building. Near to the Termini. The staff at the Hotel were really helpful and pleasant! We liked the room, although it was a little small and the shower cubicle was quite a tight fit for someone over 100 Kgs. There was free Internet. Breakfast was very good and plentiful. We would definitely recommend Hotel Aberdeen to others! By the way if you are going for a 3 day trip like us you can buy a Rome pass from the tourist office at the side of (I think) platform 24 (the end platform). This was quite cheap and gave you all your public transport for 3 days. It also gave you two free entries to 2 of a number of museums including the Coliseum - so you can avoid the huge queue and get into the smaller one for the Rome pass!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pavacati0ner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel based on Rick Steve's reviews. It was by far the nicest hotel we stayed at in the big cities in Europe. It was clean, quiet and above average for European standards. The breakfast in the am was good too. I'd highly recommend this place and it's in a great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Aberdeen Hotel. A little gem.”
Reviews.Author: Riverblue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew Ryan Air from Liverpool to Ciampino with no problems, once there I dithered on Taxi or Bus and chose the bus, 6 euros each and right to the Termini no problems at all and plenty of seats and a direct service, we walked from the Termini to the Aberdeen if you stay here mail the hotel for directions from Termini Station which is only 10 minutes away with your cases in tow, nowhere in Rome has big signs indicating shops, hotels etc so not a bad idea to get directions wherever you are staying. The Aberdeen is a great little hotel in a quiet street off one of Rome’s major roads, Via Nationale. Very safe place to stay with smallish rooms but space enough to move around comfortably, very clean and friendly not much more you can ask for in a capital city. They don’t have much of a communal area and no bar (they do have a fridge bar in the room though which is handy) so meeting other guests is confined to breakfast which is served between 7 and 10 am. Breakfast is typical continental fayre. We couldn’t keep the room on our last day as they are very busy and needed the room but, they do have a small lounge and a washroom which they are happy for you to use, bags are kept in a safe place for late departures from the hotel. The location is quite good, far enough away from the dodgy Termini Station (Make sure any stay in Rome is away from the Termini area) and in walking distance of all the sites or if you prefer, Via Nationale has buses and the Metro just 1 minute away from the hotel, take care on the busses, I read a lot of reviews before I went about security in Rome and theft etc. I must say they were a bit of a worry but to be honest all a bit over the top. Rome is a major European City and has the same problems as all major cities but Rome has more Police on the streets than any place I have ever been, incidentally the Aberdeen is opposite the police headquarters and in the same district as some other military and police buildings including Quinerale the Presidential palace so, sleep well. Just make sure you keep valuables and wallets out of site take extra care on the busses and crowds and you won’t have a problem, I tend to leave my wallet in the hotel safe (which was in the room and was free) and just take enough cash for the day in my pocket. Pick pockets tend to look for tell tale signs such as wallet shaped bulges so eliminate the risk. We didn't see any problems and I would encourage you to walk everywhere in Rome as you will stumble on more sights and will give you a feel for the city. After 5 days though you may need a new pair of feet. The streets and roads immediately around the Aberdeen are busy with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants but to be honest we didn't find a decent restaurant or bar in the area and found better restaurants on our next to last day near Piazza Navona (typical). Now Piazza Navona has a lot of restaurants too and they range from 15-20 Euros to 30-40 Euros per meal but they all seemed to be the same Tourist type foods i.e. not very appealing and even less appetising so my advice is by all means spend time in Piazza Navona have a drink and enjoy the atmosphere but stay away from the major roads and piazza's and eat just outside Piazza Navona in the quiet streets where you will find better food at reasonable cost. Rome is an expensive city; it was between 5 and 8 euros for a medium sized beer so definitely not a drinking destination, obviously we didn't get around all dining area's so it will be a bit of hit and miss if you are staying in another area but you will probably find the same applies in other area's and the better food will be served off the main tracks. Overall a great stay in Rome and the Aberdeen Hotel was a little gem. One other tip, Take a guided tour of the Vatican we did the Vatican twice, once on our own and again with a guide and I cant recommend the guided tours enough, you will miss all kinds without one, it cost 25 euros each plus the cost of the Vatican ticket 13 euros but best money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: gmim
Reviews.Content: August 23, 2007 gim Orlando, Florida We stayed for 3 days. The hotel was clean as far as breakfast goes, it was time save the calories for lunch. Will not stay there again because it was nothng special

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WandererSF17
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful week in Rome in April 2006 and stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel. The rooms are clean. The breakfast got us started each day. The tours they hooked us up with were great. In fact, we liked everything about it enough to book there again for our return to Rome for a cruise in August 2008. Several of the four other couples we were travelling with stayed there (and they all visited it) and all agreed it was a great value and very well located. (Some of these folks we were travelling with ended up in other hotels one one end of the cruise or the other due to the Aberdeen being full -- high season et al -- and all agreed the Aberdeen was the best value.) We arrived a day before our cruise and every single bit of our luggage was lost by the airlines. Sobrina at the front desk make our problem her problem and got on the phone trying to track it down. She worked on it while we went out to buy overnight things and a few changes of clothes. In the end, it turned out that the airlines had found the luggage and delivered it to another nearby hotel...something we would never have found out in time without Sobrina's help. She was truely amazing and because of her, a potential disaster became a wonderful vacation. It is people like her that develop true loyalty...neither we nor the friends we were traveling will consider any other property for future visits to Rome. The hotel is great...we stayed there three times, but Sobrina's help was way above and beyond what is normal from hotel staff...even the good ones.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrswhitey
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed at the Aberdeen for 3 nights at the beginning of July. All 3 were adults and we found we had ample room. The bathroom was an excellent size (full bath with shower over). We chose to walk to the hotel from the train station and found it quite easily by using the map in a guide book. The hotel was clean and all of the staff were friendly. My 16 year old daughter ejnoyed the internet facilities and this mean't we could sit outside the snack bar which was opposite the hotel and wind down from a hot and tiring day of sightseeing (with wine!!) The location of the hotel is perfect for reaching most attractions by foot, though we did return by taxi a couple of times and they usually cost about 10€. Overall we had a great time in Rome and would concider the Aberdeen if returning.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Zeegy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel located in the quiet historical section of Rome, which is approximately 30 minutes walk to many points of interest. The train station is approximately 10 minutes by taxi; the airport is approximately 40 minutes by taxi. Our room was spacious, nicely decorated and our bathroom was huge, with a full tub and shower combination. The hotel has a working elevator, good A/C system, and friendly staff in the 24 hour lobby. The free breakfast was better than expected; several cereal choices, rolls and croissants, yogurt, meats and cheeses, fruit and juices, and great coffee....including cappuccino upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Aberdeen a great base for exploring a great city”
Reviews.Author: ShoelessJeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aberdeen whilst exploring the eternal city and felt it was a great base for a variety of travelers. While I feel many reviewers of this hotel get a little carried away, there are some things that set Aberdeen apart from other Euro hotels. Read on for the GREAT, the GOOD, the BAD, and the UGLY. I will offer some 'bottom line' recommendations at the end also. Here goes . . . GREAT: # 1 - I encountered nothing but friendly and eager-to-help employees at Aberdeen. From 'hellos' to being eager to share Rome tips, the employees at Aberdeen make a big difference. I'm generally not used to encountering congenial employees in Euro hotels - I am used to having my [--] kissed in business class hotels here in the U.S., but it doesn't always seem 'sincere'. At Aberdeen, they WANT to help. Stop reading here and you've already discovered why so many guests of this hotel like it so much. # 2 - Location (part 1) - Aberdeen is nicely located minutes from Termini and major sites, but it sits on quiet Via Firenze - a side street that escapes the noise of Via Nationale. You'll have excellent access to buses, trains, and be a relative close walk to some major points of interest. GOOD # 1 - The in-house breakfast is nicer than other Euro hotels I've stayed in. You will be served by friendly employees that will help you get off to a good start. # 2 - It was helpful to me to be able to keep in touch w/ work on e-mail. They have a terminal or two whereby you can check e-mail at no charge in the lobby. BAD (or 'room for improvement') # 1 - The rooms are clean and nice but don't come expecting to be spoiled. If you're traveling with someone, you'd better not be opposed to getting thisclose. Luckily, I was with someone I love to get thisclose with. Like most Eurotels, expect a cramped bathroom and no frills - and you'll be fine. # 2 - Because of the nice marble floors in the rooms and hallways, expect a lot of 'background noise'. You'll hear other guests and clanging dishes from the dining room. # 3 - All of the guestrooms are on the second floor and there's no elevator. No big deal. I'm a jock and you expect a euro trip to be physical but, again, don't come looking for luxury. UGLY Nothing ugly to report. BOTTOM LINE / RECOMMENDATIONS: # 1 - The Aberdeen is a good choice as a 'tourist class' hotel. Calibrate your expectations accordingly and you'll be pleased - like most of us who have posted reviews here. # 2 - Unlike most, I DO not recommend the trendy little Target restaurant around the corner. The best Italian restauants feel very 'family owned'. Don't get me wrong, I did not dislike Target, I just feel you can do better by going more casual and less trendy (although the food in Rome was disappointing in general compared to other areas of Italy) # 3 - (important!!) If arriving by Termini - and chances are you are - DO NOT take a cab to this hotel!!! It is a seven minute walk thru an area that looks more dangerous than it is. I was quoted a rate of 40 euro at the station by a driver! I'm very happy I declined. In fact, on the way back I looked for that driver. Good thing for him I didn't see him again. You will be happy with Hotel Aberdeen and the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stanshaw
Reviews.Content: just returned from a great trip to Rome. Scoured the net and found this little gem of a hotel on Hotelopia. It had a great location, 5 mins walk from Trevi. very clean, pleasant staff, and adequate breakfasts. If you're after a decent meal at decent prices try the Target restaurant around the corner - buon food and service. all in all a fantastic first trip to the Eternal City ! would definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with a spartan room”
Reviews.Author: divingdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen for our final two nights of a 5 week trip to Italy. There are several pluses to the hotel including a most helpful and accomodating staff, a great location (walking distance to the Termini train station and around the corner from Piazza Republica) and a nice breakfast. The major down side was the quality of our room. Admittedly I booked late(only 4 weeks before arrival there) but the room was spartan, small, and near the stairs, hence noisy. At 130 Euro/nite the price was not bad for Rome but a somewhat better quality room would have resulted in a better rating. The hotel was one of Rick Steves' choices in the area and I wonder if a higher price or better quality room would make the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: edmontontravelers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after an exhaustive search of at least 100 hotels in downtown Rome. We were looking for a hotel in a central location; close to the train station but not a stones through either and in walking distance to all the main sights. We wanted a price range of 150-200 Euro. We read about this hotel in Rick Steve’s reviews and contacted them directly. They had their “French Room” available for a rate of 120 Euro. They told us that this was a very small room, and even sent us photos. The bedroom and bathroom were small – but we knew that before we got there, and who spends a lot of time in their room anyway. All of it was clean and very adequate. We found the staff very polite and helpful and the breakfast was typical European. Do not expect North American cuisine but expect European cuisine – fresh buns and spreads, Prosciutto, yogurt, Muesli, and cappuccino’s. If you have the right expectations, you will not be let down. If you want North American – stay at home! I would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves has low expectations”
Reviews.Author: poorbutliketotravel
Reviews.Content: The staff: very pleasant and helpful in all respects The room: overvalued (like all hotels in Europe), dirty bathroom tub, strange breakfast (avoid the cold cut "meat"). Great yogurt selection and all the Nutella you can eat. Strange "vitamin drink". Small....very, very small. The location: pleasant walk to metro station. "Snack Bar Gastronomica" across the street has "mini bar prices". Rick Steves, shame on you! At 160 Euro surely we can do better?

Reviews.Title: “Early wake-up call”
Reviews.Author: jillpharmd
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone saying that the hotel is in a great location because that probably is the best thing the hotel has going for it. We stayed there for 5 nights and we were put right next to the breakfast room. We were woken up every morning at about 6:45am from dishes banging and people talking. About 15 out of the 36 rooms at this hotel are affected by the loudness. I wish I would've read about this before I booked this hotel so I am writing this to make others aware.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Rome's Hotel Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: VAScooter
Reviews.Content: Right off the Via Nationale in Rome, tthe staff of the Hotel Aberdeen made our recent 12-day stay in Rome really enjoyable! Their help—especially when we ran into problems with our ATM card—was greatly appreciated. We loved the room, the free internet, the breakfast service, and especially the courteous staff always being ready to help at any time. We definitely recommend Hotel Aberdeen to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: stalban55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Aberdeen whilst in Rome for the Italy v Wales rugby (don't mention the result!) and had a great time. There were 8 of us in 4 seperate rooms and my wife and I had room 16 which was a double overlooking the entrance courtyard and was clean and quiet. The hotel is fantastically located being just 2 mins walk from the Metro at Republica and another 5 mins from Termini. We found the breakfast a bit basic compared to other hotels we have stayed at and found that there wasn't a lot of choice left after 9-9:30 so I'd advise getting in there a bit earlier. We also had breakfast at the George Byron cafe on the corner of Via Nazionale and the omlettes were delicious and good value. The snack bar opposite the hotel also does very good cheap coffees and is open until late at night. The staff are friendly and helpful telling you how to get to the sights easily and quickly and generally spoke good english. They really came into their own however when one of our party found that he'd lost his family's passports as we were leaving for the airport. We were at the airport trying to arrange something with BA when the receptionist from the Aberdeen rang his mobile saying that they'd found the passports in the room safe and had already sent them in a taxi to the airport. What fantatstic service this was and to top it all they didn't charge us for the taxi as they said the chambermaid should have checked the safe when the room was vacated! In summary this is very good, clean and comfortable hotel in a great location and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Long Overdue High Recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: BethAB
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Aberdeen in January 2007. The location can't be beat for convenience (easily walkable and easy to find from the Termini Stazione, very close to bus and metro, walking distance to Ancient Rome, and a lovely, friendly little shop across the street for bottled water, croissants, sandwiches, etc. which I miss already). All of the people who work at this hotel are warm, friendly and helpful. Our room was beautifully done, huge, airy and sparkling clean. We had a room facing the street and some may not like the hustle and bustle noise at times, but I loved it. It's off the main drag, but does get some traffic. It was unseasonably warm there in January and we opened the shutters and window to take in the sounds of Rome (along with a little fresh air). With the shutters and windows closed, much of the outside noise was blocked out, for those who prefer quiet. The included breakfast was very well done too.
