I can't recommend Hotel Aberdeen strongly enough. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Rome. This was my second stay in Rome and both times I have used Rick Steve's guidebook suggestions for hotel stays and restaurants. He has won me over as both hotel experiences have been excellent and we haven't gone wrong yet by following his restaurant suggestions either.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: flaguy
Reviews.Content: I chose the Aberdeen for my week in Rome based on the great reviews at TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed. The hotel is an easy walk with wheeled bag and backpack from the main train station. The hotel is on a quiet side street right across from the Ministry of Defense so always felt safe with the military around. Checkin was a breeze and the front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. I chose a standard double so I would have a little extra room for a week long stay. The room was a nice size with twin beds pushed togethet to form a king bed with night stands on each side. There was a desk with TV next to the bed and a large wardrobe with free electronic safe in the entry hall. The bathroom was a good size with a deep tub with handheld shower. My window overlooked the courtyard. There was no problem with noise even though it is an old building. Breakfast was served in a large room and included the usual cereals, breads, meats, cheeses, yogurt, juices, coffee, and tea. Two computers are available to check email and surf. The location is perfect for walking to all the sites. There are bus stops and a Metro stop nearby as well as Termini rail station. I would definitely stay at the Aberdeen again!

Reviews.Title: “good base for all”
Reviews.Author: jessica11
Reviews.Content: just come back from a fantastic trip to rome . The hotel Aberdeen was agreat base, just off the via nationazale ideal for shopping and sightseeing. The hotel rooms were clean, bathrooms clean and the staff couldnt do enough for you . I celebrated a birthday whilst i was there and they recommended a great restaurant to eat in the Target just round the corner. Breakfast was basic but the coffee was great. Found a great irish bar , the Scholars Lounge, just down from the victor emmanuelle monument - a great pint of Kilkenny. Another great bar was Trinity college. would recommend this hotel as a good base , for those that dont do stairs, (only one flight) there is no lift.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Accomodations for 3 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: Wander-Nan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels on a 10 day stay in Rome. First we stayed at a supposedly "4-Star" hotel. Then we stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen, which put the 4-star hotel (which will remain nameless) to shame. The room was 50% bigger, the bathroom was twice as large. The beds were great. Everything was impeccably clean. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful (unlike the other hotel). I've stayed at many 3 and 4 star hotels throughout Europe. This was a find! What a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Liverpool
Reviews.Content: After deciding to go to Rome about three days before we travelled, I wasnt left with much time to research hotels etc. After cramming a few hours worth of surfing trip advisor and similar sites, the Hotel Aberdeen came out as top of the bunch in my price range. Instead of posting my life story, I will round up how we found the hotel: Location - The street of the hotel - Via Firenze - connects with two main roads full of shops, cafes and even theatres - Via Settembre and Via Nazionale. These two main roads connect to a maze of interconnecting streets that will get you anywhere you want to go in under 30 minutes on foot. It is a safe, clean and friendly area and there are bus stops on Nazionale and Settembre. A good, if not totally perfect base from which to explore the city. Trevi fountain/Pantheon - 10 min walk Spanish steps - 10 min walk Colloseum - 10 min walk Vatican - 25 minute walk Hotel - The hotel is difficult to sport at first - its just a door with two or three intercoms and brass plates with the names of two or three hotels on it. Situated on a mini courner in half way up the road, just set back slightly in the main street. Hygien - Very clean, we only stayed for two days and the room was cleaned and towels changed during our stay. Services/features - Free internet use - they havce two computers you can use for free at any time - free electronic safe in the room, mini bar. Mini bar was VERY REASONABLE compared to English hotels and it was a huge relief when we got the bill. 9 euros for two mineral waters and two cans of lager - in England mini bar prices could have made it about £20. Noise - Our room was mostly quiet but as it was on the bottom floor and at the back of the hotel, it could get a bit niosy with vespas zooming past and cars beeping now and again. Not too bad on the whole and it didnt wake us up. Staff - Top notch staff who were very friendly and always approachable. All reception staff spoke great English and one actually was English, so it was easy to communicate. They gave us a free map of Rome and wrote on routes to the tourist sights etc, which they didnt have to do. Receptionist came in to show me how to use the safe - was very friendly and didnt make me feel like an imbecile for not working it our myself. Breakfast/food - We stayed on a B&B basis. Breakfast was fine - decent quality but not too much choice. There were three cereals, croissants, bread rolls, ham, cheese and yoghurts. Coffee, tea, OJ, pineapple juice and water were there too, along with milk. I've had a lot better but it was fine, a decent start to the day. Overall - I'd definately stay there again, good location, great staff, clean friendly and safe environment. It wasnt luxury but it wasnt hardship either. We payed about £60 between the two of us for the whole two nights weekend stay with breakfast which is extremely good for whet we got.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,Great Location,Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Diandebra
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen Hotel was even better than I thought it would be because it was so reasonably price. It was the cheapest price of all five hotels we stayed at in two and a half weeks in Italy. The hotel and staff get an Aplus rating in all respects. The staff,Anna Marie,and the others were extremely friendly, helpful, and accomodating. They made good suggestions for places to eat. Our room was spacious and well appointed and very clean with marble floors,lovely furnishings, and a very comfortable bed. The breakfast was delicious and had a good variety. The cappucino was yummy and to die for. The ceiling in the breakfast room was spectacular and I kept looking up at it. Thank you everyone for making our stay so very enjoyable. Arrividerci,Ciao!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: romavisitor
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay. The hotel was spotlessly clean. All staff on reception were extremely pleasant and helpful. Central location. Very close to Metro for trip to Vatican. All other main sights were within easy walking distance.Great value for money. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again - Definately Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Toronto__ON_Canada
Reviews.Content: A quality three star hotel being both clean and well kept. Run by a very nice and helpful staff who were welcoming from the moment you step in. They were helpful on numerous occasions. Since there are less than 40 rooms in the hotel we also found it very quiet. The hotel is conveniently located near the train station being less than a15 minute walk. The location felt very safe and had a nice little coffee store directly across the street. Having the breakfast included was a nice little bonus although you probably want to plan on eating somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: lgxtrip_boston
Reviews.Content: Location: Centrally located, near bus lines, subway, Termini station. Near the Ministry of Defence so absolutely safe! Staff: Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful Rooms: Small, has AC, can be noisy (as it is in an apt bldg) Bathroom: Tiny space, basic toiletries. It is true - the water gets sprayed everywhere. Also, the water pressure is terrible especially during "rush hour" AM and PM A very basic hotel in Rome. What it lacks for amenities - it makes up in location. If you are ok with the basics, can sleep through noise (ear plugs always help) - this could be perfect for you. I am not sure if i would stay here again. But I did not have a bad experience either. The only real annoyance personally was the water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aberdeen is a Winner!”
Reviews.Author: GMApopka
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Aberdeen multiple times. Each stay has been for approximately 1 week and we have been extremely pleased each time. The hotel is very quiet, clean, fresh and comfortable. While I must give credit to finding the hotel in Rick Steve's travel book for the 1st stay, each susequent stay has been because we were so pleased with the Aberdeen. Annamaria leads a very professional staff that goes out of their way to be as helpful and courteous as possible. In addition to Annamaria, Sabrina, Fabio and Stephan were very courteous, professional and helped us a lot. We are already planning our next trip to Rome and are looking foward to staying again at the Hotel Aberdeen.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: JandDfromIdaho
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine...except for our room was in a noisy area making it hard to sleep. Fabio's recommendations were useless. We should of stuck with our travel journals. J and D from Idaho

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adventuregirl64
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen is in a safe, quiet location and for the price, can't be beat. Staff, room, bathroom, a/c and breakfast were all great. Ten minute walk to the train station and only three blocks to the metro (subway), which made the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mastiffmark
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! we stayed 6 nights during the first week of October. very clean and a great breakfast including cheese and ham and made to order expresso. Safe neighborhood, close to bus stop, metro and train station a short walk away. Good places to eat in the neighborhood. clean room, marble bathrooms. staff was very friendly. will stay there next trip.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: SJSU_Spartan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay. There was a lot of places to eat around the area, was in walking distance of many of the main sites and was super close to the "metro" station. Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. Rooms are small and I still cant figure out why European showers have a "half door". You will get water all over the floor, so reserve a towel for the mop up. We stayed in room 45 which was right next door to the breakfast room. Avoid these rooms. Its very noisy with voices and hotel staff making a ton of noise with the dishes. There is a bit of a noise problem at the hotel as you can hear the goings on in other rooms and the hallways. We were pretty tired from the days sightseeing, so it didnt affect us too much, but something to note. Breakfast was ok with cereals, ham and cheese, yogurt and such. Its good enough to get you started. Coffee is terrible, ask for an espresso drink. Overall a real nice stay and the price was right. DP San Jose, CA

Reviews.Title: “Aberdeen Hotel is Fantastic (for the price)”
Reviews.Author: MilesDependent
Reviews.Content: By way of background almost all the hotels I stay at are 4 or 5 star properties. I have stayed in a few 2-3 star hotels, but have spent literally hundreds of nights in 4-5 star, and maybe only 20-30 in 3 star. Unfortunately in Rome my budget did not extend to 4-5 star, so I 'slummed it' in what I figured was the best 3 star option. Overall, I think the Aberdeen is exceptional value for money, with a great location and price. But there are some issues. Room: I was in a single room and can confirm that it was officially the smallest room I have ever seen. Just one single bed, a tiny closet, TV stand and about 5 square feet of spare floor space for bags. There was no where to store my bag so I just had it on the floor, soaking up about all the spare space. The room was well decorated and spotlessly clean. There was no view (except of a brick wall), but the rooms at the front of the hotel would have a nice view of Via Firenze. Overall, the room was barely comfortable. If you plan on spending any time in your room (e.g. watching TV or reading a book) you will be pretty miserable. Bathroom: The real low point was the bathroom. It was tiny (as expected) with a corner shower, toilet, bidet and sink. The big problem was the shower would spray water in all directions except where you want it to go. On top of that, it would make an extremely loud high-pitched noise which was painful to the ears. The end result is that you are in a shower that sprays water everywhere like on the walls and floor, and you have a headache from the high pitched deafening noise. Not impressed. Noise: This is my biggest problem with the Aberdeen. There must be almost no noise insulataion at this hotel. From my room I coul hear the goings-on in nearby rooms without any difficulty (including at night...). I could hear the footsteps and conversations from people walking up the hallway. I could hear the gate at the front of the hotel open and close throughout the night. I was kept awake until well past midnight each night due to the noise (guests arriving back at the hotel). I would be woken at around 6am from guests leaving the hotel early, or heading down to breakfast. I should point out that I am a very light sleeper. I chatted with others in the hotel who said they did not think the noise was a problem. But for me it was. I spent 6 nights there, and did not get more than 5 hours decent sleep on any one night. Staff: The big plus for the hotel is the staff who are FANTASTIC, and will do everything they can to help with your visit. They are so friendly, and really make the hotel. I cannot emphasise enough how great everyone at the front desk is. Breakfast: A basic breakfast is served each morning consisting of croissants, rolls, ham, cheese, cereal, yoghurt and juices. Coffee is available but if you are smart you will ask the attendant to make you a cappucino (which they will, but you have to ask). Entertainment: There are two internet terminals near the lobby which are very useful and free. It appears to be a high-speed connection. The TV in the room has like 60 channels but the only one in English is CNN. Location: The Abderdeen's location is excellent. There are heaps of shops and restaurants near-by and the area felt very safe. I walked everywhere I had to without much difficulty. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the Colloseum/Forum, and about 15mins to Piazza Venezzia. The other BIG benefit with the location is the Republica subway station is only about 500 feet from the hotel. The subway is a great way to get across Rome. There are also buses operating about 300 feet from the hotel. So overall, the location is great. BUT, to be honest, I would have preferred a location around Piazza Venezia, which I think is the true heart of the city. Conclusion: For the money I paid (about US$130/night) the Aberdeen was exceptional value for money - given the high cost of Rome's hotels. The staff and location are what make this a great place. The problem with the bathroom is no doubt limited to my specific room - and to be fair - I never complained about it. I am sure if I had, the staff would have fixed the problem ASAP. However, I would probably not stay at the Abderdeen again due to the noise problems. Also, I would probably rather spend a bit more money and stay at a 4 star hotel closer to Piazza Venezia, which would give me a larger room and better location. However, if you are not a light sleeper, the Aberdeen is exceptional value and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Best in Rome for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MarkLaurence
Reviews.Content: I have just finished a four day stay in Rome at the Aberdeen Hotel and having been to Rome four times previously this is the best place I have stayed by far. It is close to Stazione Termini, the main Rail Station and the rooms are very good for the price. I stayed in another hotel close by on the first night and it cost the same but the room, breakfast and location were terrible. Aberdeen is a very popular hotel and hard to book thatìs why I couldn't get the whole stay there. The guy on the desk is obviously an Italian Australian and he is fantasic. He is very friendly and helpful and makes sure you feel at home. He clearly understands the needs and issues of foreign travellers and is always incredibly understanding. The breakfast is very good and included in the price. The room is fantasic; spotlessly clean and air conditioned which is very important if you are coming in Summer (June-September). All in all I had a great stay. I travlled by myself so i think it is also very good for solo travellers as it is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: BHolt
Reviews.Content: As others have already commented, Hotel Aberdeen is a clean, well-located hotel in Rome. The office staff definitely tries to be helpful and they will patiently walk you through your Rome itinerary, pointing out how to best see the sites. They also had good restaurant recommendations. The Target restaurant was very delicious for a nice Italian meal (despite the connotations of the name "Target" -- it's not the place with the red bulls eye!!). They also have 2 free internet stations. Just an fyi: we were traveling with 2 children and we were very nervous about gypsies and pick-pockets in Rome, but, we found a huge police presence at all the tourist attractions, including the train stations, and we had absolutely no problem. Here are a few disappointments with the hotel: the quad room was small for 4 people (which we expected), the a/c fan was loud and blew constantly (without much cooling effect), the beds were hard and uncomfortable, and the breakfast was just ok (we had some wonderful hotel breakfasts included in other areas of Italy). BUT, if you are looking for a good location for walking to most of the sites, Aberdeen would be a good hotel choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “My family very happy with the Aberdeen Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissusM
Reviews.Content: Great, accessible location within easy walking distance to most and metro station otherwise. Surrounded by good restaurants (Lon Fun right up the street was a nice break from Italian), shops of all kind including groceries, etc. Terribly convenient, safe location and I had two children with me! The staff was very helpful and responsive. Rooms were not large, but quiet, attractive, and quite clean. Recommend it very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KiwiDa
Reviews.Content: The Aberdeen Hotel is well sited near the Termini station and 15 to 20 minutes walk from a number of the main tourist sites (eg Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steppes). Our room was very clean and tidy, with few frills, but good value in Rome. The Continental breakfast was a good start to the day, and all of the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful. The free internet access in the lounge was useful. For a comfortable, no frills, hotel the Aberdeen Hotel would seem to be hard to beat at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: znell
Reviews.Content: Geat hotel - friendly helpful staff and very clean. The room was small but still ample and the rooms were very clean. I arrived before checkin at 8am but they were able to find me a room within an hour or so. In the meantime they suggested I had breakfast. The breakfast is the usual European breakfast. Ask for coffee as the stuff in the pots is dreadful. Close to one of the main streets in Rome and within walking distance of all the sights. They have free internet use with two computers available. Great value for money in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Traveller Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: clfrngrl
Reviews.Content: It's not the Ritz, but it's perfect for the bargain traveller! Clean, modern (with hair dryer and safe), friendly front-desk man. Took the advice of trip advisor and Rick Steves and was extremely satisfied. Breakfast was more than adequate: coffee, juice, rolls, cereal, fruit, croissants, the basic euro continental. Next time I would request a room with a bathtub; my friends got one at no extra charge. Also, mention Rick Steve's name for a discount. I paid about $95 for a double in November. With that in mind, one note of caution: don't be fooled by some of the photos posted. Yes, the hotel appears to have a grand entrance, but it occupies just a portion of the building (there's also another hotel and apartments). So don't expect grandeur (ie. a luxurious Italian villa) at these reasonable prices. And this is Europe, don't expect American-sized rooms, everything is smaller here, except of course the charm!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a lot of searching to find a nice reasonable priced hotel, I found the Aberdeen Hotel. On arrival at the hotel we found that it was beautiful old building, excellently done up, clean and with a safe in you room. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, we arrived before checking in time and were told it would be about half an hour to wait which was fair enough, reception offered us use of the sitting room or suggested the local cafe for something to eat. We dedicded on something to eat and was not disappointed with the local cafe for a snack. The hotel is extremely central and the metro was a 5 minute walk away and the termini station 15 minutes although with 3 cases and 2 children it was 25 minute walk although we did go round the square the wrong way doh!!! We had heard so many stories about being ripped off with taxis that we decided to walk and it really is in easy walking distance of the termini. Reception provided maps and explained where everything was which was extremely helpful. We found that most places of interest were about a 20 minute walk away from the hotel although there were plenty of local buses and metros to use. Breakfast was a simple but nice - cereal, fresh juices, tea, coffee , rolls and crosissants. I have to say that there was a little bit of noise especially early in the morning although to be fair, the hotel is in Rome and you have to expect some city noise. We found that after a long day sightseeing, we were exhausted and any noise that woke us up , we fell back to sleep again quick smart. We will definetly use this hotel again on our next trip to Rome, it offers value for money especially with the expensive hotels in Rome, it is central , clean and staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “safe, convenient location, helpful staff, clean”
Reviews.Author: cvillecouple
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way above average for the price! We paid around 120 Euro/ night, which is very good for Rome. It was in a central location, close enough to walk directly from Termini station with big backpacks. This was a major plus after a long flight from the states. No need to worry over trains or busses, just walk about 10 min, and you can relax! When we arrived at 10:00 am, the front desk held our bags until our room was ready, around 11:00 am. It was wonderful being able to shed the bags and enjoy a stroll around Rome. Once we checked in, the friendly lady at the front desk gave us a map and circled all the major sites, complete with lines for the quickest walking paths. Then a friendly maid escorted us to our room. Friendliness scores MAJOR points in my book. The room was simple, but comfortable. Be prepared for the smallest showers a human can fit in (all over Italy)! I am a small woman, and I bruised my leg trying to shave. There is no room to move, but at least the Hotel Aberdeen showers are in a stall. We were worried about safety, but were happy to find that the hotel is in a quiet location with securely locked doors to the main building. Even when returning late at night, we felt safe, because there were so many policemen and guards nearby. Our only negative at Hotel Aberdeen was the misfortune of being placed in a room directly next door to the breakfast dining room. We were awoken at 6 am each morning by extremely loud clanking of glasses and dishes. It was so noisy that I had to use earplugs to get back to sleep after 6 am. We were only there for 3 nights, so it was fine, but we would have asked to be moved if it had been there any longer. You may want to request a room away from the kitchen when booking, but I would in no way let this keep me from staying at this lovely hotel. The free breakfast was simple, but good. They had cereal, breads, yogurt, plus juice and coffee. It was enough to get us started on our day of walking everywhere! Another bonus is the free Internet access. You can't go wrong with Hotel Aberdeen!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a group of five Irish women who stayed here for a few days in April. The eldest of the group was in her sixties and the youngest in her twenties. We found the hotel to be very centrally located and we walked everywhere. The staff at the front desk were especially helpful; they gave up maps and detailed directions, organised wake up calls, called taxis for us in the evenings when we were going further afield to check out certain restaurants and so on. The rooms all have safes in the wardrobes which the friendly girl who was looking after our room showed us how to use. The breakfast was basic but sufficient. In general the hotel was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. There is a little snack bar across the road which opens late where you can sit inside or outside and have a drink. You can also buy water and cigarettes here. This snack bar would appear to be a family run business, and a very well run place at that. We often met up here in the evenings before we went out. There's also a pharmacy nearby on Via Nationale should you have ant medical requirements. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT! Your search is over.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_Casey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in March 2006. We will stay with them again. The location is perfect. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and room/bath was large. The staff is friendly, helpful and professional. Breakfast is great. Price is a bargain. We felt very safe. The entire hotel is non-smoking. If you agonized over your choice, as I did, look no longer and call this hotel! :) Details: The location is perfect. 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. 15 min. to Pantheon. 15-20 min. to The Spanish Steps. Took a taxi to the Colliseum and Forum, but walked back without difficulty. Lots of taxis near by. 10-15 minute walk from Termini Train Station. Right off Via Nazionale, a popular street. Good shopping near by. Great restaurants within walking distance. 20 min taxi ride to The Vatican. Easy to navigate. We had a large room which was beautifully appointed. It was much, much nicer than any room we've stayed at in other parts of Europe. The private bathroom was large. Furnished with hardwood, marble and tile. The room was kept spotlessly clean. The bed is very comfortable (again, this is superior to other experiences). We did ask for a "quite" room. We had no problem with noise (other than being serinaded by our neighbor one night-but I just added that to "ambience") I can't say enough nice things about the staff. My e-mail, telephone, and in-person experiences were all superior. They are helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast is more than adequate: juices, coffee, corn flakes, yogert, croissants, hard rolls, and cheese and ham slices. If you want more (like an American pan cake house or all-you-can-eat buffet) please stay home and quit giving the rest of us American Travelers a bad reputation. Thank you. I priced many hotels and this one is not only reasonable, but I felt you get way more for your money with Hotel Aberdeen than many others I checked. I read mixed reviews (mostly positive) on TripAdvisor before we went and we DID feel safe at this hotel and location. I've never written a review before, but felt strongly enough (pleased with my experience) to take time to share it. Happy Traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: kittytraveltweets
Reviews.Content: We booked the Aberdeen based on Rick Steve's recommendation and the reviews on this site. The hotel is located on a quiet side street in a good safe neighborhood. The hotel has marble floors throughout including the rooms. We booked a double room and it was immaculate. However, typical for Europe, the room was so small that we were barely able to fit two 22 inch roll-on suitcases in the room. We actually had to use the desk to hold one of the suitcases. As a result, it felt somewhat cramped. The staff was really friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fine and good way to start your day. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon and about a 5 minute walk to the Termini train station. We didn't mind the walk and enjoyed seeing other parts of Rome. For the value, (I think we paid 100 euros/night) I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I felt at home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience while staying at Hotel aberdeen. The staff was very friedly and made us feel safe and comfotable. My friend and I stayed for a week while participating in RS tour. I would definitely stay there again next time I am in Rome. It was clean and near many of the public transportaion areas as well as walking distance from the sites. There are also many stores near by on Via Nazionale. They took good care of us at Aberdeen. My friend and I called the service desk to inform them that the shower head had a crack and would squirt water out of the side. The manager at the front desk told me that it was unnacceptable for it to be broken and that they would replace it at once.Not even two minutes after I called there was a knock on the door, it was a staff member that came up to change the shower head. We just wanted to let them know so they would be aware of it but they replaced it immediately. They are also extremely helpful with directions and very willing to answer any of our questions. It was my first time in Rome and their great service made the experience even better. It's definitely hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came here based in part upon the recommendations and special offer in Rick Steves book. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff were helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable. The location was great, making our way around Rome from here was very easy. The breakfast was better than where we stayed in other parts of Italy. We would stay here again or recommend it others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Christina78
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aberdeen is clean, quiet, and a great value near public transportation in Rome. The hotel was close to the Termini rail station, but felt very safe, even late at night. We were able to walk to the hotel from the station (although we found it quite hard to orient our selves correctly coming out of the station), and we were able to walk from the hotel to all of our destinations other than the Vatican (we used the subway too - at least until it closed at night). Our room was fairly large by European standards and felt clean and comfortable. The shower was kind of hard to get into and the hairdryer didn't work well, but otherwise the bathroom was just fine. The window latch was broken in our room, and the maid would open the window after she cleaned, so we made sure to lock valuables in the safe. I would definitely keep the Aberdeen in mind when visiting in Rome, although I may look to find something closer to the Spanish Steps area where there is much more to eat/do.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: mntraveler06
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Hotel Aberdeen in mid February. It was an extremely clean hotel in a perfect location! The gentlemen that worked at the front desk in the evening (wish we would have gotten his name) was great with recommending restaurants (must try Target Restaurant) and even our plans for the next day's outings. The hotel is in a very safe location. We had a double room (two twin beds that we pushed together) and it was a great size for two adults. We would definetely stay at this hotel again if we ever return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great Location”
Reviews.Author: srups
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Aberdeen Jan 29th - Feb 1st 2006 based on advice from Reviews from tripadvisor.This was our first trip to Rome and were pleased with our choice of Hotel.Rooms are small but adequate and were spotlessly clean.Breakfast was cornflakes, Juices,breads, cheese,ham,Tea/coffee.Hotel staff friendly and helpful.Got a good rate on internet 80 euro per room per night including breakfast (winter Special).Location was handy to visit all major attractions on foot 15mins to Trevi fountain, collosseum 15min,Vatican 40mins (taxi 8 euro).Train station and bus station 2 min walk away as was the underground.Used Rome shuttle Limos for Airport transfere (35euro).Booked angeltours for guide of vatican.Liz our guide was excellent and very informative and answered all our questions.Got offical tour of Collosseum (3.5euro).Overall Hotel Aberdeen great value and would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised - great value and location”
Reviews.Author: omahatraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aberdeen right before Christmas for 2 nights based on recommendations on this site and Rick Steves. Couldn't have been happier with the choice! The location close to Termini makes getting to/from the airport a snap (we took train in, had hotel book a cab for us out at fixed rate of 38 Euros). You can easily walk (15 minutes) to Col/Forum, Trevi, Pantheon, etc. If you're sightseeing, you're going to do a lot of walking in Rome anyway. Underrated is that the Metro is 2 blocks away to get you to St. Peter's. Staff was very courteous and helpful with any questions. Room was great, comfortable, quiet, had second floor with balcony. Agree that breakfast isn't fantastic, but more than enough to get your day started. Note that Rick Steves rate may be lower, we stayed for 91 Euros a night. Stay here, you'll be happy with the Aberdeen!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed for a week and received great service. Great advice on restaurants, sites and how to get to them. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - ask for a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here earlier this month for four nights. Upon arrival was told that I would have to change rooms after the first of four nights. No problem -- I'm flexible. This is a very nice, extremely clean and convenient hotel. The staff is very accomodating and keep a fine hotel. A couple of recommendations: please request a room on an upper floor. While there is no elevator, it's worth it. Both of my rooms were on the ground floor, where late night street noise was incredible! There is a garage in the rear of the building where men congregate at night, talking loudly and starting up cars -- I couldn't figure what was going on out there! All of the racket ended at about 2:00 a.m. Also, don't get too excited about the breakfast. It's served in a stuffy, windowless room far in the corner of the second floor. The menu never changes. So, if you're there for more than three days, you might want to make alternate breakfast plans - good luck. Otherwise - location, friendly staff, extreme cleanliness are all pluses here. Not to mention the reasonable tarriffs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: isnthisfun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aberdeen Hotel as part of a Rick Steves Tour group. I was very happy with our stay. The hotel's location was good: close to Termini, off of a few main streets (so easy to find), close to the metro and bus stops. The staff was very friendly, the place very clean, the breakfasts simple but yummy. My only issue was the water temperature of the shower which felt a bit schizophrenic. Other than that (and really, barely that) it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: BGorberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. The people at the desk were very nice and helped us a lot with reservations even before we came to Italy. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was great. We highly recommend to stay in this hotel if you happen to be in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay. The Hotel staff were very helpful, especially Alhandro, he was awesome. He helped us store our luggage when we went to Venice for a day. He also got us a good deal on our taxi to go to the airport. The rooms were clean and not to mention the hotel was in a great location. We will stay there next time we travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Aberdeen! Sabrina was working the front and she was so helpful and sweet. They had excellent tour information and restaurant recommendations. She booked our car to the airport coming and going. We had a 2 year old with us and let me tell you something....everybody at The Aberdeen loves children! We felt so welcome with a toddler. They gave us a crib to use at no charge. The hotel is in a terrific, quiet location and the hotel and rooms were spotless. I cannot say enough about our experience at The Aberdeen. The price was fabulous and so was the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Oasis”
Reviews.Author: augustwedding
Reviews.Content: After a long, very warm train trip from Sorrento to Naples to Rome, my new husband and I were greeted with such a wonderful welcome at the Aberdeen Hotel. The staff members treated us so warmly, helped us arrange our tour, and even had cold sparkling wine waiting for us with a sweet message for the last night of our Italian honeymoon. The room was cool, spacious, and very clean. The bathroom also was spacious and picture-perfect. Though we did not spend much time in the room because we tried to see a lot of Rome in a few hours, I would have liked to have spent more time there. I was a little nervous about the proximity to Termini, but the area was just fine. We will definitely come back to the Aberdeen when we come back to Rome. That can't come soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Hotel Aberdeen Aug. 12 - Aug. 15 2005. The rooms and hotel were so clean. Staff was wonderful. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: EFisch
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by Rick Steve's and was very clean, modern, and nice decorated. Family of 4 stayed in a quadruple room which was spacious and had an extra sitting area-small bathroom was very clean. Air conditioning was adequate, though not individually adjustable for the room. Hotel staff was very helpful. Continental breakfast was also very good. Convenient location, felt very safe. Hotel has an elevator, but you must first walk up a flight of steps to get to it. Recommended restaurant, Il Barracio was close-by, good, and reasonably priced. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelin
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed Hotel Aberdeen during our recent 3 day stay in Rome. Very clean and well appointed. Convenient location near Termini station, 2 blocks from the Republicca metro stop, walking distance to all the sights. Desk staff all spoke good English and were very helpful, including an immediate response to my initial email inquiry. Very reasonable prices. Good continental breakfast buffet. We had a family of 8 staying in two triples and one double. Also recommended by Rick Steves.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Expected”
Reviews.Author: Trvlwme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Aberdeen from June 5th - 8th of 2005. I was with a group of 18 people. We all enjoyed the hotel very much for location and cleanliness. The rooms are according to European standards, small. The bathroom was recently remodeled and very nice with just a shower. The air conditioning was good, but could have been better. Annamaria, at the front desk was very helpful to the group. Breakfast was continental but also very good. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody traveling to Rome. there is a very good restaurant about a block from the hotel, the Il Barroccio. Very good and reasonable for Rome. The hotel is close to a metro station and a bus line. I chose this hotel from the reviews in tripadvisor and was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the Aberdeen and found it to be a greal little hotel. It's across the street from the Italian Dept. of Defense and could not have been safer. The Staff was most helpful and if you are taking a taxi to airport, have the staff arrange, prompt and reasonable, sure beats the train for almost the same price for 2 or more.

Reviews.Title: “Home at the Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Aberdeen was a pleasant one. We (my mom, sister and I) had a triple that overlooked the hotel entrance. It was quiet and spacious for us. Breakfast was plentiful - but then again we don't each much in the morning (bread, yogurt, coffee, milk, juice). Where I think the Aberdeen did excel for us was their concierge and staff - they were extremely helpful and courteous. From the initial contact via e-mail with all hotels (with the Rome hotel search), during our stay, and holding onto our luggage after check-out -- they were fabulous! We didn't have time to utilize all of the hotel's in-house services (e.g., Internet) as we were busy sight-seeing. Ask for special rates, as sometimes they offer discounted rates during certain seasons or to Rick Steves's readers. Ciao e buon viaggio in Italia!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome and the Aberdeen Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just arrived home from a 5 day vacation in Rome. This was our second trip this year to Italy and both times I used Tripadvisor to find our hotels. The Aberdeen in Rome was lovely. Before we arrived I had corresponded with Annamaria on and off for 4 months. She was wonderful in changing, adjusting and helping us plan our week in Rome. The hotel was perfect for us. Our room was small but it was clean and quiet. There are larger rooms but I stressed the need for quiet. It was and we always had the windows open. The beds were comfortable and although I am a poor sleeper I slept very well in Rome. The entire staff was helpful and suggested wonderful restaurants, helped us find the sights and advised us to take a tour to Naples and Pompei instead of going on our own. It was a good decision and I would highly recommend it. In summary I would say that the Hotel Aberdeen was well located, safe, clean, quiet and made our stay in Rome very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bmarr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Italy. Spent 3 nights in one room and 1 night in another when returning to Rome. Our first room was very large and comfortable our second room was very small but ok for the night. The staff are helpful and very friendly. The location is excellent to walk evrywhere. Highly recommend for its value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with extremely helpful staff. Location was convenient to Termini train station and less than 10 Euro per cab ride anywhere. Very well maintained and very clean. The only recommendation for those that like to sleep late is to ask for a room away from the breakfast room. The wooden chairs on the marble floors and the normal conversation was quite loud for the half dozen or so rooms nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Aberdeen hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three-night stay at the Aberdeen and were very pleased with the hotel, its location to the train station and the most pleasant staff. Our room, however, was very small. The pictures on the website show larger rooms and we saw several larger rooms that were being cleaned when we passed through the halls. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The breakfast room was pleasant and the food was adequate although nothing special. We ate at a wonderful restaurant about a block away called IL Barroccio on Via della vigna vecchia that was packed with tourists and locals (a good sign). Since Rome was the last stop of our two-week trip we were pretty tired of walking and mostly took taxis from the hotel to the various sights. The taxis aways arrived within 3-5 minutes from the time the front desk called and we found the fares to most places were about 6-7E and 9E to the Vatican/St Peter's. I would hightly recommend the Aberdeen and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sas300m
Reviews.Content: Our room was a little small (for a triple) but absoutely spotless, beautiful sparkling clean bathroom with marble tiles. Water pressure excellent. Good location within walking distance of Termini train station and across from the Defense Ministry. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The day we arrived there was a demonstration or protest against the war and most of the streets were shutdown by the train station...and they had discontinued the the bus tours for the afternoon. Very disappointed we returned back to the hotel and Anna Maria immediately booked us another tour within minutes! We were picked up from the hotel and the tour was much better than we could have hoped for. I would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: Judy48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aberdeen in mid March, '05. From the minute we walked in and made contact with the staff, we had a very pleasant stay. We took the elevator to our second floor room. It's location is not obvious, but there is an elevator. All the floors are marble, in the halls, the breakfast room, as well as the sleeping rooms. The room & bathroom are small. Our bathroom had a small corner shower that would be difficult to enter if you are large. However, considering they are working with buildings that are hundreds of years old, I'd say they have done a fine job updating it. The breakfast room has a lovely painted ceiling. The breafast had a nice variety of food choices. As in probably all Rome hotels, the only English speaking TV channel was CNN which didn't have good reception. We appreciated the in room safe. Our room was quiet except for the occasional guest who didn't use courtesy while in the hall. The location was great. We took the faster, cheaper train from the airport to the Termini and walked a few blocks to the hotel (they'll give you directions). Most everything is a pleasant walk from the hotel with the bus stops and Metro close as well. Sabrina and a young man were very gracious to help with all our questions. The day we checked out, they stored our luggage 'till later in the afternoon, and offered us the use of a lovely marble bathroom to freshen up in before we finally left. We will stay there again when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: polly2us
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Aberdeen in January. The hotel is very clean, quiet, and excellent value-93euros in Jan. it has free internet service which is a bonus. The staff could not be any better. Any help on restaurants, directions, calling a cab,etc. is done immediately. The only thing that I should have requested was a room on the lst floor as I have a bad knee as there are steps to climb and no elevator. The location is in walking distance of most attractions except the Vatican. Also it is near the train station,but not in a bad neighborhood. I would recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, Clean and Economical!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Aberdeen September 14 through September 20, 2004. After a long journey from San Francisco, the owner was extremely friendly and spoke first in English then in Italian to show us to our room. All of the other staff were very friendly and helped us with any questions we had. They even offered us umbrellas when it was raining. I've been to many hotels and this hotel had probably one of the most friendly staff. The room was very clean and the bathroom had a bidet, towel warmer and looked freshly remodeled. I love taking baths and the tub was great also. The shower also had a removable head. The shower was strong and there was plenty of hot water. The buffet breakfast included cereal, yogurt, meats, croissants, bread, cheese, coffee, milk, OJ, and tea. This would hold us over the day so we only spent money on one meal a day. The hotel is in a great location by the train station so getting around is very easy. There is a great restaurant two blocks away called Il Barocco (45/48 Via Napoli) where we ate most nights and every dish was excellent. Another authentic Italian restaurant about 5 blocks away is Colline Emiliane (22 Via degli Avignonesi) I would highly recommend this hotel for it's price (we paid 125 Euros a night), for it's very friendly staff and because it is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A bit loud”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location and reasonable price, however, my room on the 1st floor was very noisy! Constantly heard the front gate slamming and guests coming in, etc. There are two other hotels on the same block that may be better: hotel Seiler and Hotel Oceania.
